name: J Campbells
text: WOW is the best way to describe our experience at this dealership. We were traveling in our 94 Chevy G30 camper van & started hearing the warning squeal from our front brakes. Upon entering the dealership, we were greeted by the owner himself who is so friendly & personable & we thoroughly enjoyed talking to him while the service staff inspected our brakes. Jamie, the service mgr, was so helpful & knowledgeable & ordered our brake pads & we returned the next morning when the service staff replaced the pads & we were out the door in no time. The charge for the work was very, very reasonable which was icing on the cake. We highly recommend this small town business that treats customers like family.

name: Kimberly Austin
text: The Best place to purchase a new vehicle for your bucks! Love them there

name: Pat Pleimann
text:
Not impressed!  I went in to look at trucks and was given the bums rush!!  Mark didn't seem to have time to be bothered.  I told him how much I wanted to spend and he said he only had one truck that would be ready the next morning at 9 am and it was above my price range.  I was dismissed and told to come back in the morning.  Just wondering how a dealership operates with only one truck to sell??
Not the Southern hospitality I expected.

name: Jamie Ball
text: Told a couple of people about my bad experience at a couple of other shops and a different dealership and they recommended Odem and boy they were right. Great service, knowledgeable staff with a passion for cars. They did an outstanding job on my truck and I couldn't been happier.  Great hometown dealership!!!

name: Queen Antoinette
text: Mr Mark Odom is very straight forward and honest. He took his time with me and explained everything to me that I needed to know to help me make a wise decision.  Thanks Mr Odom.

name: Madeline Sanders
text: i just bought my first car here and the customer service was amazing! we got to the car lot and at first i didn’t see anything i wanted. one of the guys who worked there came out and was very nice and outgoing. there was just one car i kinda liked in my price range and i test drove it and said yes to buying it. we did paper work and he worked really hard into letting us get it without any exceptions. he was very up front and honest about the car i was getting. he told me the service work that has been done recently and everything. the prices are very reasonable also!! you will not get played going here!!

name: Lennon Learning
text:
I consider myself to be a buyer that is hard to please. I have extremely high standards. I want an amazing product offered with exceptional service that comes with a reasonable price tag. My experience with Mitchell Allen Motor Company has been just that. I called Mitchell Allen and spoke with Jesse, the owner. He talked to me as if he were giving purchasing advice to a family member. Brandon, his son, was equally respectful. They were kind, courteous and patient throughout the whole process. They never once were annoyed when I would call with a million questions. Matter of fact, they asked me to call back if I had any more questions.

I must say that this is the first time that I have purchased a vehicle with absolutely no pressure to buy. It was the first time that I did not feel as if I got swindled in my purchase. Do you know how good it feels to know you are buying a quality vehicle and not be taken advantage of? It feels amazing. I have bought a few cars in my day, and I have never had such a smooth car buying experience as the experience I had with Mitchel Allen. If you are in the market for a car, I highly recommend that you go to Mitchell Allen Motor Company to purchase your vehicle. They are family owned business with integrity who stands behind the vehicles they sell.

name: MARCUS LENNON
text: Very pleased with our purchase of a 2013 Buick Enclave for my wife.  Very patient staff that went out of their way to accommodate my busy schedule.  Upfront, honest, and didn't pressure us into purchase.  Chick-fil-A type service at a dealership.   We will definitely give them a shot the next time we are in the market for a vehicle.  I would definitely recommend them to friends.

name: Linda Miller
text: I bought 2 cars in one week! Unbelievable! I'll go back!

We are located in Colorado, so Jesse FaceTime'd us, walked us through the entire car, and then gave us couple reputable trucking companies to get shipping quotes from. Thank you for the amazing service Jesse.

name: Anna Lowe Hicks
text: My Lexus was totaled, with limited options, G.B. Enterprises went above and beyond to make sure I left with an awesome, reliable vehicle. My husband traded in his truck, so we basically got a two for one deal with the trade in. We traded his 2012 Ford FX4 Crew Cab and left the lot with a 2012 Ford Explorer for our growing family, and my husband got a 2012 Nissan Maxima Sport to get better gas mileage for his commute to work. We now have no car payment on either vehicles. None could be possible without the help of the wonderful guys at G.B. Enterprises. We will continually recommend this place and will definitely be back. We are forever grateful for everything and still love the decision we made and the cars!

name: Rassan Tarabein
text:
THIS IS THE MOST DESPICABLE SCAMMERS I EVER SAW IN MY LIFE !
We bought new Buick Encore from Chris Meyer in 2018 (now Tamron Buick Daphne). Yesterday it didn’t start, and we had it towed a guy from Tamron Buick service department (named Shay) called and claimed that the issue was a dead battery ask him for an authorization to replace it for $165 plus tax. It was stunning to hear this as the battery was replaced just last month from O'Reilly auto, who kindly accepted to replace the battery. Shay called back upset asking to authorize $50 charge to “spray the brand-new battery with sealant” to prevent it from corrosion and breaking down again. miss Becky at O'Reilly auto called and told me that Shay was a liar as she tested the old battery (which Shay claimed to be broker and wanted to replace). Shay ended up charging the amount of the battery anyhow.
Shay seems to be trained to scam as his boss, Kyle shamelessly stood by the scam and endorsed it.

name: Queen Lewis
text: I took my car in today needingServiceI was denied service being that another dealer  putting a battery in my car so they Responded  IT  couldn't be looked at it even after me telling disclosing I purchased my car from there, so I'm stuck not knowing What's going on with my car not to mention its a hybrid. It's very hard to find someone to check it VERY RUDE AND UNPROFESSIONAL SERVICE MAN!!  No customer service whatsoever  I WILL DEFINITELY TELL MY FAMILY AND FRIENDS TO NOT DO BUSINESS THERE ...SIGNED A DISGUSTED customer

name: Margie Cochran
text:
It was the most rewarding car purchase we have ever experienced. Absolutely no pressure and the fastest car purchase also.  Antonio the finance manager was friendly made our signing was a great experience.  He explained everything you would have thought some had given you your car the experience was absolutely fantastic.  Our salesperson was the best
Alyssa Penne she never once pressured us.  Alyssa made sure we knew where the restrooms and their free cold water bottles was located.  The transition with Alyssa was very enjoyable.  Alyssa made you so comfortable you would thought she was your sister or best friend
Alyssa greeted us with a huge smile ( so genuine).  Alyssa is a hometown girl and after you meet her and leave a little piece of her heart , kindness, and warmth stays with your soul. We will tell everyone to go to. CHRIS MYERS in Daphne and ask for Alyssa and you will leave with the car you want with NO STRESS.  When you leave with your car it will hit you and you will tell yourself we got the car we wanted and did not leave CHRIS MYERS stressed BUT relaxed and you will tell yourself that was the best calming experience we have ever had. SO GO TO CHRIS MYERS AND ASK FOR ALYSSA and she will do the rest.  Oh yeah one more thing she loves her GRANDPA. Her heart and soul shines through at the thought of her GRANDPA.❤❤  Margie and Larry Cochran.  Head to CHRIS MYERS in Daphne see Alyssa.

text: I cannot thank Chris Myers Service department enough for their professionalism.  Kyle and Shay did an outstanding job!  I will always use the service department at Chris Myers Automall.

name: Elizabeth Anne Sclater
text:
I question the ethics of this company regarding their service department operations. Their web site lists a certain price for one of the routine maintenances ... only as I was dropping off my keys was I told that “oh, the web site is wrong, there are other things we do at that mileage ...” and the final bill was more than double what the web site indicates.

I have no reason to believe that the *quality* of the work is lacking, but that change-up between web price and final invoice leaves me terribly skeptical. At best it’s a lack of attention to honest detail in their advertising; at worst, a blatant bait/switch. Friendly people, but I do not trust them.

text: I’ve personally been doing business with Mr. Pierce and his family for a couple years and can honestly say they are some of if not the most honest and dependable people I’ve ever done business with in my life!! I encourage everyone to do business with them and I’ll go as far as to personally guarantee you’ll be treated fair and honest!! text: Love this place I just recently got my 3rd vehicle from them they are an amazing family. And will work with you as best as they can. I will never go anywhere else for my vehicle needs and it doesn't stop there they have boats fourwheelers tractors if you need anything just give them a call and they will help you out as much as possible.

name: Joe Goodman
text: Good quality vehicles and great prices.

name: Caleb Dickey
text: My wife and I both are very pleased with the service we received from Pierce Car and Truck Sales! Highly recommend them if you are searching for a vehicle! Already eyeing my next purchase to be a boat!

name: Doug Williams
text: I bought a Truck and a boat from pierce auto and have been very pleased with the honesty and service with this company and will buy again in the near future 💚 and the prices were fair too I highly recommend them to all my friends.

name: Montgomery Waylon
text: Brought a 2000 Camero from here on March the 1st which was a Friday. I brought the car back in on Monday the 4th and told them the service engine light came on and something under the car was rattling. I was told by the owners son that he didnt know anything about standard shift cars and they would not be responsible for anything wrong with it. Almost 3 weeks later the car starts running hot. When my husband got to me to check it out he opened up the radiator to find that it is full of J.B block seal he runs over 80 gallons of water through the radiator trying to clean it out to no avail. We replaced the thermostat that was so coroded with block seal it was rusted up. I called and left a message with Pierce auto sales telling them that the car was running hot and because someone was trying to cover up a cracked block or blown head gasket and there was so much block seal in the radiator and engine that I didn't know if the car was going to make it home and that I really needed someone to call me back because I had no way to get it home. I never recieved a call back.It cost me $60 to rent a car dolly to drag it home. Now the car came with an outside warranty but because "whoever" filled the motor up with block seal to hide a major problem until they could find an idiot "me" to take the car off of there hands the warranty will not cover the car. So now I have a blown up car sitting in my yard that I drove less then a month and repo men knocking on my door because they want there car back and still after all this time I have yet to recieve a call from anyone at Pierce Auto Sales.  I recieved more help and sympathy from the repo man in 10 minutes then I have from Pierce in 2 months. I paid $1500 down for a car that didn't even last until the first payment was due. I dont bash people or businesses but i have tried every other way to get them to talk to me. I just want my money back so I can get a car that runs and won't leave me on the side of the road less then a month after purchase.

name: Angie Lowery
text: I highly recommend Pierce Auto if you are looking to purchase an  automobile or boat.

text: Great folks to do business with

name: Lisa Dowland
text:
What a wonderful car buying experience!  I have owned many cars over the years and one thing has consistently stood out: it’s a complete hassle and you drive off the lot feeling taken advantage of.
THEN there is Valleyside & Orion!  I was at the bottom of my rope, searching for my dream car, when I found Valleyside on CarMax. From the first call to the last text message, I was treated with absolute respect not only as a  consumer, but as a female.
Orion worked diligently to find the best loan rate and never failed to follow up. You just can’t find all these things in one dealership anymore.
Orion, THANK YOU for making my dream car happen and restoring faith that there ARE honest people out there. You are a gem and I won’t buy a car anywhere else.

resp.text: We really appreciate your kind words Mrs. Dowland! Customer satisfaction is job #1 with Valleyside and I’m happy to hear that you enjoyed your experience with us. Thank you for allowing us to earn your business. You have a friend in the car business now! God bless!

name: Alex Thor
text: My wife and I were shopping for a truck to meet our needs for work, home, and adventures, and Alex and Orion were fantastic in that endeavor. The atmosphere was extremely comfortable and relaxed. They had nothing but quality vehicles at fair prices, including our truck. I highly recommend them if you're tired of the usual salesmen games. Also, the thunderbird out front is pretty dope.

resp.text: Thank you Alex! It was just like selling a vehicle to a friend. Thanks for sharing some of your testimony on Gods goodness; I’m looking forward to hearing much more. God bless!

resp.text: Why would we ship a car to you that hasn't been paid for? Why would we release a vehicle to someone who has not paid for it?  Let me get this right, you want us to give you a $80K vehicle based on your promise to pay us? Or do you want us to release a $80k vehicle with a screen shot of a FEDEX tracking number? Really Matthew? Not here pal. Oh yeah, the "after booking a flight" lie just shows what a scammer you really are Matthew. You have the audacity to give us a 1 star review after your scam didn't work. You can run your scams somewhere else, not at Valleyside Automotive Company. I have every email and text to prove you are a liar Matthew.

text: I drove from Mobile, Alabama to get a motorcycle from Orion. He had the cleanest VFR800 in the south east. He put in the extra effort to complete a long distance deal. He gave me his word that the bike would be mine even though it took a few days for the bank to get him his money. The bike is amazing, museum quality for less money than tired, abused bikes. Alex even helped me strap it down in the trailer. It was more than worth the drive and I would recommend them to friends and family.

name: C C
text: I trusted Valleyside to sell a 2019 Jeep Wrangler for me and I was not disappointed! Everything was clean and both the employees and their method of doing business were very professional. On top of the simplicity, I got a fantastic price versus selling it to the Jeep dealership. The employees kept contact with me though the whole process, treating me like a friend instead of a source of income. If the time comes for me to buy or sell a vehicle again, Valleyside is where I'll be going without a doubt!

resp.text: We’re very concerned about your disappointment with Valleyside. I'm truly sorry that you drove over two hours and the car you wanted wasn’t here. Vehicles that sell are advertised, with a SOLD tab on the picture, for a week after they’re sold. Our vehicles sell often and fast, so when customers call to inquire about vehicles, we let them know the status before they make the trip here. I don’t remember speaking with you about a vehicle. We appreciate you choosing Valleyside for your vehicle purchase. Please give us a call to check on the vehicle status before you take the long drive again; we want to make sure that we have the vehicle you want. Thanks and God bless.

name: Jose Plascencia
text: Never Buy In This Place, I Just Purchased A Ford F350 Dicel After One Month The Transmission Was Disconcerted

resp.text: When we sold you the truck it was in great working condition, we also included a free warranty. You told us that you put over 9000 miles on the truck in 7 days while the truck was overloaded by 3,000-5000 pounds each trip. You burned the torque converter out by your overloading the vehicle. I'm surprised, with the way you were using it, that the truck lasted a month under those conditions. The weight capacity rating is not a suggestion, it's the weight the truck can properly handle.

They apologized and we told them I'd up my loan for so much more money if they could find me a dependable vehicle. They have yet to return my call with any updates what so ever. I'm just so upset, I bought my first car all by my self and it's a complete lemon. I don't even expect to receive a call from them, I don't think they care anymore since I've had so many problems with it, they just want me to keep it and be done. text: someone in my family purchased from here. And someone I know, transmissions went out within 3 weeks after purchasing the vehicle. Because of the oversized rims and tires they put on the trucks and fail to regear the differential. My uncle had to spend over 2 grand on a rebuilt transmission, and then went ahead and had the differential rebuilt so he wouldn't have to keep on forking out money on transmission all in all he paid over 3500 after purchasing a 15 thousand dollar truck. Business shouldn't put oversized tires and rims on a vehicle to try and jump the price 3 grand. Then make the customer pay another 2-5 grand for transmission being rebuilt. I would not reccomend purchasing from them. They are nice at first but after you give them their money, they are cruel and won't stand behind their word.

text: We purchased a vehicle from MGM Auto Brokers in 2018. resp.text: Hey Mr. Heath, I’m sorry that you feel like you were misled in any way. Here at MGM we have the CarFax to every vehicle available on our website for customers to view before purchasing. CarFax can also add information like accidents much later on if they hadn’t reported that incident yet. I do however remember discussing with you that the truck was owned by 2 people but the same family. I also looked at the current trade value on that vehicle we sold you, it looks to be about $7,000 more then what we sold it for.

name: Nicole Brewer
text: My son, Petty Officer Smith, bought a 2016 Mustang GT for over $30k with 16k miles on it here. He had the car for a day and a half when the check engine light came on. Had it checked out immediately and came to find out it needed a motor. Ford garage told him that, a $12k fix. MGM told him to take it there. This was a month ago and the car has been parked since. Luckily he has a motorcycle he could use to get back and forth to work, although the weather has not been kind to him in Pensacola where he is stationed. This put him at risk on a daily basis. He did not want to drive the car until MGM advised him what to do at that point. Car is still sitting at this point. He had to get another loan to purchase an engine and get the car repaired. I don't suggest anyone doing business with this company. They have zero integrity and terrible character! There are many more details to this story that back everything I am saying. I think it is a disgrace to treat any customer (I, myself run multiple businesses) this way, let alone a service man. WARNING👉MGM ARE CROOKS!!!👈

He was not welcoming, did not thank us, and was downright rude and condescending. An apology was only offered by him after my fiance' went into the store and told him he didn't appreciate how we were treated. Even if he took 50% off the sticker price, I still would not spend money at a place that so blatantly disrespected us.

text:
My son-in-law that is in the military in Pensacola bought a car from this dealership and the engine blew the very next day and the dealership will not make it right.
Dealership said the car engine was under warranty but the previous owner altered the vehicle so now the engine warranty is not honored and the dealership will not replace or refund.
My son-in-law will have to get a attorney!!! Shame on the dealership for taking advantage of a 20 year old serving his country!!!
He needs a vehicle to drive back and fourth to the base and the kids are not wealthy to go and buy another $30,000 vehicle or replace the engine for $10,000.

text: Basically it’s a “rent a center “ for cars , they never tell you the price because after rental fees etc. A car that’s blue booked for like 8k will cost almost 30k. The woman that works on the credit side of the Pelham location is very rude for no reason at all , even answering a phone call seems to annoy her. Someone I know who purchased a car from them after I referred her , the car had issues and she returned it , the Memphis location told her that if she returned it they would file a 1099 and take her taxes lol, um no genius a 1099 is a self employment tax form and only federal such as student loans , child support , federal tax can take your income taxes , they assume people are that ignorant so they use words to scare you.

Why let him test drive a car and then later tell him they don't have the one he did the application on and got approve for..This is truly false advertising and bad business. I wouldn't  send anyone to this car lot. If a person give u there word and tell u to come in with what amount of money u say u have. This was a waste of time off the job and a lot of gas. name: Teresa Johnson
text: We went into this dealership today with high expectations but also as a last resort to get my mom approved for a vehicle. We only considered a "No CreditCheck" dealer because my mom couldn't get approved due to signing on a vehicle for a family member who didn't fulfill their credit agreement. We were told by the salesman named Austin that we only needed proof of income and a valid driver's license. First my mom was declined due to insufficient income so I agreed to be her co-signer. After giving Austin all of my information, including proving income and place of residence, he told us to give him 20- 30 minutes to get a response back from corporate. We returned to the dealership appropriately 40 minutes later feeling hopeful that my mom would get a car. We sat at Austin's desk and he told us that we couldn't be approved because we didn't live together! I've never heard of anything like this before! We wasted two hours of our time while they concocted up a lie for why they couldn't approve us! It was very hurtful and embarrassing! It took a lot for me to even go into a place like that but I trusted them and swallowed my pride just to help my mom. They advertise "No CreditCheck" but it's a lie! They looked on her credit bureau and saw the repossessed vehicle and turned her down without even giving her a chance to explain. I will be making a formal complaint with their corporate office on Monday morning! Please don't fall for the " No CreditCheck Scam"

text: Well the best way to describe my experience at Galaxy Motors is to be completely honest. I’m a coparent that went in half on buying our daughter her first car. With all three parents there an the test out the way we notice a small amount of oil on the bottom of the engine. Brought it to kyle attention an he let us know that they just changed the oil. Hey we all know that sometime we make a mess changing the oil so this was understandable. But Kyle Said nothings wrong with the car you can take it anywhere to get it checked out which we should of but hey with this pandemic an money be so close these day who has extra money to spend especially when all three parents had to save up money to buy the daughter her first car. An just think for a daughter to be getting her first car it’s to be exciting joyful an a memory that you you always remember. Well the word of Kyle of the car having nothing wrong with it an it’s a Great first car for our daughter. Well this is Definitely a memory our daughter will not forget. The car is been in my shop for the last four days waiting to be worked on this weekend. So with that being said I hope to warn anyone that is going to buy here be Cautious an don’t trust there word cause it has no meaning whatsoever. An by the way I made several calls an Kyle was out asked for him to call back an nothing.

name: David Harrelson
text: "WOW" That's all I can say about this place!!!! I would like to tell you a short story. My name is David and I have been in public service as a firefighter/paramedic for the last 28 yrs. About three months ago i responded to a severe accident involving a Kia Optima that had rolled over down an interstate several times then hit a concrete guard rail. The young lady got herself out of the car and refused to go to the hospital. she had only very minor injuries. Then on 05-09-2016 my youngest son was involved in a bad one. My 2015 Kia Soul was totaled by a speeding driver. In both of these vehicles "ALL" of the airbags were deployed. Thanks to the hand of an Almighty God!!! and the quality of the Kia Soul my son walked away with only slight bruising. Now let me introduce you to the place to go and the man to see to get yours. If you need a sound and dependable vehicle at the right price that will keep you and your loved ones safe. Come to Carlock Kia in Tuscaloosa Alabama. Then see the only man  you'll need to make it happen. His name is Ansharn Glenn aka " THE CAR DOCTOR". This man!!!!!! He can make it happen and will without a doubt. He turns frowns upside down:-). Trust me I'm a professional and what you will get here is why this today makes number 5 for me.

A lady answered the phone, I asked her name because she never stated her name and she said her name was Kristy. She sounded very aggravated with all the questions I was asking her. She seemed to know nothing about the leasing program and kept talking to people in the background. I was very upset at this point, so I asked to speak with her manager and she put me on hold for 20 minutes. After being on hold, she then said he was in a meeting and she would have him give me a call back. I am still waiting on this call back. To anyone that is searching for a vehicle, I will not recommend this company to anyone. Kristy was beyond rude to me on the phone so I changed my mind about dealing with this company at all. I will never, and I repeat never give them any of my business or send anyone I know there!
Signed,
A very pissed off potential customer

name: Elizabeth Anderson
text:
We purchased a brand new Kia Soul about 3 months ago. Salesman and all staff were excellent, courtious and as prompt as possible getting us approved and on our way in our new Kia Soul. Can't comment about the service department as there have been no reason thus far to seek service. Its a great family car/suv. CONS: there's not much leg room for most back passangers, the back seat rest dosent lean back for someone with back problems, no built in gps
. Pros: Great mid sized Suv, great gas milage, built in back up camera, easy to clean upholstery, relatively smooth ride unless you have to travel on roads not well maintained, great traction, heater, a/c and radio works well, power windows & door locks, and huge glove box. So far very pleased! Never owned a brand new vechicle (had only 4 miles on it which were ours from test drive, now however there is over 6000 miles on it) all ours!
If you want a new or used vechicle and want to be treated like royality then head on over to Carlock Kia in Tuscaloosa Alabama, you wont be sorry you did. Honest!

I GIVE THEM A FIVE STAR . REALLY YOU DONT GET THAT GREAT A SERVICE AROUND THESE DAYS AND I WAS VERY IMPRESSED . KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK GO TEAM CARLOCK KIA OF TUSCALOOSA.

name: Adela Germano
text: Friendly service (thanks Chevis!!!) and nice environment, casual, lovely folks who work there.

name: Sandi Zacharias
text:
Don't buy a car here! I was looking to build my credit and I had put $8,000 down on a used car with only 51,000 miles I found at Carlock on May 12. I test drove the car and l wanted it on a condition that they do an alignment on it as it had small pull to left.  After 5 hours of doing paperwork I go to get in the car and it wouldn't start due to a crouded battery. They said they would fix it first thing in the morning and gave me a loaner til then. Next day I go to get the car and drive it home, later that evening it wouldn't start. I looked under the hood and it was the same battery with acid everywhere. They had to come haul it back to the car lot. They replaced the battery like they should have done the day before. But now I didn't trust the service department so I took my car to postles tire barn and had them to check and see it had been anligned. In fact it had not, I got a print out of the degree each axle was off alignment. On June 10th I drove to Dallas Texas for one night, on the way back my air compressor quits working. Now I'm over 6 hours away from home and wasn't even out of Texas yet and its about 100 degrees outside. It was a long hot miserable drive home in my new car that I had not even had a month yet nor had I even made my first car payment. I immediately texted my car sales rep, he said bring it in and they will fix it. I was relieved until I actually took it there and they gave me a estimate of $1200 or something in that price range. I had a sit down talk with a general manager and the told me he would have it fixed if I pay for the compressor and Freon which would run me about $350. I don't have an extra any amount because I had just bought that car and had to get full coverage insurance plus tags. And I still have my first car note coming up. If they were as reputable as they claim they would have just fixed it since I hadn't had the car an entire month. I posted pictures of my text messages where I asked them to do the front end alignment and they didn't, I also posted the text convo on how they said to bring my car in and they would fix it. These images are posted on Google just tap on my profile.
Update: its now June 19th and I was told by the Carlock place it was my compressor, I had it replaced somewhere else and that wasn't the problem, so now its taking more money to chase the problem. My first payment is due on the 26th and I haven't been able to drive my car going on two weeks now.
Update: 6/23/17 found out the car needs a whole new air compressor, air condenser, expansion valve, and a vac and recharge which runs 1,700 dollars.

name: Patricia Jones
text:
We HIGHLY recommend West Alabama Wholesale Auto for your next vechicle purchase!
My husband and I just purchased a car and a truck from them.
Our salesman was GEO ,he was absolutely the BEST !!!! He is so patience with you , he listens to what YOU want in a vehicle !
I test drove a few cars before I made my choice,a beautiful 2018 Hyundai Elantra.
My husband was looking for a truck ,he test drove a few and even though they were great ,they weren't excalty what he was looking for.
GEO assured my husband , that if he didn't find what he was looking for on the lot ,to give him a few days and he could have it there, and that's excalty what happened !! So my husband got an awesome 2017 Nissan Titan.
Even if your credit isn't in tip top shape they will work with you and get you financed in the vehicle you want.
Everyone at the dealership is super nice , great customer service!
This was absolutely the best car/truck buying experience we have EVER had.
Ask for GEO,he is the man with the plan!
He goes the extra mile for his customers to assure they are getting a absolute GREAT deal.
Thanks
Patricia & James Jones
Berry , Alabama

text: Called them looking for a certain car within my price range. Just talking over the phone made me feel reallly confident. I definitely recommend them if your looking to drive off the lot TODAY. No hassle at all. Thank you so much.

name: Bobby Mohr
text: Gave them one star only because zero stars was not available....was trying to buy a 08 f150 lariat 4x4  from this place...explained to the salesman my credit status and situation...only had $ 2000 to put down....he assured my that should be enough ...filled out the paperwork, and after waiting a couple hours decided to leave and just have the salesman call me because they were "working on the deal" ...came back a couple days later and after a couple hours waiting the salesman says here's the deal....we need a co signer...so I got my daughter to sign on the loan...well then a hour or so later he comes out and says his manager wanted to talk to me....his manager  says to me that the deal the salesman had been working on was for the wrong truck....i said really? So in other words they pulled the old bait and switch on me....its where the salesman gets you interested in one vehicle but then either changes the vehicle, the down payment or the interest rate...in this case he was changing both the vehicle and the down payment....i told them id rather walk then buy one from them...i got up and proceeded to walk to my car , the salesman follows me and assured me he would continue to work on the deal and he would call me...never heard from him....i went 2 miles down the road to another dealer, he told me within 5 minutes I was approved and within  an hour or so I drove off with a vehicle

It also took 9 days to get my deposit back, and that was only after threatening legal action, to which the manager laughed off in front of a room full of customers. Places like these make their business by assuming you the customer have no idea how cars or money work. You would literally be better off taking an Uber everywhere you go, would be cheaper than a 400 dollar payment on a car worth 7k.

text: Only rotated two of my tires on the passenger side. They didn’t know I marked my tires. Watch out for this scam.

name: Scarlett Dolbear
text: I hate this place. I bought my car from them in 2014. It was a 2012 Nissan rogue. They were over priced compared to other dealers, and the service department is terrible. For instance, I had my oil changed and they did an inspection that is routine. They gave me the sheet showing everything they had checked, to include the tread on my tires. A couple of weeks after this inspection and maintenance my tire almost blew out. It was in terrible condition for some unknown reason with no blame attributed to them because yeah it happens. They told me they could have me a new tire in 24 hrs. So, I agreed. They also added that it would be in my best interest to replace all four tires because the rest of them were in such terrible condition as well. Now, why would they have checked the tread on my tires less than two weeks prior and marked them good if they were in terrible condition?? So, I obliged and told them I would just order four new tires. But, I also told them I wanted to keep the old ones just in case I needed a spare. When I came back to pick up my car it did have new tires. I asked where I could pick up the old ones because my fiance at the time told me to keep them, and they assured me that I didn't want them. One guy, I'm guessing the supervisor, even included that his wife wouldn't be driving around on tires in that bad of shape. So, lesson learned: they will try and take advantage of you in any way they can when it comes to getting the most money out of you. I left without my old tires and to top it all off they even charged me a recycling fee for them after I told them I wanted to keep them. I went back not too long ago and the service was just the same. My AC had went out on this same car. Long story short, they charged me a diagnostic fee and couldn't even tell me exactly what was wrong, but worse case scenario I was looking at $2000 worth of repairs. So, after the tire incident I went elsewhere and got a second opinion. They took less time and narrowed the issue down to a relay problem. But, told me worse case scenario $1500. So, again they are over priced. I ended up trading my car in at a dealership in Bay minette and I couldn't be happier. I purchased the extended warranty on the rogue with them, and it served no purpose. It ran out at 100,000 miles and every issue i had either wasn't covered  or started at 104,000 miles. Another lesson learned. I will not shop with them again, or use their service department for anything to include routine maintenance. I don't recommend them to anyone. Of course this is just my opinion of them from what I experienced.

Everything was done the way I think it should be done as far as the whole vehicle purchase experience. If I had to purchase another vehicle (I've been a Chevy man for 50 years!) I would definitely look here first.

name: Kathy Mccutcheon
text: Just bought a new Buick Encore, absolutely love it! My experience buying this car was wonderful and very stress free! Ron Scogin was my sales rep and he was very professional and friendly! His instructions on operating the car before I left the car lot were extremely helpful! Everyone at this dealership was friendly and helpful! First time in many years that buying a car was so easy and stress free! Nice to know I didn't have to spend an entire day going through this process! Love my car and service!!😊

name: Ursurla Barnes
text: I love the fact you can go look around on the lot and not be chased down by a salesperson. When you are ready to test drive you will make an instant friend with the salesperson...very friendly and in-depth knowledge of the cars. I did not leave the Brooks lot with my new car without knowing how everything worked ! Last, but the main reason I purchased again from Brooks was the service department. I am going to describe it as I told them..WOW !! Yes, it is that good.  😊

name: Damesia Crocker
text: Everyone here at Brooks was an absolute delight to work with. They made our purchase  very easy and helped us get into exactly what we were looking for. Thanks to all the staff there for being such a great team to do business with.

resp.text: Damesia, congratulations on your new vehicle purchase, and thank you for your recommendation of our team! We sincerely thank you for your business and hope to continue serving you for many years to come.

name: Chris Owes
text: Joseph Deshler, Preston Brooks, Paula Mashburn and Shawn Minter have all been exceptional throughout the purchase process of my first vehicle as well as during my first service inspection. I would recommend them all to anyone. They listened to me and made sure I got what best fit me although I did not initially know what I wanted. Shawn Minter carried out my first maintenance inspection and explained everything to me in detail although there were no issues I felt comfortable after his thorough explanation.

text: Always willing to help you out.Even made fresh coffee for me after finding out just worked off nights. Great service Rep. Shawn Minter

resp.text: Thank you Wanda for your kind words & Thank you for choosing Brooks! We understand those long hours........

text: The service at Brooks Motors is fantastic!! Everyone is very professional and helpful. I enjoy each visit to the dealership.

name: Richard Grant
text: Had issue with a 2012 Acadia  we purchased there since day one. many trips in for repair  still present after 5 years. Service rework is frustrating and time consuming. Ownership does not seem to care about customers, I/13/17 service on my 2013 Sierra HD diesel ended any relationship with this dealership. Have owned GM products for 45 years and this is by far the worst dealership  i have worked with. They have some good people but leadership is wanting.

resp.text: Hi Richard, we appreciate you taking the time to respond. The staff at Brooks Motors take our reviews very seriously. Please call Preston Brooks (Business Manager), (334) 636-5485 for ways we can work towards resolving these issues. We look forward to hearing from you soon.

text:
I had an oil change done on my Volkswagen.  the staff was very friendly from the time I came through the door.  I really liked that when I pulled up to the Service lane they opened the door and I was able to drive in, then the waiting room was just inside the door.
I will be back for my next service.

text: I had a great experience at Brooks Motor service department they were kind and very friendly also everything was done in a timely manner

name: Richard Brewton
text:
I looked for over a month for the SIERRA I wanted. I had received several emails from Brooks but because of the distance from home I avoided making the drive.  After a frustrating Saturday talking to other dealers, I told my wife Rae I was driving to Thomasville Monday to see what they had.  Rae suggested we make the drive that afternoon.

I never expected to be driving a new SIERRA home that afternoon.

We arrived at Brooks late on Saturday afternoon.  I walked on the lot and found the Sierra I had wanted all along.  Neil was very helpful with the test drive and answering our question.

I had done a lot of research on USAA's car buying site and TrueCar's site as will.  When Neil presented Brooks pricing, it was well within the range  I expected to pay.  The financing was in line with the research I had done as well.

Neil, Kelly and Preston were very gracious staying after hours to complete our transaction.

Rae and I agreed this was the best experience either of us had ever experienced when purchasing a new vehicle. Relaxed, no anxiety and we left totally satisfied with every aspect of the transaction.

Thank you to all!!

PS: THE COOKIES WERE FABULOUS !!!!

resp.text: We're happy to hear that you found our staff so helpful, Richard! We sincerely appreciate your business and kind review. We hope to see you again in the future! Safe travels!

name: William Odom
text: I would like to invite anyone and everyone that is wanting to buy a new or used vehicle you should go to Brooks Chevrolet and Thomasville Alabama I promise you that you won't have that feeling of being harassed or pressured ... These guys are awesome !!

resp.text: We appreciate you too!

name: Erin Andrews
text:
Came to the dealership explaining my vehicle is randomly stalling out. Which is extremely dangerous. If I stalled out in a busy intersection, red light, or train tracks, I could die. And this is the car I carry my 2 babies in. I've worked in the service department industry for years and years before I had my kids and from my knowledge it's a liability to turn away a customer if their car is doing anything that could put you in danger. Well, this dealership did.

That's okay though. I'll call a lawyer if anything happens to me or my family. I'm headed to Chris Myers GMC.

name: Lynn J
text: I went to the autonet used car center back in April 2017 or 18. I purchased a Ford Mustang, the buying process was a easy and quick transaction. The sales auto clerk and manager over the Hueytown location were very nice. They try to help you with any maintenence issues that you may have with your vehicle. You can always pay your notes on time via Internet or go in person. If you are on a budget and you need a decent car, then I'd recommend going to autonet. Just examine the car, as throughly as possible. Keep in mind, with any used car dealership, you must look at what you get before you close out a deal. They try their best to work with you based on your weekly income wage amount, so don't worry about a very high costly note every 3 weeks. I would recommend them to anyone, especially if you're a first time buyer.

resp.text: Thank you for the review! It was a pleasure doing business with you!

name: vee mcdonald
text: I purchased a truck from them! I paid a good amount of money down. However when we got the truck the radio system was not working the dealer told us no worries the radio is just locked and where going to handle that. So they take the truck to get the radio unlocked but the aux was broken and the DVD player still would not work. So they give me a card to call their radio guy, because he would no what to do. Well they sent him to fix the radio. He replaces it with a radio that’s not for my truck, but it’s not his fault because he was given a budget and couldn’t spend much to remedy the problem. Even though they just received over 16,000 for the truck I just purchased. When he put the replacement radio in it prevented my back up assistance from working and all of the turning signal, and low gas signal from ringing! My point is if you’re going to sell a vehicle and advertise all these amenities make sure they work and if they don’t honor your word and fix it properly! Don’t try and take the cheap way out when you didn’t take the cheap way out when you got my money!

name: Wil T.
text:
Stay Away!!!!!!!!!! Bad Business!

I recently purchased a vehicle here for my daughter.  During the initial test drive, the vehicle drove fairly decent except  for a minor suspension issue. The test drive was only approximately 2 to 3 miles during heavy traffic so there were no obvious signs of transmission issues on the freeway. However,  after having the vehicle a few days the transmission started slipping and making a grinding noise at high speed when the engine was good and warm. I called Rustem back and notified him of the issue and he insisted that the transmission was good and that he had just put a transmission in the vehicle.   I had the vehicle towed to an automotive shop and they confirmed the same issues. I told Rustem about what they found and he insisted that I take the car to Nissan. Please  listen to me, DO NOT BUY ANY VEHICLES FROM THIS PLACE!

text: DO NOT BUY FROM HERE!!!!  We traded a nice Jeep for a truck. We didn’t even make it home before the transmission went out. However, we didn’t have the $400 to get it towed and they said we couldn’t drive it to them. So they eventually said that they would help pay for us to get the transmission fixed elsewhere. Needless to say they completely deny that they said that. They have done nothing but lie to us and it was hard for my husband to even get them to talk to us to begin with. I REPEAT DO NOT BUY FROM THEM!!!! If they would’ve done as they said we wouldn’t be leaving bad reviews!! If I could give a lower star rating I would.

resp.text: So sorry you feel this way, never did we offer to pay for the vehicle to be fixed elsewhere.  I can post the messages between your husband and us.  We traded "as is" I never complained about what I had to fix on the Jeep nor would I had said anything had you brought the transmission to us to have an opportunity to make you happy.  But to get on here and tell absolute "Lies" is slanderous to say the least.  I have read every word of our conversations and I suggest you do the same, that way you can get the facts straight.  As i quote the last thing he said " i am going to dump on you"/

name: Doug White
text:
DO NOT BUY FROM ACTION AUTO WHOLESALE LLC

Transmission went out before I could even get home, after they told me it was just rebuilt. I made sure because it the 4060 in a 2000 GMC SIERRA 4x4, which if you know about that transmission you know they are known for going out. Anyway the only way they will help is if I tow it to a guy that they use, which works at the city dump. The same guy who supposedly rebuilt it already. Well I live over a hour away and to tow it there would cost $400. So I called to get them to pay for the tow but no they wouldn't do that. I don't have $400 to tow it out there, you see I traded a very nice Jeep Wrangler for the truck. So I found a shop to rebuild the transmission for a $1,000 and ask Action Auto Wholesale to pitch in half. You guessed it they are not willing to help me in anyway. DON'T BUY FROM ACTION AUTO WHOLESALE LLC
LOCATE AT 34382 US-98, Lillian,Alabama 36549

DO NOT BUY FROM ACTION AUTO WHOLESALE LLC

name: David Armstrong
text: Lee at Steel City Classics recently handled the sale of my 2004 Corvette. Lee is the nicest guy you'll ever meet, and knows cars extremely well. He has an excellent marketing strategy with great photos and online advertising to get cars noticed and sold. He handles all the interactions with interested buyers, removing all the hassle from the sale of cars. I highly recommend Lee and plus you'll get to see a number of very nice classic cars and hot rods in his huge storage area.

name: Ray Ray
text: If they don't have it, they'll find it.  Great staff and autos.

name: Nicole Ivanovich
text: I tried to sell my 1975 Corvette on my own through facebook marketplace for about 10 months and was finding I was getting very little interest in it or if there was interest, the buyers were not serious. I reached out to Lee and he went above and beyond in helping me. Lee picked up my car which was in Montgomery and trailered it to his warehouse in Birmingham, helped me get it in tip top shape by sending it to a local classic car mechanic to help make a few minor repairs AND was able to get the car sold in 2-3 months time. Lee was always open with sharing all offers that were made on the car and letting me know the activity it was getting. Lee handled all of the negotiations, communications and transaction details with the international buyer. Lee listened to our family's story of the car and was able to share that with the buyer to hopefully pass along our family car's history. I would not hesitate to recommend Steel City Classics to anyone who is looking to sell (or buy) a classic car.

resp.text:
Nicole's Corvette was a great car with a special story. Her father had it for years and kept it in perfect original condition. The Corvette was a part of her family story. The current owner saw the car while visiting Birmingham and had it shipped home to France!
I enjoyed meeting you Nicole and I really appreciate your kind words.

text: Drove 7 hours to get this truck it was nasty and 800 miles later dropped 7300 in a new transmission. Wouldn't trust them again.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, all criticism is welcomed. Since all vehicles are sold as-is, we always encourage people to get a mechanical inspection performed by a shop of their choosing before any purchase.  We have this disclosure plainly stated on our website and try to verbally state this on every sale. I do hate that you had a bad experience, but I am also having problems finding you in our database.  Are you sure it was Lakesideimports.net in Mobile, AL? I also wish i knew what vehicle you purchased. A $7300 transmission seems awful steep.

name: charles coker
text: Drove thirty miles to buy a car the truck was rough I was still willing to buy the truck but he was unwilling to come down on price.

resp.text: Mr Coker, I am glad you drove in and looked at our truck. I hate that the condition was not to your liking, but we price our vehicles per condition so all discounts are already given with advertised price. I keep many pictures on the website and try to be very forthcoming with any imperfections. I hate wasting peoples time just as much as I hate my time being wasted. Just because you were not willing to pay the advertised price that you drove over for, should not justify a one star review.  I hate that we did not see eye to eye. I still cannot see the justification in a 1- Star review. Thank you, BJ.

name: Raymond Kuppersmith
text: Not a good experience for me,and I 'll leave it at that, because am the one that made the mistake buying this vehicle from Lakeside.

resp.text: Mr. Kuppersmith,  thank you for your business. I do hate you had problems with the water pump on your truck.  I am glad you were able to repair this and hopefully now you are enjoying your truck. Come by and see us maybe we can work things out.  Thanks again BJ

name: Frances Blackwell
text:
We purchased 2 boats and the hull #'s on the bill of sales were wrong for both boats. Both boats BOS had the same hull #'s. The one the number actually went to had a number missing. We called and text numerous times to get the owner to send us corrected paperwork. He was either out of the office or in a bad cell phone area. It took 2 weeks to get it taken care of. We bought the boats to rent and reservations were coming in so each day we couldnt get the boats registered or insured was a day we were losing money. After many hours at the court clerks and VAS not answering calls he finally got back to me and had an attitude. This was all his mistake. There was no need to talk over me with an attitude because i asked him to correct HIS mistake. They should treat customers better and pay attention to the paperwork.
Go over the papers very carefully before closing a deal with this company.

name: Cayson’s Club
text: The reason I do not recommend them is my husbands truck he bought there has been tore up since we bought it early this year. We’ve put nearly $5000 in it and he still can’t drive it. Idk if they knew or not but it makes me sick after several years of my husband waiting to get a truck, he hasn’t been able to enjoy it.

text: Jason & John are very friendly, knowledgeable, and professional. Saves a trip to service in Huntsville. Price is fair and reasonable. They also have helped with other issues even if it is just a phone call with a question.

name: Curtis Austin
text: I purchased a 2014 audi a8l 4.0t on Friday August 14 and on Tuesday August 18 the brake guard unavailable light came on then later that day when I got home the battery light came on saying alternTor fault battery  not charging. I called vintage autos and I was told that he would get with the owner and work some out. I called back the next day and was told the owner was in court  and that he would call back i never received a call so I tried to call about 7 times no response. The next day I called repeatedly all day long with no response or even a returned call. This is the most unprofessional  service I have ever had to deal with they were very friendly in the beginning  but once they had my money things turned for the worse I would not recommend this place to anyone stay away.

Update: Talked to Alex over the phone and his apology seemed genuine and sincere. He went above and beyond to make it right.

resp.text: Very sorry for your experience. Your wait time was much longer than anticipated, so we are refunding you the alignment charges. We appreciate your business very much!

text: I'm a transplant from Florida, so finding a Cadillac dealership in The Shoals area, with excellent service, is very important to me. Well I found that in Bentley Cadillac! text: Bobby warden was extreamly helpful form start to finish, I came in and he sat down with me and ordered the vehicle exactly how I wanted it. Kept me informed the whole time it was being built and when it arrived set up a delivery time for me to pick it up. He went over everything at the delivery and made sure I was comfortable with all the features before I left. Overall exceptional expierence with Bobby and the entire Bentley Cadillac dealership.

resp.text: Hi, your wonderful feedback and rating mean a lot to us. Until the next time we meet, take care!

name: Willodean Davis
text: Great, Great Great .in everything they do.  Randy Gray and Devon Cox was wonderful helping me on such a bad day..Thank everyone at Bentley.

resp.text: Hi Willodean! We're glad to hear we were able to make your day a better one. Please let us know if there is anything we can do for you.

name: Jack McGowan
text:
Professional atmosphere
Courtesy was awesome
Service absolutely spot on
Cost was not out of line with competition

resp.text: Hi there, thank you so much for your positive comments about Bentley Cadillac of Florence! We sincerely thank you for the positive review, and look forward to seeing you again soon!

text: I understand up selling, but i felt like i was being pushed to buy services i did not want. Normally i deal with Devon but she was not there at this service.

resp.text: Roy, Thank you for the kind words. We are happy you were pleased. We value your business, and look forward to serving your family in the years to come.

text:
I took my Cadillac SRX in for a repair. Once again, Cecil Staggs was amazing.  He kept me posted on the progress of my car and was very helpful in getting it repaired in a timely manner    I appreciate the wonderful service I always get at Bentley Cadillac

Judith Rickard

resp.text:
Ms. Rickard,
Thank you for the review, and for your business. We will make sure Cecil hears about your praise, and we look forward to serving you in the years to come. Be well!

text: arrived for schedualed appt. met with Cecil (who is always exceptionally helpful with any question or service ) service was timely and complete with wash off and cecil had a quote for tires and alignment ready for us when service completel. All done while we waited for a very resonable wait time.

resp.text: John, we're glad everything was completed quickly and to your satisfaction! Please don't hesitate to reach out if there's anything additional we can do for you.

name: Deirdre King

name: David Eason
text: I really enjoyed my first experience at Serra Nissan of Sylacauga. I was shopping for a Nissan Rogue. They had a very good variety in stock. My Salesperson was David Vaughn. He was outstanding to deal with. David was very helpful and took all the time I needed to look at the different options. There have only been a few car sales people who I would be willing to deal with again. David Vaughn is in that select group. From our looking, test drive, and eventually negotiating the deal, I could not have been more pleased with my experience. Besides David, his Floor Manager, Ricardo was also very helpful with helping make the deal work. Chad in Finance was great to deal with as well. I highly recommend Serra Nissan of Sylacauga. Ask for David Vaughn!

name: Debra Price
text: Staff went out of their way to show common courtesy and kindness. Marty the sales manager and mattie the sales woman were super. I would highly recommend this dealership. They were fast and we never felt so comfortable.  Thankyou for everything M & M.

name: Linde Williams
text: Codie in the Service Department was great! She really cared about me as a customer and it showed. It's difficult to find great customer service but I received it today!

name: LaTonya Chatman
text: The service staff were all very helpful and nice. I have visited another Nissan dealership for service and they tried to push products and services on me that I did not need but this was not the case. They suggested only services that I need. I did not have to wait all day for my service work to be completed.

name: Janet Hadley
text: I sent an email to Serra Nissan interested in looking for a new, used car. Frank Morris called me to ask me what exactly I was looking for. Within minutes he sent me pictures with options that met my description. I made an appointment to come see him later that afternoon. When we got there Frank had pulled the vehicles I was interested in. We went for a test drive and fell in love with a 2019 Kia Sonata. Frank was incredibly patient with me and never made me feel pressured to make a decision. He worked with his manager and finance to get me exactly what I needed at the price I wanted. He even called a few days later to make sure we were happy with our purchase. I highly recommend Serra Nissan, and ask for Frank!

name: Nancy Smith
text: Great experience with Jaclyn. And sales manager Marty.

name: Quisha Thomas
text: I just want to thank Marty and Madi and everyone that was involved with helping me get my car. Great experience I would definitely recommend sierra Nissan in sylacauga to anyone who needs a car. I was so happy words can't explain.

name: SHELIA JOHNSON
text: Love it, great service from Madi and Hardy...love my new car

name: Eddie Jones (SalesSupermanEddieJones)
text: Great people and awesome cars. Plus, Eddie Jones is there

name: David Fletcher
text:
The entire team at Serra Nissan of Sylacauga were a pleasure to work with. From the moment we stepped on the lot and we’re not swarmed by sales people, to when sales professional David Vaughn showed us the car we were interested in looking at and test driving, to negotiating on the vehicle with David’s manager ( we only had to make our original offer and one counter), to signing paper work with the F&I manager Hatcher. I was happy when we told Hatcher we already had financing, he only asked what our rate was. He then helped us select an extended warranty that was a better deal than what we had from our bank.
My wife hates all the B.S. that happens when you you purchase a car and would rather have a root canal. We would both highly recommend Serra Automotive and sales pro David Vaughn!

name: Tamara Riggins
text: The stuff is very helpful and kind.

text: Bought a Ford Explorer from them not even a month later the power lift gate would not work. I called them and they told me to take it to the Ford dealership. They worked hard to get my business but the lack of customer service is horrible after the sale. Wouldn’t advise dealing with these people. Won’t ever be back.

name: Michael Harman
text: Dont expect these uneducated mechanics to fix your nissan without replacing parts that It doesnt need before they figure out which part is wrong. They charge triple and are mean about it towards the customer! The girls at the front desk are great! But the mechanics are lazy and not nice.

name: Robin
text: I was in Sylacauga (2/10/21) for service for my vehicle.  Onna in the service department was FANTASTIC.  Onna had the best attitude that I've experienced in a long time. Her kindness and willingness to help was outstanding. Onna, YOU ARE AWESOME!!

name: John Mitchell
text: Too lazy to rotate my tires when I had my oil changed! Will not be returning!

text: Well i bought a 2014 Nissan and it had warranties I also had got my key replacement during my warranty that they had neverrrrr program it to my car now I guess it’s my fault the reason they never got to it so now I have a key that can’t be programmed on their account I never had a issue here but this is my first and last time getting played by Nissan in sylacauga only thing I can say is the lady at the front desk was nice!!!

Part Can't be ordered until Monday(3-1-21)now. Thanks to the Tech who went above and beyond find the part I need.

text: My Rogue needed some work and the dealership where I purchased the car and the next closest dealership were too busy to help me in the time frame I needed. So my son-in-law called Sylacauga and they said bring it on in and we will take care of you. Super Super nice and very professional employees. They took care of my issues faster than we expected and I would highly recommend them to everyone.

name: L G
text: My experience was very pleasant I think the young lady name Miss Alana she is very friendly and courteous  she is always helpful to me everytime I come to get my oil changed the world need more people like her

name: Teresa Huff
text: Sales reps were friendly and worked to make the deal happen.

name: Daffney Holley
text: I brought my suv in for a tire expection and I needed my tire patch tire rotation. And while I was there got a whole service for my suv as well. I really do appreciate how well they did everything that I needed done.

name: Crystal Wilson
text:
CONVENTIONAL OIL & FILTER CHANGE    $39.95
TIRE ROTATION & BALANCE                        $29.95

I was told I needed windshield wipers. I ask how much and the service man said $18. I said ok, go ahead and change them. He did not say per blade. He misrepresented the item.  The price I was charged with discounts is not the problem. I now do not feel I can trust your service staff without questioning their ability to treat the customer fairly. I never had a problem with the Nissan in Carrollton, Ga with years of service.

name: L. T.
text: Great experience with them. They are very nice and very attentive to your issues.

name: Lorraine Connell
text: I was pleased with your very friendly and efficient service personnel.  Sharon made my waiting time pleasant, while my car was getting an oil change. She also informed me of what service needs my car will  need in the near future. No pressure just a nice "heads up" ! I wish all service personnel were as nice as Sharon !

resp.text: Thank you Ms. Connell for the great review! Alana and Sharon, our service writers here at Serra Nissan are amazing!!

name: Jeanne Smith
text: We found the exact car we wanted. The sales part was seamless. There was a wait to get in with the finance office as there was only one for three dealerships. The follow-up on issues from our salesman was non-existent. He said he’d order things and never did. After two calls to him I spoke to the sales manager and I think we’re going to get satisfaction. Overall, the team was personable and mostly professional. I would recommend Serra Nissan.

resp.text: Ms. Smith, I just wanted to let you know that we have ordered your owner's manual and key fob. We will be calling you when it comes in. Thank you for being a valued customer of Serra Nissan of Sylacauga!!

name: Yakeshia Dates
text: The lady took GREAT care of me at the Sylacauga Serra Nissan name Sharon. I was very pleased with her service. She is always very nice and polite.

name: terese c
text: I was not impressed with the hospitality, of the service department. In the pass I would take my cars here. When I bought my daughter a car she brings it here. So I do not come often. The staff is entirely different! The service department was the only reason I continued to purchase cars from this location in the past. Anyone can sale me a car, salesmen are all the same. But the service department keeps my new car in good condition. Service wasn't bad, just not what I was use to. Miss Kim, Ken.......Andrea❤!

name: Lisa G.
text: It's a awesome place everyone was great in the service department and parts. Mrs Sharon , Tabitha and David are people that go out of there way to make me very pleased that I purchased my car here and that having my car serviced here is always in good hands. Thanks guys awesome job.

name: Destiny Moon
text: The tech was very resourceful and polite he gave great conversations just a very good experience

name: Melanie Nelson
text: Although Jeff Adams wasn't our salesman, he spent 2 and 1/2 hours with me helping me get the vehicle that I really wanted.   Mr. Jeff Adams is a tremendous asset to this dealership, and if we ever look to trade or buy, I will ONLY do business with him.  He didn't benefit at all from those hours with me, but he never hesitated to be right there, available, by phone and text even after leaving the dealership that afternoon.  Offering advice, encouragement and kindness.  Sometimes you need more than a knowledgeable salesman, sometimes you need a compassionate, considerate human being with commission or profit not the first thought.  This was my first new car purchase in over 32 years, and I would definitely recommend friends to shop here.

name: Tyler Norwood
text: The girls behind the counter in the parts and service department have gone out of their way to help with warranty info, setting appointments, etc to try to get an ongoing problem with my truck fixed. They definitely deserve 5 starts. Now if only the mechanics could diagnose and fix the issue...but, that’s been a problem with every dealership  ive taken it to so that’s no really just on Serra Nissan.

name: Philip Hopper
text: Everyone at Serra made my buying experience flow easily. There was no pressure like I have had at previous car lots.  Each person in the process from the online account rep to the sales person to the finance team was knowledgable and helpful in making my purchase. They even brought my vehicle to me the next day after fixing one of the tires . Only negative thing was having to go down the road to another building to do all the finance work.

name: Peggy Caine
text: You all was very nice and did a good job on my car and truck..Thank you Peggy Wesson

name: Mindy Jones
text: David Compton was the absolutely most helpful person.  My little Nissan need something and he knew exactly what I need and  even took the time to explain the steps for getting my Nissan looking great as always!  10/10 would recommend David  to another person in need.

name: John E Clough
text: Efficiency and knowledge seemed to be motto. Made an extra effort to show me a friendly pleasant service visit. All of the staff that I came in contact with acted as though my reason for visiting was important.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great review, Mr. Clough. It was a joy talking to you this morning.

name: Takeila T
text: I have been to this service center before and it didn't take as long and I was semi prepared for a wait on a Friday....however I did not think it would be close to 2 hours. The lady that checked me in went to lunch for an hour and came back and was shocked that I was still waiting and no one had even acknowledged that it had been so long. A tip would probably be to update customers with an estimated wait time. But the staff were friendly and were pleasant just busy and overworked or either they lacked a system for managing the customers.

name: Everything MsJae
text: Thanks David so much. I love my new car.  😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁

text: David in the Parts department went above and beyond with customer service! I needed to special order some hard to find parts and he couldn't have possibly been more helpful! Thank you Serra Nissan for your awesome knowledgeable staff!
