text: Literally the best car service ever!! Customer service is the best in town, they fixed my car in a timely manner and were very sweet to me! I would definitely recommend this place.

name: Theo Zinner
text: Many other shops turned me down as they did not want to work on my 91 mr2. Eagle imports was able to do it. They went above and beyond by finding all the bolts I was missing. They even gave me a free floor mat for my other car. If you have an older car I would highly recommend eagle imports.

name: Alessandro Sanna
text: The old grandpa at the desk need to learn to talk to a costumer. Nobody will ever come back and pay you thousands of dollars to get treated like that. Lost my business, my brother business and any person I can make aware of this place. Not going back

name: Ambriah Chambers
text: This place is amazing always on time with everything they are so very nice and treat your car with the absolute most care! They fixed my air conditioning within two days and I had my car back immediately that morning such a great place everyone who works there your doing a great job!😇

name: Megan Johnson
text: Very honest and kind people! Priced my BMW maintenance for 125$ less than PepBoys. Car was fixed in a timely manner. Won’t be taking my vehicle anywhere other than Eagle Imports from here out!

name: Edwin Guy
text: This is a long overdue review from Guy in the red 180sx. Eagle Imports is very conveniently located on Opelika road right by Byrons Smokehouse and let me just say the work these guys do is spot on! They take on mostly Euro cars but will and have worked on Japanese cars and other import cars. I’ve had a chance to speak and watch the owner Of eagle imports work and he himself is the man with the plan, if another shop can’t get it done this man can! These guys do amazing work and the price is right!

name: Roy Washburn
text: Made an appointment for 8am and upon arrival was greeted by name, had all my details up and ready.  Confirmed my details and immediately took my car back.  They also were careful to point out some other kptional items but did not pressure me to purchase.  Even one item they did for parts only since they were already working in that area of the car and part was VERY reasonably priced.  Would definitely continue servicing my vehicle here.  Thanks to Larry and the whole team!!

name: Ryan Martin
text:
New review:
I was back at the shop again, this time for a good bit of work (control arms and steering rack replacement) on my C230. They got it in and out quicker than I expected, and the work was millimeter perfect. I picked it up this afternoon, and spent two hours this evening joyriding around town because the car just felt that good.

They're truly a proper shop that will get your back on the road for pennies on the dollar as compared to a Mercedes dealer. Hard to ask for more.

Old review:
Thanks to Larry and the guys for getting my SLK 230 back up and running, and some $300 cheaper than their local competition! My old beast has 277,000 miles on it, so maybe with their help it will get to 300,000 and beyond.

They were transparent and thorough with every update, so I would definitely recommend them to anyone else for their import repair needs.

name: maggie hall
text: Terrible customer service and i mean TERRIBLE they were rude as hell.

name: Garrett Hoke
text: Fastest I’ve ever seen someone identify and fix several specific issues under my bmw’s hood. These guys know what they’re doing.

name: JT Whitlow
text: Wasn’t very pleased. They charge you for things you can get free and will hold your car hostage until you pay a fee that they do not disclose to you. Be careful, I should’ve listened to the previous reviews. Oh yeah, I guarantee there will be more than one thing wrong with your car. I’ll go to Birmingham before I go back there.

name: Chris Gilbert
text: The technicians are very friendly and very knowledgeable. They clearly communicated the problems with my car after other shops in town couldn't diagnose, much less fix the problem. The prices were fair and it was fixed in a timely manner. I'll definitely be returning for all of my service needs!

name: Tiffany Hodges
text: I have VW and this is the only place I will take it. Larry and his staff are honest and pricing is reasonable.

name: beyoung joe
text: This is Joe, who fixed car here. This is a good shop to fix your import cars, Larry and other guys are great and solve all my problems. They fix cars fast and reliable, if you have problems with your cars, just go this shop. It's good choice.

name: shabnam habibi
text: This is the worst place to go. I had engine check on in my car. Its valve cover gasket needed to be replaced.  Although I told them what the problem was, they kept the car for 3 weeks and asked for $250. The moment I turned the car on in their yard the engine check sign reappeared and this time it was flashing, which means there is a worse problem with the car. I HAD to get the keys back to them. This time, they kept the car for one more week and ask for extra $150. The guy in charge told me that there is also a problem with the coils. They didn't even bother turning on the car to see if any problems show up. If the coils had the problem from the beginning, they should have been able to diagnose it. In total, I paid $400. Two weeks later, the engine check came back again. I went there and he said you need to pay another $100 for diagnosis!! They just want to rip money off of you! Never go there!!!!

name: James Puckett
text: I have been here a couple times for repairs on a 1999 Mercedes C230. It is little pricey but that is expected from a small specialty import shop. Customer service was great and quality repairs were made. Would come again.

name: UKNOW !!
text: Great people with Great service!!! I was pleasantly surprised will the positive attitudes and it shows in their work! Thank you guys for a great experience!!

name: Jeffrey Yukawa
text: I have had a lot work done there. Fair prices and quality work. I highly recommend going there if you need work done to your car! I drive a lowered civic si and no one around town could aline it. Eagle Import had it done and driving straight in no time. Great place!

name: Kimberly Aston
text: Very awesome customer service

name: Andi Dover
text: Very helpful n sweet

name: Doug Reid
text:
Definitely a lack of communication w car owners, At first I was excited to find some place that was doable for import cars. I was quoted 3.5 hrs for a job plus parts. I told them going in it was an old car w a lot of miles, and  it wasn't worth much, so I didnt want to spend the cars value on the minor repair needed. So after 2 weeks its still not completed, they are blaming defective new parts, told them to put the original part (oem)back in since they were having so much difficulty and I need the car.
The car was driving wonderful but water pump was leaking, hope I can drive it now for a while, but I am concerned.

name: tam stew
text: Totally  tried to rip off my parents  on their Audi repairs.  Stated 3500 because compressor went out. My parents took the car to Audi dealership for repairs who stated it was only the fan that went out..cost 550.00.  They even charged for low fluid but the car fluid was filled a week prior. My parents are elderly...buyer beware

name: Moofuly
text: If it’s not you care about what you drive & it’s not American . You’re going to want to take it here , fantastic service & they even waxed my car! 👍

name: Michael Cohen
text: AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!!! Took my car for an oil change and brake check. Wanted to charge me over $100 for an oil change, so I had them nix it and just check the brakes. Came back and told me they would do the brakes and the oil for $450, which is absurdly overcharging. Told them no thanks. Owner had already told them to start the oil change and he'd charge me just for the oil and filter and the brake check. Whatever. Except they only put 5 qts of oil in the car which requires 5.5L, and used 5W30 instead of VW approved 5W40 like I specifically requested before turning over the keys initially. So not only did they try to overcharge me, they didn't even properly complete the work they did. The owner was sketchy throughout the whole deal. I had to repeatedly ask for quotes, which he never gave me solid estimates on, and I never felt like I could trust the work they did.

name: Kevin Copeland
text:
I have a 1974 VW thing I took it therefor a problem with the ignition which they fixed and was asked about an oil leak. I said I would love to have it fixed and it got fixed for three day and then it was leaking again. Well I took back and after we got the parts Issue squared away the car was fixed. I was shown the work that was done and it was all   very well done and I was and am very pleased.

I will take my vehicle again and I would say to you that if you have a air cooled VW take it there and you will be treated very very well.
Hope this helps

name: zmthornton
text:
These mechanics are very knowledgable and capable of tackling difficult/unique issues.

Patience and financial flexibility can play in with the overall experience because they are a small local shop. They aren't going to budge on price, but if you can be patient with them, they are good at being accommodating when issues arise. For instance, my 31 year old Land Cruiser FJ60 was brought to them to do an extensive AC overhaul. Their estimates seemed a bit on the high side, but again, they are very knowledgable and reasonable mechanics who want to "get it right the first time." They also never charged me for my truck occupying their space for over a week while waiting for parts to arrive, which was nice.

The "Ya get what ya pay for" adage plays in here, as they will help tackle tough issues and see them through til the end. Being a smaller shop that specializes in imports, there are going to be shops around that would do the same work for less money. However, chances are that you might not find the same level of knowledgable and thorough mechanic work.

name: Lou Charlton
text: First of all, I had been looking for a car like this for months.  I was on vacation in OB and looked a little online in that area.  I bypassed looking at this particular car because of the color.  Still not seeing what I really wanted, I did read about this car.  It had all the bells and whistles I wanted.  I contacted the dealership, and promptly, Ben reached out to me.  This was the best car buying experience I've had.  He drove the car down to OB so I could look at it.  On our way home, we stopped by his dealership and finalized the sale.  He even made arrangements to have the car delivered to me at my home arriving two days after shipped in perfect condition.  Even the delivery man, who was so friendly , talked about how Ben was a very nice guy.  We love the it and the COLOR is beautiful on this car.  So far, we have not driven much but it's so smooth.  Even tho we are over 500 miles away, we are not past reaching out to Ben for future car needs.   Again, thank you Ben, it was a great ending to a wonderful vacation!

name: Brenda Douglas
text: i was told 0ne price for a vehicle and and was later told 2000 dollars more without another cost included just said he made a mistake who does that there's something dishonest about this dealership

resp.text: Ms Douglas asked our salesman the price on a van in inventory, that she had seen online, and was clearly marked on our website; our salesman mis-quoted the price, standing in the parking lot,  off the top of his head,  and immediately said he needed to verify the price online, which was marked $2,000 more...It was an honest mistake, and we regret this customer can't understand that mistakes happen..We tried to rectify the mistake as soon as we could.

name: Mary Lou Bradley
text: I would be very careful when buying a car from here. We bought my daughter a BMW. He and his wife seemed honest people. He spoke of having a strong faith. Shortly after buying the car, the 1st trip on the Interstate, we started having trouble with the car. We have had the car for a year and have replaced many parts on the car & have found out recently that the car is badly flawed. We have completely lost all the money we paid for this car for my daughter. She has cried many tears knowing we have to get her a new car & we don’t have the money, right now to get her a new car. It has been just terribly nauseating and upsetting. My advice is any car you think about buying from here, have a mechanic check it out before buying. Jordan Automotive in Daphne is a great place & he is honest. He doesn’t care if the dealer gets mad. He works for his clients. Doesn’t want his customers to get screwed over like we did.

resp.text: Mary Lou, I am sorry you had a bad experience with the BMW, we had the car checked out before you bought it, and there were no issues, I wish you would have let me know when you first began to have problems. Since we don’t have a crystal ball, we always suggest an extended warranty when buying a high mileage BMW..I am sorry for your trouble with that car, that was not our intent.

name: Jep Hill
text:
Friendly salesman & decent price.

Took my vehicle in for its first oil change to find out it hadn’t been serviced adequately prior to me purchasing. I put 3k miles on the vehicle over 6 months, and found out the oil was so low (no leaks, either) the engine already needed to be flushed. The engine also makes a noise when starting, and I’ve found out the fix is $2,500+.

You may get a good price on a vehicle from Sport Center, but, in my experience, you may not get a reliable, well-maintained vehicle to last the long-haul.

name: A Google User
text: Last week I purchased my third vehicle from Sport Center Imports. When I bought my first vehicle in 2009, I was in my mid-twenties. I had been to several dealership prior to meeting Ben and Gayle Mayfield. To this day, 10 years later I remember the condescending and patronizing interaction from several of our local dealerships.  I was once naive and financially inexperienced. I was intimidated by the large dealerships and the ‘tactics’ they employed. I felt like I was being taken advantage of, looking back, I know I was. I’ve grown up now and I know what I am doing. Still, if Sport Center Imports is in business I won’t purchase from anywhere else. It might sound odd to completely trust a car salesman, but I do.  Every time I leave their lot in my new vehicle I’m amazed at the fairness and transparency with which they operate. I’ve recommended Sport Center Imports to countless family members and friends over the years. I never miss a chance to tell someone about the positive experiences I’ve had with them. They’ve earned my loyalty and if you give them a try, you’ll no doubt feel the same way I do.

name: A Google User
text: Saw it, bought it, love it!!!  Ben & Gayle are truly the best at what they do!  No hassle, no hidden fees, NO BS!  Easiest, no pressure vehicle purchasing experience I have ever had.  The pricing, ease of financing, and extended warranty offers are unbelievable, worth every penny and their professionalism and friendliness are PRICELESS!  Thanks again Ben & Gayle,  you definitely have a client for life  when it comes to buying top quality, and low pricing on vehicles!

resp.text: Thanks for the props Dean ! We were more than happy to help guide you through the maze, without the disorientation often associated with vehicle purchases...I enjoyed getting to know you ! Thanks Again. ( By the Way, You Look GREAT in that R/T !! )

text:

text: This was my 1st car buying experience and I have to say I don't regret it a bit! There was no pressure of me buying a vehicle. The process was smooth and fast!

name: A Google User
text: My husband and I have purchased several cars from sport center imports and have been more than pleased. They have gone out of their way to get us the exact car we wanted. They have excellent customer service and gave us a great deal!  We have always had an amazing experience and would refer them to anyone who was looking for a new vehicle.

name: A Google User
text: I purchased a car from this dealership a couple of weeks ago.  The dealer was honest about the car. I even took it to a local mechanic after purchase to have it checked and they told me the car was in excellent condition.  The dealer even went out of his way to drive the car to Mississippi after I purchased it, because I was uncomfortable driving to Alabama alone to pick it up, as I had recently been in a wreck. In addition, I was late on the first day I went to look at it,  and he stayed late so I could view the car.  I was really appreciative of the extra time he took for me and my family, love the car I bought, and I highly recommend this dealership to anyone!

name: A Google User
text: Have purchased 2 cars in the past from Ben and Gayle.  Just purchased 2 more on Saturday.  Great people and fantastic selection.  I found the vehicles on the lot that my daughter and I were looking for.  The went over and above on helping me purchase the vehicles that I wanted. Thanks again!

name: A Google User
text: My husband and I had the WORST car-buying experience we have EVER had! We bought a 2015 Chevrolet Tahoe(with around 29,000 miles and some warranty left on it) from them that had been wrecked...twice. Even though this was on the car fax, this information was not disclosed to us. We hear a noise in the rear of the vehicle, so we took it to a local Chevrolet dealership. We were told that the vehicle had been wrecked, not fixed completely, and unsafe for my children and myself to be traveling in. We were advised to contact the dealer first and give them the opportunity to make it right. Sport Center Imports wanted us to bring them the vehicle and let them have another Chevrolet dealer take a look at it. We were given a vehicle to drive and was under the impression that they were going to do everything they could to make it "right". We sought legal advise. We were advised not to accept the vehicle after they had their mechanics look at it, but give them two options... either find us one that was comparable, or buy it back from us. About a week later, one of the owners contacted us to let us know the Tahoe was fixed...it was just a coil spring that needed to be repaired.  Once we explained that we did NOT want this Tahoe, and this was not we had paid all this money for, we were told they would find us one comparable. So once again, we were under the impression they were going to make it right. When they found us another one, it had over 36,000 miles which meant no warranty....BUT we decided to go ahead and purchase it and put it all behind us (after having it looked at by our own mechanics). They agreed to pay the first one off (as a trade-in), and turn around and finance the second one. They did. However,  a couple weeks later, we got a call from the owner letting us know that a payment was late on the first Tahoe (that we traded back in to them BEFORE the first payment was due) and that he didn't want it to damage our credit. We needed to pay it and he would pay the rest of the Tahoe off. Once again, we had to threaten to get a lawyer. We had to contact the credit union to explain what was happening and that we didn't want our credit ruined. It has been a long, drawn out mess! Instead of doing the right thing to begin with, we had to continuously fight with these people to get anything done.  Now they have this very same Tahoe listed on their website.I am warning you...if you do not want a headache, I would look elsewhere. I have since peeled their name off of my vehicle and want no part of anything to do with these people anymore!!!

resp.text: Ms Waite, I am so sorry that we could not offer you a satisfying experience.  Once I found out you were unhappy, I did all that I could do to make it right for you; took the original SUV back, gave you a free loaner car, and purchased a new Tahoe for you.  We post a free Carfax on our website on every vehicle offered for sale, for our customers convenience.  We even discounted the price of the new Tahoe to keep your payments the same, after your credit score dropped almost 80 points, which equaled a loss of $2,800 to us.   Once again, I am sorry that we were not able to exceed your expectations....

name: Begrudging Google User
text: I usually don't write reviews but I decided that with my experience with this place that it would only be fair to give these guys their due credit. I have bought a couple of vehicles from Sports Center Imports over the last few years and I have nothing but good things to say. I tend to do my research for months prior to purchasing and have a really solid idea of pricing and what to look for in a used vehicle purchase. I watch inventory like a hawk at several dealers in a few areas to get an idea of what is available even before I ever go into buy a vehicle in case I have to play a bit of hardball. Well, I have never had to play hardball with these guys, they have never given me even the slightest issue getting vehicle I am looking for at the price range I have in mind. It's never taken me more than an hour or two to get everything taken care of and out the door. They are one of the two (the other closed down due to the owner retiring) used car dealerships that I would be okay with quite literally walking around with a blindfold on, pointing in a random direction, and buying whichever vehicle I pointed at and knowing I wouldn't have an issue.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the Kudo ! Our entire business model has been built on giving customers a positive vehicle buying experience, and EXCEEDING expectation each and every time....Thanks for your business....

resp.text: Vera, I am so sorry to hear, through google,  that you had issues with your truck, I wish you would have called and let us know, we may could have help steer you in the right direction.  Franchise dealership service departments do want to "FIX" anything, only "REPLACE" Everything.  I had that truck inspected at the time it was traded in, and I personally drove it to KY and back and had no issues what so ever.  I wish I had a crystal ball so I could see what the future is in regards to the vehicles we sell, but I do not.  All we can do is try and make them as front line ready to go as possible,  while maintaining the fact that it is a used a vehicle. Once again Vera, I am sorry that you had issues with your truck, and I do wish that you would have notified us sooner.

text: If I could give this place a 0 star I would. The car I bought was a minivan mazda mpv.  We wanted to get it to use it for a new business we wanted to open. Our budget was limited indeed, but I was expecting that a mazda mpv with almost 200k at $2800 to be working just fine at least for a while, especially when you GET IT FROM A DEALER. We took it for a drive test, and nothing seemed wrong with it. The mechanic they have it on site, looked at it and said the car was just fine. We explicitly told the salesperson that we need a CAR THAT RUNS AND DRIVES WELL. About 10 minutes after I left the dealer,  the power steering started to act very weird , becoming very hard to keep the car straight. At any moment I could've make an accident or worse. We took it to a shop, and we were told that we need to invest at least $4000 to fix just the problem with the power steering, let alone the other problems with the engine that appeared after. I don't know if someone from the dealership turned the check engine light off, but the guys at the shop discovered at least 5 check engine codes. Moreover, when the time came to go to DMV and get it registered, they tried to bypass the law and make me pay the whole registration fee(the fee was supposed to be included in the car price)  saying that " I have a Georgia driver's license" and they can't do anything about it". I called the salesperson back  within 5 days of the car purchase,  and I was told that the car was sold "AS-IS". Dear friends, BEWARE of this place. I lost all the money I wanted to invest in a small business i wanted to open with that junk car.  They only sell OVERPRICED JUNK YARD CARS.  The car I purchased doesn't even sell for $1000 now.

name: Alec Hadley
text:
On September 10, 2020, my car broke down right outside Chatom AL. I sent my car that was under warranty to Chatom Ford. That was one of my worst mistakes possible. The first week of their service was promising. After that it was all down hill. Shade the “Service Manager” was my main point of contact. He would promise me updates and call backs which I would never get a returning call. On October 16th I was PROMISED my car was repaired and ready for pick up. As I had two friends take off work to take me 5.5 hours to Chatom Ford, Shade called me and said “the car jumped time and is not ready”. The following day I called to get the new date  I could expect my car to be repaired.  Shade then tells me that he had been lying to me and my car was not ready and he does not know why my car is not fixed nor when it could be fixed. During this call he also promised me that the car would be sent to my house in Tennessee. After Shade continued to lie about my car and repairing it, I then moved to speaking with Collin Ward (General Manager)-  I only spoke with him once because he told me “ I’m sure what you are saying MAY have happened, but im sure my team has a better way of going about this story”. He also promised I would get a call back from him and I never did. Collin also asked me why I would even send my car here with it being out of state and not send it local (I was on my way back from vacation on the coast when it happened). In my opinion, this should not matter. With no hope, I called asking for the owner, Gene Brown. No one would help me reach him. Then I finally received a call from Kevin O’Brien. He was very promising and reassuring at first as they all were. Kevin worked with my father and I for about two weeks then he stated to not take our calls or call us back as promised. Last, my father began to work with Lara. She was helpful in helping us know what was going on. She is who we worked with for the rest of this mayhem. 99 days later on December 18th Chatom Ford met me in Mississippi to give me my car. This dealership is an ACTUAL JOKE. From day one I asked for nothing but updates and I never once got that. NOT ONE WORKER AT THIS PLACE (I say place because I can not call this a business because this place has no business structure at all.) was truthful in customer service to my father or myself. If anyone at this place has any further questions feel free to contact me as you have my name and number. PLEASE SAVE YOUR MONEY AND TIME BY NOT SENDING YOUR CAR HERE. THIS MANAGEMENT IS A JOKE AND ABSOLUTELY WORTHLESS IN THEIR PROFESSION.
Thank you for the worst Ford experience I could ever ask for. You really make a name for yourself.

name: Cassella Scott
text: I believe Jim Burke doesn't care about customer service or customer appreciation because when you come in to the service department to get maintenance on your vehicle, the staff will avoid you like you had the plague when you approach them for help. It's like you almost have to stand in the middle of the floor and yell " CAN I GET SOME HELP IN HERE PLEASE!!!". Staff in the service department will just sit behind their little desks and won't even acknowledge that you are in there until you get right in their face and tell them you need service. Maybe they are trained to be that way because customer service is only as good as the people who manage and run the company. Dreadfully, when your vehicle goes to the back to be serviced, be prepared bring breakfast, lunch and dinner with you because you're stuck and at the mercy of Jim Burke service department. I had a staff member to tell me it will take about an hour and a half for an oil change and it turned to three and a half hours. I asked a staff member how long before my vehicle is finished in two hours. The staff member check and he told me it was still on the rack. At the last service appointment, my vehicle sat on the street when they finished with the doors unlocked for I don't know how long after service and I had to hunt down a staff member to get my keys. No one came to the waiting room to let me know my vehicle was ready. And that side of town in Birmingham has vehicles broken into all the time. So let me end this rant by saying there needs to be some checks and balances of the staff at Jim Burke service department because customer service is little to none there.

name: Angelica Dill
text:
I just started leasing a Subaru Impreza sport about two months ago. I had a flat tire on a Friday afternoon so I called Jim Burke right away thinking they could help me. When I called, I asked them if they have the tire in stock and when they could get me in but the guy on the phone kept saying “I’m not sure”, “ I might have to order it” “maybe you could come in...”. I asked him if he could check his inventory because I really needed my car for work Monday. He told me to call back the next morning. I re-explained to him that I really needed to figure this out because I drive for work and needed my car situated by Monday.
I called Saturday morning - he said they didn’t have the tire in stock and they’d have to order it. Then he asked me repeatedly what tire I had and I told him multiple times what was written on the tire. He called back several more times to confirm what the tire was. Then he said he didn’t know when the tire would be in, maybe Tuesday or Wednesday.
I called Monday morning to see if they had any update on when the tire would come in but the service department didn’t answer. Then I called someone that I had been in contact with in the leasing department. They tried to get a hold of someone in service. By the end of the day the only thing they could tell me is that they didn’t know when the tire would be in because the guy who helped me Saturday was not in. I emphasized that I really needed my car for work and that I’d been driving on a spare. They said they’d  probably have a loaner car to give me on Tuesday but they’d have to get back with me in the morning.
Tuesday - I heard nothing all day. No updates about my tire. Heard nothing back about the loaner. Finally I called someone in the leasing department again around 3 and they said “no ones called you yet??”
By the time the guy finally got back with me he said he hasn’t been able to locate the loaner that it “disappeared”, he didn’t know why so many people were involved in this, and that the tire was still not in and he didn’t know when it would come.  I told him that I was frustrated and I needed either a tire or a loaner. He said if he would have known this Friday he would have given me a loaner............

Wednesday morning I was finally able to pick up a loaner car and then my tire came in and I picked up my car Thursday.

Not sure why I had to chase down this guy. He couldn’t tell me straight whether they carried the tire on the car that I leased from them. And his problem solving skills were just not there. The whole experience was frustrating and now I’m not looking forward to ever getting my car serviced there - especially if I have to work with this guy every time.

resp.text: We're extremely sorry to hear of the poor experience that you had with our service department. This is not typical behavior and this is not how we conduct business as a company. There is no reason that it should have taken that long for you to recieve any answers and we truly apologize for that. Please contact the service manager, Rusty, by calling 205-324-3371 and explain to him exactly what took place. We would love the opportunity to make things right and to earn back your trust in us!

name: Steffany Heacox
text: I brought my 2016 Jeep Patriot in for a wheel speed sensor. I had a 9:30 appointment. I arrived at 9 am with my 3 year old in tow. Simple right? At 11:30 they finally let me know it wasn't going to be warranty as we were out of the mileage range, which was incorrect, and was able to be corrected, and that the part was across town. Around 12:30 they come back in to let me know he was going to go get it from the Hoover dealer or it would be 3:30 or so before it was delivered. Here we sit at 3:30. FOR A SIMPLE WHEEL SPEED SENSOR!! THis waiting room is less than comfortable and with a three year old leaving and coming back with the escort service is not an option (car seat!?), there are no changing tables for diapers in ANY bathroom, no water in the cooler available even though I've asked 3 employees now, and no one has asked if the kid needs a snack! What if I hadn't packed any? Or didn't have cash for the very small selection in the vending machine? And the tv is stuck on old westerns. You can't change it. I've asked two employees sitting outside, both of which have said just a minute and never came in! Get it together Jim Burke. This is the WORST service we have ever gotten from a Jeep dealer. EVER. We will not be back at this rate.

resp.text: We would like to apologize for the type of service that you received and thank you for taking the time to inform us of your less than pleasant visit. There is no excuse for the lack of communication that you received as there are none to give. We do apologize for that and have addressed that directly with the staff along with the lack of assistance in getting water and TV changed. We have received feedback from other customers as well about changing stations in the bathrooms and we are working on that now to be more accommodating for all. We understand that it was a wheel speed sensor, which is a simple repair, that was delayed due to not having the part in stock. However, this should have and could have been communicated better in order to lessen the time that it took to go get the part or offer better options for you. We try and make each visit as comfortable and accommodating to each customer as much as possible and we obviously dropped the ball with your visit. We hope that you accept our sincerest apologies and trust the fact that we are addressing these issues so that you will give us another chance to earn your trust in the future.

Overall I believe that there are some good mechanics here; however they don't consider the overall customer experience. They are short handed so, you won't get a status of what's going on, the shuttle service ends at three and if your car is or isn't ready before then- no one calls you. When you call them, you aren't likely to get an answer or a call back. My car sit there for more than 24 hours ready, with nothing more to do to it, but because of miscommunication - I guess no one figured I needed a car within that time period. I don't know the thought processes behind this, no one figured I would need to make plans to get to and from work maybe that's why I couldn't get status on my vehicle.

I was guaranteed my issue was taken care of and I was told it was road tested for the shaking I was experiencing. Well, guess what- still shaking and I had to take it back to the dealership to get it finally resolved. So thanks for the tire balance, and the effort to save me money, but my initial issue was still there when I left.

text: There was one or two things that I was unsatisfied with. There was approximately 5 people and head of me all of those people what scene before me and that wasn't the problem when it got to me that was two people came in after me and they were seen as well before me I asked the gentleman had he heard anything about my car then he stated to me what the problem was and he was about to let me know what my problem was I let that go I went back to work he said he was going to call me when my car got ready but I had to call back down to Jim Burke someone else told me that my car was ready when I got back there then he initially told me that my car was ready I thought procedures were to call me to let me know that my car was ready if I had to call back I don't know if he had to call me or when he would have called me to let me know my car was ready I just didn't like that type of service but I got there to get my car he told me that I had they have fix the wire problem but the panel that the wire connect to might go bad so I may have the same problem over again I feel like if that was the case he should have told me that before I had that fixed if that was the problem I would have had the wiring and the harness fixed

resp.text: We apologize that you were left dissatisfied with your visit. As far as people coming in and out either ahead or after you it is difficult to comment as to why because we offer multiple services through multiple auto manufactures that have quick service options like Oil changes, filter replacements, etc. Your vehicle was in for an electrical diagnosis which can take more time. It appears that there was an issue with the wiring harness, which was repaired, also a possibility of another issue with the third brake light that would have resulted from the wiring harness short. When the third brake light was tested at the time of service it tested good, but had symptoms that could result in a possible failure in the future. However, we could not definitively say that it had failed and wouldn’t want to sell anything that is not needed. The estimate that was provided on your receipt was discounted to absorb the labor cost in the event it did fail at a later date keeping you from paying double labor. As far as contacting you when the vehicle was completed it is our practice to stay in constant contact as discussed with the customer and to contact once the vehicle is complete. We do not show the specifics as to when you were contacted but do have that the vehicle was completed around 12:00 p.m. If you were not contacted promptly or at all when the vehicle was completed we will address that directly with the advisor that assisted you. Again we apologize that you received less than an ideal service visit. We hope that you can give us the opportunity to make your future visits much better."

text: I was referred to Jim Burke Pre-Owned Supercenter by a very good friend, and she said I should ask for Terry Skinner. I made a visit on 01/09/17. He asked what were my top 3 cars, my wants, what I didn't want, car note range and down payment amount. He ran with it from there.  He did above and beyond my expectations, and I will be a repeat customer of Terry Skinner and refer my friends and family. He was able to put me in a 2015 Nissan Altima 3.5 SL, and you wouldn't believe it if I told you how much I am saving monthly as my car not was almost cut in half. name: tracy mccall
text:
My experience with the representative at Jim Burke Pre-Owned Super Center was phonominal. We are not newbies at Jim Burke.  Actually we vowed to never do business with them again due to an experience in the Nissan new car department we had in 2013.  The agent we initially dealt with was not thorough and didn't really seem to be interested in satisfying us, but instead wanted to just sell a car. My husband knew what he was looking for. The only reason we purchased the car was because it was exactly what I wanted.  Leading up to my retirement,  my husband,  Mike wanted to surprise me with my dream car which was an infinity Q50. Just so happened,  he observed the vehicle on the internet. Now from my understanding,  he wasn't looking to get it from them but more so wanted to see how the agents intentions for their customers' would be like. He made communication with Mr. JONTÉ WILLIAMS.  Well apparently Mr. Williams knows how to deal with hard rock minds like my husband.  Mike is a straight up business man who looks for people to hang themselves once he's had bad experiences with them but this was the case. Jonté was very professional but also displayed a great people oriented level of customer relation and appreciation.  Mike told me that Jonté was not pushy and that he was all about making sure I was happy with my retirement gift. When my husband told me what was going on, I did everything I could to make it known that I didn't want to go over there but when my husband said he was working with Jim Burke again,  I  knew it had to be ok. Well upon actually meeting Mr. Williams, I  observed him to be a very confident man in his spirit.  He is very comfortable with people such as my husband and when I saw them laughing and talking,  I  knew he, Mr. Williams, was trustworthy of giving our time and business to him. Jonté relating to me reminded me of a non paternal big brother I have. He kept me laughing but at the same time he took the time to make sure that I was comfortable with the decision to accept the infinity Q50. Donté really took care of us and put our mindset at ease when it came to purchasing future vehicles from Jim Burke. We would defiantly refer others to your business. Thank you Jonté for your professionalism,  and I look forward to seeing you again.

Tracy McCall and Michael McCall

text: If I could do no stars I would. My husband and I went to this place to buy a truck. He had a 2006 Ram out there that my husband called several days before about... We drive out to look at the truck, then ended up buying it. The owner I forgot his name went on and on about how people wanting the truck. He (the owner) so called said ‘’oh I fixed it up and it’s a good running truck and this and that.’’ The truck was in bad shape we had to fix what he tried to fix.. but that’s not the bad part about it... The truck he sold us has a REBUILT title. Not once did he mention this to us, after all the calls he received from my husband. This should have been told to us from the beginning!!! A HORRIBLE WAY OF RUNNING A BUSINESS.

text: if i could give this place ZERO stars i would,hes a con man, make sure you check the drivers door frame for a Alabama rebuilt sticker, most of the cars and trucks i looked at had rebuilt titles, that means they have ben wrecked and fixed with salvaged parts, i asked him about 1 truck if it had been wrecked,underwater,or beat up, he said no, then i seen the sticker, HE FLAT DOWN RIGHT LIED, that was about the only words i got out of him, i wrote down the vin,checked it at the court house, they ran it, that truck was under water and stuffed with mud,smashed up front end, he wouldnt tell e that at all even when i asked him, so, make darn sure you check the car.truck out good, run the vin if have any dought, later i asked afew people about him, 1 bought a truck from him , he didnt check it , found out it had a rebuilt title, was wrecked in the front end, that truck lasted almost 6 months , engine went out, seems there was a crack in the front of the block with jb weld on it,

text: Went by yesterday to look at a car , and the guy was VERY UNFRIENDLY (we think its because we are black). My husband went inside to get the key , instead of handing him the key he unlocked the car with the keyless entry , then my husband asked to start it up, that's when he placed the key in his hand. My husband got in started the car and the guy still hasn't said a word the car was rattling as my husband shift the gears, the salesman stood there sucking on a straw drinking a beverage.  Finally my husband handed him the keys back and he then said ok. Up until then I thought he couldn't speak , and what is hilarious he had on a church if the highlands t-shirt.  He was representing Christ and being ignorant.  Needless to say they didn't get a sale from us. We both said if the engine purred like a kitten we still wouldn't have spent any money there.

name: Tina Lowe
text:
I would like to thank the family at adam rue auto sales for helping me get the car I wanted with the rate and payment I wanted. Unlike the big dealership across the street.  Im new to the area and haven't had my own car in three years due to a divorce.  I have good credit but hadn't used it in the three years since ive been here.  Plus i got remarried and had no credit activity in my new name.  I told the big dealer across the street I was looking for a low rate with a payment no more than 300 a month.   The best they said they could do was 17% and 400 mo. For a car I didnt like.  I told them my past rates had been about 6%. They actually laughed and said that wasn't going to happen since I haven't used my credit in 3 years and that I was basically a ghost. Adam rue had the perfect car that i absolutely  love, got me a 6.57% rate and 289 monthly pymt. Thanks to you I now have credit in my new name.  You gave it your all, above and beyond. I was more that just a high money making rate.  You have been a blessing and have made a life time customer which is worth more than 17%.
Thank you, God bless

name: Stephanie Wilson
text: I had a great experience at Credit Now Auto Sales, I'll try not to make this too long because there are so many great points to make. My salesperson was Thad and when I arrived I was promptly greeted but no one was being pushy. They let me take my time to look it over, take pictures, make calls, and when I asked to test drive and take to my mechanic to look it over they encouraged I do that. I loved the vibe at the dealership, it was very lively and fun and eased my nerves.The manager was engaging and made sure we were taken care of and offered a lot of helpful advice. The lady in accounting thoroughly explained everything in a way that was easy to understand, and it was quick too! All I needed was proof of income, proof of address, drivers license, and a few references plus a down payment to get me going. Topping on the cake was they filled the tank up and included a 6,000 mile warranty at no extra charge! I'm a proud owner of an F250 pick up truck now!!!

name: Idealia Cleveland
text:
All of the bad reviews on this website are accurate. People write bad reviews for reason. I saw all of the great reviews here and I figured that this would be a decent place to purchase a vehicle for rebuilding credit. However, I was wrong. All of the bad reviews here are accurate. I've even waited 9 days to post this review because I didn't want to do it out of anger. I wanted to make sure that I am not in my emotions and being fair about what I am saying. I do not take any pleasure in writing this bad review.

I was strung along from this company for 18 days. I needed a vehicle because I had just come in town from across the country. These people claimed that I was going to put down $1200 for a 2006 Escalade. I never said that I was going to put down that much. I also have a call recorder app on my phone that records EVERY CALL. I went back and reviewed those calls and never in any of those audio's did I ever say that I was going to put down that much. As a matter of fact, I asked Jennifer specifically, "About how much are my payments going to be?" The only thing that was discussed was that it would be $175 every 2 weeks.

They went ahead "processed" My application. Jennifer came back and let me know that I was approved. However, the vehicle had several different issues that they needed to fix. Jennifer told me that it had to be put in the shop and that they didn't want me to have it in that condition. At the same time other customers, that had already purchased vehicles from this dealership, were bringing cars back because they were having issues with them. This was a major red flag for me. I kept getting put to the back burner because other people were bringing their cars back that they purchased from there, that needed to be fixed. I said that twice y'all. Think about that.

In the meantime, I didn't have a car and needed to get around. I asked Jennifer for a loaner, and she said they were "reluctant" to give me one because I'd be expecting that level of service all the time. But they wanted to get my business, so they provided me with an ugly Kia. It was ugly, but at least I could get to Walmart, ya know?

They finally got the Escalade fixed and ready by July 10th. Dave called me and let me know that it was ready. I drove the ugly Kia back to them. When I got there, I test drove the Escalade. I didn't like how bad the inside looked, but it's a 2006. There's obviously going to be a lot of wear and tear. Tracy asked me how much I was going to put down? I told her $500. She told me that Jennifer told her that we had already discussed the down payment. I told her no, she did not discuss that with me. The only thing that was discussed was the $175 every 2 weeks.

So of course they went and called Jennifer. And of course, they came back and told me that she said she discussed that with me. They would not be able to accept anything less than $1000. And then very callously, Tracy told Dave, "Take her home." I said, "Damn, y'all not even trying to work with me?" Nope. I didn't argue. I just gave them the key back and Dave drove me home apologizing.

I emailed them the audio proving what was said, and got crickets. They were caught in a lie.

Last week, I needed to get to the VA....I am a disabled veteran. It is important that if I need medical care, I have a way to get there so that I can receive what I need. I did not have a vehicle to get my medical care. I don't think these people even thought of how this was going to affect me. But something that I have learned is that if you are constantly being blocked for something, then spiritually, you are being blocked and protected for reason. And I think that I may have dodged a bullet with these people.

So everyone, please heed this warning. ALL of these bad reviews that are on here are here for a reason. I'm not bashing these people, I'm just stating the facts.

I hope that this never happens to any of them or their loved ones.

Patronize this business at your own risk.

text: There’s simply not enough positive things to say about CNAS. From the great customer service and sales team at Credit Now to their interaction with you after they sale is completed. They are genuinely great people. Truly a humble group and a rare find in the car sales industry. The phrase ‘used car salesman’ is seldom used as a compliment, but this is the one place that in all my adult years, I never expected to find. They do everything in their power to work with you. From your budget, to the table, they never rushed us for a sale or pushed us for more money, and have always stood behind their word. There truly is no other dealership in the greater Huntsville area, that compares. Call and ask for Mike, he’s a true standup guy! I am happy to call New Car Auto Sales, MY dealership and I hope you will too.

text: Recently saw a car we were interested in and emailed Chase for details. This was the kind of car buying experience you want to have.  We would recommend Eastern Shore Auto Brokers to anyone looking for a good vehicle for a fair price.  We will do business with Chase again when we are in the market. for another vehicle.

text: I had been searching for a decent pick up truck within my budget and found it at Eastern Shore Auto Brokers. The price was fair. text: 5 stars all the way. Chase came out last minute in the pouring rain on a Saturday to let us test drive half the cars on the lot. Every car was in fantastic condition. He has each vehicle checked out by a third party mechanic and REFUSES to sell vehicles he finds problems with. He worked with us on financing and the next time we need a vehicle, we’re going straight to Eastern Shore Auto Brokers.

resp.text: Thank You for the kind words!! Please let us know if we can help in the future!!

text: What a great car buying experience. I hate being at the dealer for hours and negotiating with a person that has no authority at all and always has to go ask for permission. resp.text: Thank you so much Jason!! It was a pleasure getting to know you and your family!!

text:
I recently had the best car buying experience of my life, and felt I had to share it so that others could see that purchasing a car doesn’t have to be a stressful combative process.

Chase take a vastly different approach. Haggle-free, low price points on beautiful car, friendly interaction that felt more like conversing with old friend. I honestly couldn’t be happier with my new car.

By the way, I got here from Chicago. Chase was holding a car for me for a few days even it had a high demand. I highly recommend these guys!

I have had a couple very minor issues with the car since I bought it, but that's just because it is an older car and things happen. I definitely recommend to always have a car inspected before buying it, just to be safe. But this place is overall a very reliable place to buy a car from.

text: A great place to get a used vehicle. The owner is very nice and is very fair with everyone he deals with. If you need a vehicle this is the place to get it! I'm glad that I did business with him.

name: Dan Turner
text: First let me say that the owner is one of my best friends and I have bought from him myself and have seen, first hand how he runs this business. This isn't a typical used car lot.  He's extremely forthcoming about ANY issue a vehicle may have in his listings and in person should you visit his lot. If it's got scratches or dents worth noting, there are pics of them in the ad. Small issues are even noted in ads. He's quite literally one of the most honest people I've ever known.  If it's a mechanic special, he'll tell you, it's a mechanic special.  If it's a good car, he'll tell you it's a good car. He drives everything on his lot for 2 weeks or more before ever listing it to ensure it's got no issues.  If it needed repairs to be a safe, good running vehicle, it's been done.  I'm still driving the car bought a year ago almost daily. If you need a good car at a  great price, give him a call today!

name: Jay Q
text: I visited this dealer and decided to purchase an impala. Two and a half miles after leaving this lot the vehicle ran hot and then completely died. There was absolutely no oil in it and no water in the radiator. After putting oil in it, immediately I noticed the oil was leaking out. I did test drive before I bought it but the dealer told me that since it didn't have gas in it that I should only go up the block and back. THAT SHOULD'VE BEEN A RED FLAG! They made sure the was no fluids in it to avoid buyers noticing leaks at the lot and no gas to ensure a potential buyer couldn't test drive it long enough for it to run hot. Even though they did give my money back, I had to pay for a tow truck and go through this ordeal. THIS PLACE SCAMS BUYERS! Never again will I patron this place!

I have dealt with Langford Quality Cars for about 23 years now. I have fond them to be very understanding when I was sick and had to have surgery, I let them know I could not afford to keep the truck I had they came and picked it up then when I got out of the hospital and was able to return to work they sold me another truck with no down payment.
Janet has always been understanding if people would call and let her know they were getting behind because of losing a job or some kind of illness. I have always known her to work with people if they gave here the respect of letting her know what was happening.
The people I hear talking bad about them are the ones who don't call and move. Or hide their cars then they get mad and badmouth her and the business.I have also noticed most of those people have a history of trying to keep from paying for what they buy from anyone and according to them it is always the business or the people that work there that cause the problem. But really it is just the customers going from place to place trying to beat businesses out of their merchandise without paying for it.

THANK YOU LANGFORD I HAVE ENJOYED OUR LONG ASSOCIATION. AND LOOK FORWARD TO MANY MORE YEARS.

name: Brittney E
text: I took my Escalade to the service dept to get work done on it. They miss diagnosed it and I paid over $500.00 for repair. I had my truck 2 days before it started doing the same thing again. I called to let them know and got the vehicle back over to them. They had my truck a little over a week and claim it was not doing anything for them and that it was old codes showing up. Well since I have had my vehicle back it once again started doing the same thing showing up the same codes. I decided to take it to another dealership and to my surprise the codes that they told me was old was not old they just cleared them instead of fixing my truck. I'm very upset because they repeatedly lied to me over and over. I will not recommend the service dept at all. Either way, they gave me a note of encouragement that every mom needs sometimes with a gift card for coffee. The second time: I requested a larger loaner vehicle which is apparently hard to come by. Along with my 3 kids, my dad is in a wheelchair and I transport him to/from dialysis and we just all wouldn't fit in the smaller one. They greeted me with a "one tough cookie" box with treats and snacks galore.

They are the nicest people and so accommodating. Add uplifting to that mix. That was this exhausted Mama's gift from heaven.

I can't say enough good things about them. I would buy every vehicle from them a thousand times over just to show my appreciation to their service department. Thanks guys!

I believe that I was blessed with my sales consultant as well! Troy Andrews is that perfect person that you only hope to get whenever you drive into the parking lot of a car dealership! He did not come outside, ever, to hound me. We all hate that whenever it comes time to shop for a car- and they do NOT do that at this dealership! Furthermore, Troy was patient in answering my questions, and always a perfect gentleman! I never felt that I was dealing with a pushy salesman. I'd highly suggest Joe Bullard Cadillac, and if you do not ask for Troy Andrews, you will be missing out!

name: Veronica Eaton
text: I was due for an oil change for my 2012 Cadillac SRX and received a call from the dealership asking me to schedule an appt. I looked online 1st to schedule, there was an appt. available for the next day. I didn't book it, thinking that maybe the person that called would get credit for service. I called her back, and was informed that it would be a week out for the oil change, fine. I also had a secondary issue of getting an estimate for the liftgate actuator replacement. A week later, I take the car in and wait on it. When it was done, I specifically asked about the actuator and was told that the estimate was the paperwork. It wasn't. I called back today to see when I could have this repaired and  was given another appt. a week out. The moral of the story is that they listed 12 things for "recommended services"  but nothing on what I actually requested. The car could have been repaired 10 days ago if I had been given the info that I requested. Now I'm trying to see if I can get my SRX repaired at another dealership either in Pensacola or Gulf Port.

resp.text: Hi Veronica,  I am very sorry to hear about your recent experiece with us. It is our goal to provide each customer with the best service experience possible. We have passed your feedback along to our General Manager and Serivice Manager. With your feedback we can only improve our processes and provide you with the best experience possible.

name: Sherri Herrington
text: By far the absolute best experience I have ever had buying a car. If you are looking for a car please see Michael Sewell. Absolutely fantastic to deal with and I would highly recommend him! The transparency and honesty were a complete change from what I expected. I have an absolute new respect for the Bullard family and their dealerships. Once you walk in there is no doubt that customer satisfaction and the customers experience is higher in the business plan than the numbers are which is not normal operating procedure in most dealerships I could not write enough about how pleased I was with the whole experience. I did not walk out feeling as though a great deal on a vehicle was the only thing I got. I walked out of that dealership with an uplifted spirit and felt through the whole process that I was receiving amazing fellowship and as if I were being edified through this whole process. If God sees fit I will absolutely be a customer for life.They were an absolute inspiration and are a perfect model of a working business  plan that is extremely successful. And I’m not talking only monetarily successful. I left with a fire in me that they helped to burn brighter. And I thank them from the bottom of my heart for allowing God to work through them as they unknowingly ministered to me They never realized it and that’s what makes them special.

name: Douglas Allen
text: What started off as a beautiful experience has turned out to be a nightmare. I purchased what was told to me to be my Certified 2015 Chevrolet Suburban LTZ. Rodney Lofton who is a awesome salesman and Roseevelt Harris the phenomenal finance guy sold me the vehicle and 3mths into my purchased I was told I had over $2k worth of repairs including brakes, new radiator, tune-up, oil cooler lines, and left tie rod end just to name a few. When I asked why wasn't these things serviced and replaced before I purchased the vehicle I was told the repairs wasn't necessary at the time. I feel the salesman did a great job but the service department made it a bad purchase by not doing their job!! I had to pay for the replacement of the radiator and oil cooling lines but the other repairs are still needed. I feel robbed and will probably never purchase from a major dealership like Joe Bullard again!!

resp.text:
Hi Mr. Allen,

Thank you for taking the time to give us this feedback. To make sure this issue is addressed/resolved I have notified the General Manager, Jason Colbert, of the situation and asked that he reached out to you as soon as possible today.

I'm very sorry that your service experience did not mirror your sales experience at our store but I'm confident if there's a way to rectify the issue our team will do so.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M., Marketing Manager

name: Robert Werning
text:
Review of Joe Bullard dealership

My used car purchase was probably a little different than most.  In my case, I needed a good, reliable vehicle as quickly as possible and would immediately be making a 12 hour road trip to a different state as soon as the car was in my possession!  My salesman Curtis Williams showed me what I wanted to see, took the time to answer my questions, and gave me the time to decide if the car was right for me - no "pressure to buy" involved.

Curtis actually delivered the car personally the next day, so that I did not have make another 2 hour trip from Pensacola to Mobile and back to pick up the car!
Overall I would say that I am very satisfied with the service I received at this dealership.  If all their employees are as conscientious as the ones that I dealt with I would not hesitate to recommend this dealer.

text: Allen, my salesman was excellent. He treated me like we were best friends. Very polite and considerate and professional. He went way out of his way, even offered to deliver the car and paperwork to my office so it would not cut into my lunch time. I am 43, and I have never in my life dealt with such a wonderful member of any sales staff. He is the reason I will only purchase vehicles from this dealership. He has my business forever.

text:
We just got our XT4 and are very satisfied with it. Our salesman. Troy was very kind to answer our questions and made sure we understood how things worked.  We were in a time crunch and he assured us that we could come by, call, email or text if we had more questions.
Respect and kindness are almost a lost value in todays society, but to us they are still important, Troy exemplifies these and more in how he serves his customers,
We were  surprised to hear Christian music playing and to hear the testimonies of several of the staff. We thank them for their standing up for the American values and showing that they are truly a family doing business in an honorable way.
Troy, we have put you and your new Bride on our pray list and thank you for not making fun of us older folks that haven't embraced " this tech -infested" world  fully yet.
We will see you this coming week with more ? and to drop off the keys.

name: Willie Johnson
text:
I have purchase many vehicle and I must say that this was one of the most pleasant experiences I have encountered buying a vehicle.  From my internet inquiry I get a phone call from Ms. Ashley Allen, a very pleasant experience.  Ms. Allen set up an appointment for me to see the vehicle I was inquiring about with Mr. Ben Jackson.  From the moment I entered the doors I was greeted and treated as a lifelong customer.  After meeting with Mr. Jackson I was introduce to Mr. Curtis Williams who would be my salesman.

Mr. Williams and I sat down to discuss what I was looking for in the vehicle of my my choice.  Once I had selected the vehicle, Mr. Williams made the test drive a pleasant and unique experience.  After I decided that this was the vehicle that i wanted, he even saw to it that the reasonable minor imperfections that I nit-picked while looking over the vehicle were taken care of prior to my picking up the vehicle.  Negotiating the final price was even an enjoyable experience, which is rare.  I think that at the end of the day we were both happy with the price.  At no time during the experience did I feel pressured or uneasy.

I will highly recommend to anyone that is looking to purchase a new or used vehicle, visit Joe Bullock Cadillac and ask for Mr. Curtis Williams.

Willie Johnson

name: Matt Holloway
text: Terrible! I came in because I had a tail light out and it's one of the newer LED lights that aren't supposed to burn out. They told me to come in at 3 and I would be out by 4. At 4 they had just finished their diagnostic check and they told me it would cost $607 to replace my tail light. I told them to go ahead even though I believed it was too pricey. The rep told me the light costs $500+ and the labor wasnt that much. I started to look up the part online brand new and I could buy 2 for less than what he quoted me. I told him they could stop and I'll bring in the light myself after buying it cheaper elsewhere. He tells me I will still have to pay $135 for the diagnostic. No problem. He comes back and tells me it's already in. I ask well where is my car? He says they're finishing up. 45 minutes later he comes back and tells me that they put a new light in and it didnt work. Must be a wiring issue he said. So I said: "So that $135 diagnostic u tried to charge me for wasn't even accurate? Because the diagnostic claimed I needed a new light." He never did answer. They did change my oil so I paid for my oil change only and went to leave. When I got my car back if was filthy even though they claimed all customers get a complimentary wash with all services. I will never go there again.

resp.text:
Hi Matt,

Thank you for providing us with this valuable feedback. I assure you this is not the Bullard experience we want for our clients.

I have forwarded your comments to the Service Manager, Sean Alexander, as well as the General Manager so that this can be addressed. I’ve also asked for one of them
to contact you to personally discuss in more detail.

I’m sincerely sorry for how your visit with us needed and I hope that we will be able to earn back your business.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M.

name: Julie A
text:
Our family was on vacation in Mobile Alabama this past week. Things didn't go quite as we had planned. Our SUV was cutting out pretty bad on the highway. It was getting worse the closer we got to Mobile. I contacted my friend who's daughter lives in Mobile to see if she might know of a service place. I talked with her daughter and she informed me that her husband, Kyle, worked for Joe Bullard Cadillac. She gave me the number for the service department and said to speak with Haley.  About this time the check engine light came on in our vehicle. It was flashing on and off, then would stay lit.
When I spoke with Haley in the service department she asked about the service engine light. When I told her it had been flashing intermittently she was immediately concerned and said we should get stopped as quickly as we could to avoid internal engine damage.  She then helped us get started with finding a tow service. We were 50 miles aWay and had four people so their usual towing service couldn't do it, but she got the ball rolling for us. She gave me her direct phone number so I could call if I needed anything.
Once we got to the dealership Kyle helped us get a loaner car while ours was being repaired. Haley kept us informed as they learned what was wrong. Our technician, Mike, came in on Saturday to work on our vehicle because we needed to leave to head back to Missouri on Sunday.
To make a long story short...God used all of these people to help us during a difficult time. They made this experience so much less stressful than it could've been. THEY WENT ABOVE AND BEYOND TO HELP US! And, they did it all with a smile. We appreciate the dealership and all the individuals who helped get us back on the road. I would recommend them to anyone who needs service or a new ride!!!

resp.text:
Thank you for your wonderful feedback. We always strive to meet the needs of our customers no matter the situation. Feel free to let us know if you have any concerns about your vehicle.

Kind regards,
Robby Herbert, GM, rherbert@joebullard.com (251)-544-7341

text: My husband & I had ONE day, due to his work schedule, to find a reliable work car for him that was great on gas mileage and did not have too many miles.. but ofcourse stayed in a decent price range because, again, it was going to be a “work” car. Thank you to Joe Bullard & staff (especially Simmie who helped us) for making it a great experience buying our “first vehicle” as a married couple! I hope to be back soon when I convince my husband to let me extend the size of my SUV!!! ;)

text: I bought a 2008 Tahoe used from Joe Bullard Cadillac. It had only 63,000 miles on it when purchased. I have now had it almost 2 years and it has just hit 207,000. I have solely had it serviced here, and couldn't be more happy with their service. Today I didn't even have an appointment, and the service staff knows how much I drive, and they put my truck FIRST in line for the ASAP oil change! Best staff and atmosphere you can find.

resp.text: Thank you for your great review! We're thrilled to hear how much you appreciate our top-level service at Joe Bullard Cadillac. Our entire team is committed to providing the highest quality of service for you and your vehicle. We can't wait to see you and your Tahoe again - we're always here to help!

I bought a used 2015 Ford mustang cash, about a month ago they gave me the run around of delivering the car, they said one day then another day until I had to go get the car myself over 180 miles away. I had other issues also that I dont want to write on here. I wouldn't go back there again.

She said when she graduates from college and gets her next car, she's buying it from Mr. Roosevelt, he's like family to her now :)

I hope you can let them know how much we appreciate them and please do something extra special for Roosevelt (my daughter's request).

Thanks!

name: Jami Morgan
text: The people in the service department handling my claim were very nice. What I didn't like was that the mechanics were excessively rough with my vehicle. I had to have it towed and the towing company left it at the gate. Christian got me a loaner car, which I appreciated very much. When I picked up the loaner there were 2 guys who were trying to get it started to get it up to the shop. I needed to grab a couple things out of my car so I stopped to do that. For some reason they needed to open the back hatch. I was traveling with my animals so I had a large kennel in the back. I watched them put my seats down (rather roughly) and sling my kennel from the back to atop the back seats. It made me cringe but at this point I needed to get going as I had some stops to make and  I thought surely they knew what they were doing, this is a Cadillac dealership afterall and these cars cost a lot. They will surely be careful... When I got my car back, instead of them putting the vehicle back they way they found it, the kennel was still strown across the back. (As a plus though, it was washed! Which I appreciated since I had been on the road and try to take care of my car!) When I went to move the kennel back in place I noticed that there are scrapes across the plastic sides in the back. Greeeeaaaaaat. But, at that point I was leaving to head back to my home state and couldn't worry about it. It was more important to get home safe. They told me in addition to the battery that I needed new air filters, a rear wiper blade, and the throttle body cleaned, all easy enough for me to do myself. So, now I am here doing said maintenance and when I popped the hood I immediately noticed that my positive battery terminal clip has been broken and won't stay shut. Great. I am now back home, 3 states away. I will be back to the area, and am considering moving my family there but if they don't make this right I will find a different dealership to maintenance at.

resp.text:
Hi Jami,

Thank you for taking the time to leave your review and detailed feedback. We are closed today; however, I’m sending your comments over to my General Manager and Service Manager to make sure they address this first thing in the morning. Please expect a call from us tomorrow. I’m very sorry for your experience and I hope we have the opportunity to prove to you this is not how do business nor is this how we want our customers to feel when they leave our dealership.

Sincerely,
Kristina M.
Marketing Manager

name: Frank Jones
text: This was the best car shopping experience that I have ever had, if it was ten stars they would get it from me.  It started with my Internet Sales Manger Tundy McDonald and she was very excellent  getting ideas and question to help me with the purchase of my 2016 Escalade ESV. She sent me to my saleslady Courtney Mauldin, asks for her when you come in, she was totally Awesome. She went above and beyond to get a deal worked out for me,  there was an issue with the car and she took it straight to  service and they fixed it right away and found something else and ordered the part and sent it to detail to get it clean up and they did a great job. If you are looking to purchase a vehicle I recommend Joe Bullard Cadillac, who will treat you right, quick in and out, and they are Veteran friendly, great staff and service. It was worth the 285 miles that I drove from Louisiana to get an awesome deal and meet some great people that really cared about my shopping experience. Ms. Courtney  called me on Monday to check on me to make sure everything was alright with me and the Escalade, and that is quality service at it fineness.

name: Bill McLarty
text: I am William, answering for my wife Cheryl.  We bought this car new in 2004.  It has been solely serviced and maintained by McConnel/Bullard.  It has less than 30,000 miles on the odometer.  It's been the worst car we've owned since our marriage in 1962.  The problem today was a broken window regulator on the rear driver's side.  My wife has been the sole driver of this car.  We have no children in then home.  My conservative guess is that this window has been lowered and raised no more than 10 times in its aborted lifetime.  My wife was told a plastic roller had broken.  A plastic roller in a $50,000 (2004) Cadillac?!  My bill:  $517.23!  I can go back through my invoices and find similar instances of shoddy work and padded bills.  During the second year we owned the car the driver side dash assembly fell off the dash while my wife was driving.  At around the 4-5 year of ownership your service supervisor convinced my wife that she needed to replace all four tires (around 10,000 miles) because they had "dry-rotted." ($800)  I've owned two Cadillac De Ville's prior to this, and have never experienced what has to be either poor construction, low-quality parts, or untruthful service managers.

I recently purchased a 2011 Cadillac SRX. The customer service provided by all the staff at Joe Bullard exceeded my expectaions. I had the pleasure of working with Darren Robinson (New/Used Car Sales) and he most definitely went above and beyond to ensure I was a satisfied customer.
