name: Wj Brown
text:
My daughter’s 07 Kia Sorento stopped on her on the freeway in Atlanta, she had it towed to a shop in Atlanta. They replaced the battery and alternator 500.00.  Two weeks later she is getting warning lights on the dashboard. Fearing that it might be more problems, when she came home for a wedding, I called Greystone Auto and took it in for a diagnostic. In less then 30 mins, results were in; defective alternator(new) . The folks at Greystone called the Atlanta shop and coordinated an under warranty replacement. That was a blessing not to have to worry about my daughter having a malfunctioning car while living there alone.
I have always gotten good service and fair prices here. I have had at least 5 repairs done there and never a complaint.
Thanks Brooke and all the folks there for easing our anxieties.! Now I have another review to write about that Atlanta shop 😡!

name: Marnie Cowan
text: We recently took a car here to get a pre-purchase inspection done, and had a great experience as they were professional, efficient and knowledge and offered a reasonable price.

name: Karen Estes
text:
Women: do not go there! Send a man!  I had trouble getting someone at the desk. I need a new light for my brakes (just one). They wanted $40.00 and I have the bulb !  No respect !!
As a woman I am used to being taken advantage of!!!!!!’

resp.text: Hello, Karen. Unfortunately we were slammed this morning so we apologize if we were not able to get to you sooner at the counter. We were not able to install this for you because you bought the part through Autozone and for legal reasons we must install our own parts in the shop. We would never discriminate or take advantage of anyone based on their gender, the reason we could not help you is simply because the part was not purchased through us. If you'd like to discuss this further, feel free to call us at the shop. Thank you.

text: Incredible service with great prices, these guys will really bend over backwards to make sure you're happy.

Even though they were getting ready to close at 5pm they stayed and continued to help us until we got it finished with no problems they took their time and made sure everything was done correctly and that we were well taken care of. They make sure you have something to drink and all kinds of snacks as well. I give them a perfect 10. I will come here and send anyone I know to them because I know they will be taken good care of.

They told me they don't know what the issue is and refuse to refund my money. They offered to sell me another vehicle...THEY COULD NEVER get another dime. This is clearly THEFT BY DECEPTION!!!!!

text: Dee was a great help, she got us in the car that we wanted and it wasn't a hassle I would recommend this dealership and make sure you ask for Dee!

text: Not your average dealership! Great team there putting safety first! I had a wonderful  experience with Gabe, he was very personable and for the first time it felt like I had someone to help me find the perfect car for me, instead of being told what car they want me to purchase. Incredibly helpful and he got me a great price! 10/10 recommend!

text: I want to thank Jason pilgrims for taking very good care of my truck. They done a awesome job.

text: Best experience at a dealership! Gabe was very helpful in finding a car that fit perfect for me and my family. Very respectful and knowledgeable, definitely would recommend if you're looking to purchase a vehicle. Loving my new ride so far; it's extremely reliable and the price was not anywhere close to as high as I would have payed at other dealers.

name: Katie Parker
text: This is the best dealership. Dee was and is still amazing. She made purchasing my new Jeep so easy and such a smooth transaction. She still keeps in touch with me to make sure I am still enjoying my Jeep and to see if there is anything I need. Highly recommend this dealership and Dee!!

name: Ashley Clift
text: Amazing dealership and I cannot say enough great things about Gabe! He was so friendly and personable, and really made the process of purchasing a car so easy and stress free! I felt like he was really listening to me and cared about my wants and needs. I would recommend him to anyone!!!

name: Michael Brons
text: Took my wife’s Chrysler 300C (2010) to find and fix source of slow coolant leak and to flush the coolant system. Arrived just before 7:30 Monday morning. A young man employed by the dealership was waiting to go in and start his day, he was very friendly and helpful. I was preparing to leave the key when the Service Manager arrived. He was also very friendly. I explained the problem and symptoms. He explained that the symptoms sound like a water pump issue. I received a call a few hours later confirming the water pump. Price was much less than I was prepared for so I quickly authorized the repair. Wednesday morning Service Manager called to report repairs were complete and they would be delivering the car (we live in Monroeville) in the afternoon. From the outset they were friendly, efficient, straightforward and struck me as trustworthy. We will definitely be back for any necessary repairs. Extremely well done!  Thank you!

name: Luis D'Jesus
text: I had taken my jeep to 3 different dealership prior to Jason Pilger CJDR and none were able to figure out what was wrong with it. No only were they able to determine the issue and fit it the first time, but they picked up the car from my house and brought it back after at no additional cost..

name: Alex Viola
text: Ask for Dee! She was attentive, responsive, and very helpful. She's also very knowledgeable and made you feel right at home. The dealership itself has a great staff and people that are willing to help you and make deals. My wife and I are very happy with the truck we purchased and would certainly recommend this dealership to friends in the future. Thanks Jason Pilger CDJR!!!

name: lexi rodriguez
text: Great dealership! Lots of great people! My specific salesman was Gabe and he was wonderful! Answered all my questions, showed me a ton of options for me, and got me a great price! Highly recommend!

name: Sherry Jordan
text: I took my truck in to have the computer module replaced and programmed. Everyone there were super nice and let us know exactly what was going on with my truck. I will definently use Jason Pilger CDJ again and will reccomend to anyone.

text: Don't waste your time here . I don't like to do bad reviews , but I can not recommend this this place.

Couldn't ask for a better experience.  My sales rep Dee, was very knowledgeable had an answer for all of my questions. She was able to take my information via the phone and within minutes I was approved. There were NO PRESSURE tactics used (I greatly appreciate that). A few hours later I had driven from Prattville, Alabama to Jackson, Alabama to finalize the paperwork and drive back home in my vehicle!!
~Sincerely Princess Butler

name: David Dolbear
text: The employees at Jason Pilger have always treated with utmost respect every time I have been involved with this car dealership and have always been very satisfied with them. I would like to thank them for the experience I have had.

text: Just wanted to say what a pleasure it was to deal with this dealership. I drove 2.5 hours to do business with them and wouldn't hesitate to do it again tomorrow. My salesman was Cory Winston and he was very attentive, thorough and not pushy at all during the whole process. Small town dealership with a great staff. Very happy with my new Ram 2500.

name: miriam hernandez
text: I had a great experience with my salesman Gabe, he’s really helpful and super knowledgeable. I definitely recommend coming here!

text:
I've actually never visited your store before but neither has Delilah Peterson. I'm giving you five stars mostly because of Delilah Peterson who rated you one star. That chick is a fraud.

Why would you leave a one star review and not tell someone why? Businesses are concerned if they have not met your expectations and they want to do better. They are also concerned if you are the competitor and you are trying to drive their rating down. Maybe you are someone that just is trying to review enough companies that you can get your local guide rating. We will never know if you don't say why. Maybe you want it that way idk
Delilah Peterson:
You rated another friend of mine's business and he can find no record of you ever being his customer.

I noticed that prior to a couple of days ago that you have not reviewed many companies. Suddenly 2 days ago you rated 30 or 40 businesses from Montgomery AL all the way to Pensacola with a side trip to Mobile AL. You gave most of them 1 star all within one day.  What is the drive from Montgomery to Pensacola with a side trip to mobile? About 7 hours driving? that's 7 hours of 24 hours. So you had 19 hours to stop in and rate at least 30 other companies many that are only open 9 am to 5 pm. So who are you? Speedy Gonzalez on Meth?

name: Martin Leija
text: I rarely leave reviews, but after an amazing experience with Birmingham Luxury Motors- Hoover, I had to write one up. I am actually about 1,000 miles away from the dealership, and at first, I wasn’t sure what to expect. I then spoke to Warren Fuller and everything just clicked. He was able to face-time me to show me the vehicle and he also let me know of any imperfections that were found.  I then asked if they could take it to an independent mechanic of my choice to get it fully inspected and they agreed without hesitation. This reassured me that I was dealing with an honest dealership. After everything came out clean, I flew out there, and once I arrived, I was out in about 15 minutes. I then drove back the 1,000 miles with my, new to me, 2015 Lexus GS 350 F sport, which drove like a dream. I just want to say, thank you Warren, for the amazing experience!

Honda Accords sell quickly, but Warren was able to locate an Accord in great condition with minimal mileage and good CarFax. When the car was delivered and I had a few minor concerns following the test drive, Warren worked with me to make the car just what I needed. Birmingham Luxury Motors gave me an out the door price (car, tax, tag and title) prior to test driving so that I would know exactly what I'd be paying. The paperwork process took less than 10 minutes as Warren had everything ready when I came in to purchase the car. I absolutely love my new car and the experience I had with Birmingham Luxury Motors! My family and I will definitely return to Birmingham Luxury Motors for future car buying.

name: Born Handy (Born Handy)
text:
My wife and I were looking to get out of our Land Rover, even though it was paid for.  The big reason for getting out of the Land Rover was the out of sight repair costs, even  for little things.  This will be important later on, so keep the Land Rover in mind.

We wanted an inexpensive to own car, so we were mostly looking for a Honda Accord, and online searching took us all over the place, but we actually held Oskar Motors for last.  I wish we would have just gone there first, because we were beginning to believe that a car for under 15k was just going to come with odd smells and cigarette burns.  Oskar had plenty of Accords that were almost as good as new, and without the burns and smells.  Even better, they were about $1000 less than the closest competitor.

The Salesman (Warren) was up front about every car, pointing out the pros and cons of each vehicle, even so far as to point out things we had expected any dealership to hide.  In the end, we picked one of about 10 Accords on the lot, and that was more than any other place we had been to, even the Honda dealerships.

The Land Rover matters because we considered trading it at Oskar, but again, the salesman was up front in explaining that they weren't going to come in real strong on the trade in because Land Rover just wasn't the kind of car they want to deal in.  They like to sell inexpensive and reliable cars, and a Land Rover that is out of warranty is just more of a head ache than most people want to deal with (a lesson hard learned by us just a few weeks ago with a $4700 repair bill).  He went as far as to tell us where we were likely to get top dollar for it, and I think that speaks loudly of a business model based on trust, and earning repeat business.

If I sound like a commercial for Oskar, I guess I will have to plead guilty because I was beginning to become frustrated with all of the shopping, and I almost didn't even go.  I was sure that their cars had to be heaps of trash compared to any we had seen that day, and I was basing that off of the "too good to be true" rule.  Warren did a pretty good job of removing the built up stress, and making us feel like we weren't having to be on guard against a car sales scam, and even better, he sold us a great car at a great price.

resp.text:
Dear Jason,
Thank you for your 5 star review and candid comments to Oskar Motors and it's superstar, Warren. We are delighted to hear that we've earned your trust and are humbled by your compliments and recommendation. It was our pleasure doing business with you. Please visit www.OskarMotors.com if we may be of further assistance.

name: Robb Giordano
text: I bought a Mazda5 from out of state and Warren and Hussein were both very helpful in completing the sale.  I was able to see the car via facetime before I made the drive.  They were very responsive to my questions and concerns and were less pushy than sales people I had recently encountered at new car dealers.  The car I was looking at was well detailed and they agreed to fix a couple things that were minor issues with it.   I always assumed new car dealerships were better than used, but now I know that is not always the case.  Beforehand I even thought some of their reviews might be fake because they were similarly written and mostly positive, but after experiencing the sale in person I think it’s just because they are trying really hard to have excellent, non-pushy service.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback!

text: Let me say that when I first saw their inventory I was impressed by the amount of quality vehicles at low prices. Mine was a one owner lease. He offers clean cars for cheaper prices. name: Christy Cater
text:
I purchased a used car from Stephen, and NINE days later the engine threw a rod. It's now in the salvage yard.

While Oskar Motors was not liable to do anything because I bought the car "as-is", they offered no help whatsoever. In fact, Stephen led me to believe that the owner, Hussein Mawani, was trying to find me some sort of warranty. For three weeks he told me they were working on it. I finally gave up.

They could have easily offered help in other ways: by referring me to a mechanic, by referring me to a salvage yard that would give me a fair price for it, or by offering me a trade-in value for it. Instead they led me on for weeks. I was so naive to believe that they were trying to help me out.

resp.text:
We are sorry that you’ve had an unpleasant experience. Customer satisfaction is our top priority and with that goal in mind we highly recommend that our customers purchase an extended warranty. Extended warranties are an industry standard with used car purchases, especially when the manufacturer’s warranty has expired. Close to 100% of our customers take that option. Used cars are sold ‘as is’ and the only insurance you have on your purchase is extended warranty, which you opted out of. We have a fine selection of vehicles at great prices... our customers are our greatest advocates because they have such a great experience with us. But every now and then, something goes wrong with a car that could not be predicted ahead of time since it checks out fine on all counts.

We’ve checked our records to confirm that you indeed got a great deal for the car when you came in on June 25th. The first time you called (on July 10), Stephen went above his call of duty when he answered your call at 3:00am on a weekend. Having confirmed with the owners that he could still offer you the extended warranty, he recommended it to you once again when you called back on July 12th. You turned that option down once again and with that embraced the risk of any unpredictable issues with your vehicle.

name: Kris Nicole
text: Very sketchy dealership . Found a car I wanted to look at online that was supposed to be shipped to this dealership. the dealership kept telling me it was in transit and would arrive at the lot the next day. Called the next day was told it was still in transit, called the day after that told the same thing and they kept putting me on hold. They told me when the car is on the lot they'd give me a call. Never received a call from them. I finally gave up and went to another dealership

resp.text:
Dear Kris,
We apologize for any inconvenience you may have had. Our cars are purchased from all over the country and occasionally a bad weather situation en route can delay the transit of some vehicles. We respectfully disagree with your comment; this is not "sketchy" behavior because we prefer our cars to arrive safely. We do understand that your need may have been urgent and sincerely regret that we lost an opportunity to serve you. Please visit www.OskarMotors.com to give us opportunity to turn this experience around for you.

name: Skip Warren
text: I really liked Oskar Motors; stumbled across them online looking for a vehicle to replace a wrecked vehicle. Found an 09' VW Passat that was really clean.  I had it inspected by my VW guy and it checked out except for a couple of minor things that could have only been found through the inspection.  Took the inspection back to Jack at Oskar and he agreed to repair the small items at my repair shop.  Additionally there were a couple of cosmetic things that he repaired as well.  I had a small window to make all of this happen and Oskar Motors pulled it off and got me out the door at the at what I felt was a fair price. Dealing with Warren and Jack was a delight, my wife even commented on how great the experience was.  They have lots of high end pre owned vehicles at all price points on thier lots.  I will definately go back to Oskar Motors when the occasion rises.

resp.text:
Dear Skip,
Thank you for your 5-star rating and a candid review of Oskar Motors and its team. We are delighted that you and your wife had a "great" experience with us; it was our pleasure doing business with you. Customer Service is at the core of our business model, and we are glad that we hit the mark in your case. A repeat customer is the greatest compliment; we are excited to have an opportunity to work with you again whenever the occasion arises. name: Jacob Berrie
text: I had looked for a long time for a nice older Dodge Van. Will at Culpepper had a really nice one at a great price. I trusted them so much after talking to them and asking Will for more photos that I purchased it from over 500 Miles away, without ever seeing it! I live in South West Florida! Being a somewhat cynical mechanic and business person, I typically would have never done this. I've never bought a car without examining it very closely, myself. The Van was perfect, runs and drives great and it's in beautiful condition. Just what Will told me. I still look on Culpeppers Website, just to see what they have. I would by any car from Will again, based on just what he would tell me. The Nicest Thing About Culpeppers, Is That They Don't Charge Any Other 'Dealer Fees' on the Sale Of A Vehicle! Nice!

name: Adam Aker
text: Great place to buy a vehicle. Honest friendly people who are always taking care of customers. Service after the sale is a priority for these guys.

name: Eric Robertson
text: I have purchased a lot of cars from Culpepper Auto over the years. I have been a customer since Mr. Culpepper was alive.  Since his grandson, Will, took over the business he has followed in his grandfather’s footsteps and made the business even better. Will tries his best to get quality cars that people can afford and goes above and beyond to try and make sure his customers are happy, long after the deal is over. This dealership has not only earned my devoted business but also my respect so much, that Will is not just a car dealer to me but a honest man that I consider my friend. Give this place a try if you are tired of the misery that car buying has become and you want to get back to the joy and happiness that used to come with shopping for your new car, it still exists here.

Mark

text: Kirt was great every step of the way with his charisma, kindness and respect. This was by far the best car buying experience I have had! He then had all the paperwork in hand and was knowledgable about each question I threw his way. Kirt listened, worked hard to get the deal perfected, and even made it fun and enjoyable along the way. I would highly recommend Kirt McFarland at City Auto Sales of Hueytown to my closest friends and family for their next car buying experience! He was a delight!

text: Bought a jeep liberty. City auto had there "mechanic" check out the check engine light. Originally was told it's the Cadyllaic converter. They offered to have it fixed. Came back after several days and said it was just a sensor. $3800 later it really was the converter. Buyer beware. Someone knew and got me a good one!

name: Brina Callaway
text: I had the pleasure of dealing with Donnie and Keith and let me just say they are both AMAZING and made purchasing a vehicle so easy!! I arrived at the dealership about 430pm and they close at 6pm.  I went to test drive a 2012 Acura TL and when I got in to crank it  the battery light was on.  After getting the financing options down I voiced my concerns about the battery warning light being on and the key fob was a little loose.  Keith asked one of the ladies that works there to please take the car down the street to have the battery checked.  Turns out the car needed a new battery and City Auto sales had the battery replaced right then!! I am going back today for the key to be replaced.  All I can say is that the men and women that work at City Auto Sales in Hueytown are AMAZING and GO ABOVE AND BEYOND TO SATISFY THE CUSTOMER AND STAND BEHIND THE PRODUCTS THEY SELL!  If you are in the market for a car I urge you to go see Donnie Woods at City Auto Sales and he will make buying a car so easy!!! I thank all of them for their hard work and doing all they could to make sure that I was happy with my purchase! I will definitely be back to City Auto Sales when I am in the business for another vehicle!! THEY ARE AMAZING AND YOU WILL SEE THEY WILL NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND WILL DO EXACTLY WHAT THEY SAY!

We called and had the pleasure of speaking to Donnie and inquired to see if the vehicle we were interested in seeing was still available. On arriving Donnie greeted us as we were like family and treated us as if he knew us for years! Made us feel welcome and at home! The staff is amazing and went above and beyond to create a relaxing no pressure buying experience! We never felt pressured to make a purchase, even allowing us as long as we needed to test drive and check out the vehicle! The financing process was easy and they worked to get us the best interest rate, as well as get us where we wanted our monthly payments to be. They paid off our trade in vehicle (That we still owed on) with no problem and no haggle as other places alway want to low ball your trade. The staff even stayed late after there closing time to accommodate our purchase. We never felt rushed out and by far my wife and I can truly say that it was THE BEST CAR BUYING EXPERIENCE WE HAVE EVER HAD! We had the key to our new Escalade, and out the dealership in under an hour from walking into there facility! We’ll definitely be doing business with Donnie again on our next purchase. Go to city auto sales and ask for Donnie if your in the market for a new vehicle!!!!

text: Seems great at first then the truck starts to fall apart after a week, said they would try to help me get it right. Told me it was ready I show they give me a big bill, truck still has the same old problem plus a new one from either the old used defective parts they installed or bad mechanics. Will never consider business with this place again. Management  Keith was disrespectful to me and his employees was told they would fix my truck no matter what it cost if I paid 400 bucks. I agreed asked him to put it in writing or I would pay it when I had a running truck, and was told to get out of his dealership if I didn't trust him. So I did. By far worst experience of my life purchasing anything ever! Astonished they are in business. Hope this helps someone from making the same mistakes. 15000 bucks all I wanted was a truck that ran right or refund. As of right now I'm stuck with a 15k yard ornament but I'll keep good faith and get it worked out eventually.

name: Life of GCV Gwen
text: We paid cash for a 1996 Honda Accord for my son when he was in high school back in 2012. The car wasn't perfect but it did get him through school before the transmission went out. I would say it was worth the $2500 We paid for it. I would suggest to always try to pay cash if you can. That way you won't be stuck in a credit plan that makes you pay probably three times the value. Nice friendly experience overall!

name: Allie Walker
text: To say this place has disappointed me would be an understatement.  We bought a vehicle on the 1st of this month, we had it for 12 days and it broke down and the motor needed to be replaced.  At first they were willing to work with us,  then after we explained that we came for a specific vehicle (as most people do),  they didn't want to help us find a vehicle that worked for our family.  We have a child with special needs that has at least two therapy appointments a week.  We needed a vehicle,  after many lies about prices and vehicles, the only one they would sell us was one that had more milage, and the interior was in worse shape.  They are not upfront about prices, I specifically asked a price of a vehicle and they wouldn't tell me, all they would say is that it wouldn't work out.  I looked it up on there website and it would have worked, they just wanted to make a profit.  I have never seen a dealership that is so dishonest, and sneaky.  I would absolutely love to report these crooks to the Better Business Bureau!!  Oh and they have an optional,  "insurance", that is about $20 a month more.  we asked to have it removed and they said they would not be able to make the deal with us.this is how they charged roughly another  $1000.  Please people, avoid the headache and heartache of selfish greedy people that work here!!  We will no longer shop here and I will make everyone I know very aware of the kind of business that takes place here.  You don't even deserve one star.      Thanks, your highly angry customer!

name: GG
text: I purchased a car from City Auto Sales without having a mechanic check it out first..big mistake. After only having the car for less then a month I had to replace a hose because my engine overheated. Now less then a week after having that fixed there is a problem with the gas evaporation unit..When I called City Auto Sales when the 1st thing happened they basically told me it wasn't their problem. I had the car over a month and they didn't understand why it took so long for the car to overheat.  That one repair cost me over 300 and now I have to repair something else. I have seen many folks give them good reviews and maybe this is just one bad situation, but its quite frustrating and costly.  Never buy a car without a mechanic checking it out first.  They aren't standing behind the vehicles they sell.

name: Anonymous Review
text: Please do your research before you finance any vehicle so you do not get screwed like we did. If you are in need of a car these people will go through all hoops to sit you in one of the vehicles THEY choose for you. If you need a car and want to be screwed for years then purchase a vehicle from this company. We bought a truck from them 2 years ago and they told us after they financed us with a 21% interest rate that we could refinance the truck a year later through the lender well they lied and they knew it. They gave us the whole build your credit scam.The truck had reached the year limit of refinance 9 months after we owned the vehicle. We were stuck and under in the vehicle. Fortunately by the grace of God we got out of the loan and paid it off. They were overpriced and used sneaky tactics to get rid of the vehicle. They were rude and very pushy and I will never send anyone here to purchase a car and I advise you to look somewhere else. City Auto Sales- reviews hurt and I hope after this post that more will follow. You guys need to take a look at your business ethics. Your lucky I gave you 2 stars since I was the uneducated person that followed through with the deal and the truck still works. Update May 2015- The motor needs to be replaced and the national lifetime warranty they sell you is not worth a penny. We have been 3 weeks without a vehicle and it is at the Dealer (Edwards Chevrolet) The warranty people are trying so hard to get out of repairing the motor. I called to speak to BOB and requested the service records that the warranty that they sold me needs and he refused to give me the records showing what what serviced on the truck before selling it to us. SO CITY AUTO SALES will not even work with the warranty that they sell you to repair the shitty vehicle they sold you in the first place. They still have not given us our money that needed to be refunded for the GAP insurance we bought. This has been requested from guess who BOB for 3 months now. They are the most horrible dealer you could ever want to purchase from. Please spread the word about how shitty their company is and how they really treat there customers after a sale. You now have ONE STAR. You don't even deserve that.

name: B D
text: Management and staff are extremely helpful and honest! Will definitely continue to do business here!

name: kljgreene
text: If I could give City Auto a NEGATIVE star rating I would. I inquired about a Jeep Wrangler they had AND STILL HAVE for sale. The price was 19,998 (wish I could post the picture I took) clearly that WAS the price. I called and talked with AUSTIN about the jeep. AUSTIN was kind enough to bring it to me. I talked with a loan officer about financing the jeep. She asked me a question about the jeep that I did not know. I pulled the jeep up on my phone and DO WHAT? suddenly the 19,998 price was gone and NEW AND HIGHER PRICE OF 22,994 was listed. The jeep isn't even worth 22,994. It doesn't matter if it has big tires or a lift...that DOES NOT INCREASE THE VALUE....AND how does the price INCREASE from 19,998 to 22,994? When I asked about the new higher price they played dumb. Claimed they didn't know what I was talking about...$19,998..??? We never had it for sale for that amount! Luckily I took a picture and I still had it on my phone with the 19,998 listed price they advertised....I quickly texted the picture to AUSTIN who claimed the jeep was NEVER FOR SALE AT THE PRICE OF $19,998....once he saw the picture he said well....if that's what we listed it for it was a mistake...we'll have to sell it to you at that price....no YOU REALLY WONT! Take that overpriced jeep and *+#•^!! Con-Man with a Con-Plan!  offered to sell it to me at that price like they WERE DOING ME A FAVOR......uh no thanks SHADY MAN. Silver 2011 Jeep Wrangler soft top lifted big tires and rims, automatic JEEP WRANGLER 4WD 2 door SPORT WITH with 75,746 miles the LIST # is 559462 is still for sale at 22,994. THEY HAD IT FOR SALE FOR 19,998. It's actually WORTH 19,200! If I figure out how to post the picture I will! LIARS...luckily I had him bring the jeep to ME....but still a WASTE OF TIME...scammers....not today buddy! Plenty of Wranglers for sale..BEWARE! I will WARN EVERYONE I KNOW!

name: Myra Hardin
text:
Bought a car at City Auto Sales on 7/30/18 the salesman was Curtis Osburn he was very friendly as was Mike Thomas the man who did the paper work...after I left the dealership the engine light came on I called Curtis as soon as I got home and told him the problem he said bring it back the next morning which I did...Mike Thomas put the car on a hand help machine and went in to check what the code that came up was...in the mean time Curtis took the gasket off from around the gas tank and cleaned it and put it back on saying that it may be the problem..I asked what the code was and he said it was a vacuum leak...Mike Thomas reset the code and Curtis Osburn said if it came back on to call them back...the engine light came back on before I got home again I called Curtis Osburn and told him the light came back on...Curtis told me to bring it back today 8/6/18  that they would put it in the shop and see if the warranty they gave me would cover it..when I got there today Curtis told me that with the mileage on the car they dont normally do anything about it then Mike Thomas comes out and tells me I need a appt in order to have it checked out...(what's going on here) was told to bring it in then told I needed a appt....get it to gather guys....was also told they would call me today with a appt for wenesday....they never called back and I left the place with a feeling of being snowball and lied to....if I could have written this review without giving you star rating I would have...that's why you get 1 star....its bad when you guys take advantage of women.
UPDATE 8/9/18.....
Took my car to a mechanic and had him put my car on a code reader... Curtis Osburn told me it was a vacuum leak.... NOT... the code is for the catalytic system effective below thresh hold...this shows they will lie to your face...I will never walk into that place place again.

name: sirk nilknarf
text:
I recently purchased a 2010 Mini Cooper S convertible from City Auto Sales. I live in GA and the dealership is in Alabama. I was going to drive out the after speaking with Kirk the sales guy, he said they could bring it to me and boy did they.

The vehicle was advertised for on price online, but that is not the price I actually paid. I bought the car sight unseen and was assured that it was almost new. Upon delivery the plastic piece for the roof fell off and hit me in the head. Then I drove it 37 miles home smelled something burning and text him immediately, he replied telling me they had just changed the oil the night before delivery.

The car has not moved since I purchased it due to the oil leak. I scheduled an appt at the dealership for today and received the shock of a lifetime. The car needs extensive motor work costing me an additional over $2000.00 plus an oil change, because the oil they drained from the car looked like a thick milkshake.....(that's a lot considering I put down $5000.00). When I brought the leaks (antifreeze and oil) to Kirks attention he assured me it was run off due to the fact they changed the oil the night before. He told me to let him know if it was still leaking in a couple of days and he would see what they could do. Two days later, I sent him a picture via text of the massive oil leaking all over my garage floor and never heard anything back.

I am a single mother of four children. I bought this car on good faith so that I could give to my baby girl. I currently own two 5 series BMW's one is a 2013 & the other is 2005 that are both dealer maintained. I due understand with a used vehicle there may be issues however, this is unbelievable.  I believe they new the status of this vehicle before they sold it. That's why I never received any return corespondence.

I am a very trusting and loyal buyer, but this experience was truly an eye opening experience. ** Please for your own sake, do not waste your time or your money at City Auto Sales!

text:
Car repair at it's finest. Brakes done in under an hour and the friendliest staff. I recommend them for all your car repair needs or to buy a car. While we were there we listened as they helped a customer. The staff called to purchase another companies vehicle for the customer. But the car was a lemon and not available for purchase. Then the staff went above and beyond to get the customer into one of their vehicles that was new. The customer left happy and very satisfied with the deal they had received. I would go here first to buy a car. It's the little dealership with a big heart for the community and the customers they serve.

True to my word we bought a car for my son and he loves his Ford Focus. Juan Cuellar and his team made the process so easy. If you need a car stop in and see for yourself the difference this dealership makes in ease and comfort of buying a car. They are bilingual speaking Spanish and English  for those who need a translator it’s not a problem.

text:

name: Blanca Contreras
text: The most horrifying place to go. I had money that i had saved for months with hard work. I went there the first day just to check it out with my money in hand. I did not have any of the requirements any true dealership would ask for in order to approve you. They took my money easily and let me go with the car without being approved yet. days later told me to return the car because i wasn't approved and i had already paid for full coverage insurance. They stole my money and wanted me to go take the car, and threatened me saying they were going to report the car stolen when i had prove they had taken my money. They were so sacred to know that they were going down that unprofessionally came in the middle of the night to take the car and messed up my property and my neighbors. Where is the police report where i had stolen the car from their lot? That is how they keep the dealership ruining taking my down payment and keeping the car to resale it. What makes you think that is not going to be you next? One of the thousand proofs i have is that when they took my money and told me i was good to go they hadn't given me any paperwork or receipts until I personally asked for it. I'll give you a name to find in your system Pablo Mejia. Why not tell me I was not approved before taking my down payment and letting me take the car and then keep down payment and car? Abusive people. El lugar más horrible para ir. Tenía dinero que había ahorrado durante meses con mucho trabajo. Fui allí el primer día solo para verlo con mi dinero en mano. No tenía ninguno de los requisitos que cualquier concesionario verdadero pediría para probarlo. Tomaron mi dinero fácilmente y me dejaron ir con el auto sin ser aprobado todavía. días después me dijeron que devolviera el auto porque no estaba aprobado y ya había pagado el seguro de cobertura total. Me robaron el dinero y querían que yo tomara el auto, y me amenazaron diciendo que iban a denunciar el auto robado cuando demostrara que me habían quitado el dinero. Eran tan sagrados al saber que estaban bajando que, sin profesionalidad, llegaron a media noche para tomar el automóvil y arruinaron mi propiedad y mis vecinos. ¿Dónde está el informe policial donde había robado el auto de su lote? Así es como mantienen el concesionario arruinado tomando mi pago inicial y manteniendo el auto para revenderlo. ¿Qué te hace pensar que no vas a ser el próximo? Una de las mil pruebas que tengo es que cuando tomaron mi dinero y me dijeron que estaba listo para irme, no me habían dado ningún papeleo o recibos hasta que lo solicité personalmente. Por que no desirme que no aprobe antes de quitarme el dinero? Gente abusiva.

name: Karla S
text: At first me and my husband were very happy with our brand new car! But It did have a few details to it like not having the light bulb working so we went to buy it ourselves. We called the next day so they could put it on for us and they complained about us buying it! They said they were going to fix the scratches it had all over the door and the hood and also the dent. A month later after we bought it it need it new tires. Okay no problem. 2 months later we took it to get rims replaced for new ones because it would shake. So I went to go pick it up and everything was fine until it wouldn't turn on. They though It didn't have gas so they went to go buy some and put some in, it still didn't want to turn on. Then they wanted to see if it need a jump start, and nope that didn't work. Then they tried the batteries,it finally turned on. After I was going to leave they wanted me to pay for the gas they had put! Haha yeah right that's wasn't my fault,that was on y'all. I left and right when I was about to get to my house the car stoped completely and it didn't want to start. (I was holding the traffic) embarrassing! A few minutes later it started again. I let the car take a brake for a few hours. (4 hours to be exact) I needed to go pick up my husband from work. So I left in the car and again the car turned off on me with traffic behind me! My husband got home and we went to go try it out to see what he thought it could be and it was running good for about 35 minutes but it didn't last longer then that because once again it stoped on the highway! We had to called a tow truck to take it back home.  We had the car for only  3 months and it's messed up we tried calling and calling and they said they couldn't help us because they didn't have a mechanic guy available.  And we called again and still nothing they could do about it so we towed it to another dealer, and we haven't had the car in a month. someone needs to figure something out because we do NOT want the car anymore nobody form your  dealership is welling to help us, and we are tired of it, and tired of not have the car! Just bad, unprofessional!

resp.text:
Sra Karla , i did talk to your husband and he said you took car to Chrysler Dealer and they were gonna fix it cus it was under factory warranty. text:

Never mind to buy here again. Ford let me down and my Dealer also

name: Joshua Rogers
text:
This is a review of the service and quick oil change of Long-Lewis.

I had my 150 Raptor serviced there and stayed with the truck just because I didn’t feel like going to the waiting area.  The did change the oil on time as scheduled but they did not 80% of the check list they gave me.

I figured I would give them another try so the next oil change I had done I did go in the waiting area. There was an older lady working and she was not helpful. She seemed to make everyone feel like they were bothering her by asking basic questions. Also the manager there was yelling at another employee and even tried to talk to me about how he was unhappy with the management at Long-Lewis.

Today, I went in for a safety recall and they were again unwelcoming and told me I would need to wait a few weeks to get it done even though the job takes about an hour according to the service personnel.  In my mind if the Ford motor company issues a safety recall then it needs to be addressed sooner than later.  I did offer to leave the truck there and they could fit it but they still said no.

It’s unlikely I will do further business there and that’s unfortunate because I will likely be buying 2 expensive vehicles this year and would be potential life long customer since I’m local.

🌺🐞🌸🐝🌼

name: Iron Hill Restorations
text: I got an zero time engine that was "rebuilt" by Jim.  Total hack job, and not sure what was actually rebuilt.  Painted over dirt and grime, RTV smeared all over, un-repaired exhaust studs, or improperly drilled and tapped exhaust studs.  I put one star, but it should be zero stars.  You are throwing money away if you have this place attempt an engine rebuild. Avoid at all cost!

name: BRENDA SHERRILL
text: Very helpful and very nice guy , I will return again in the future for anything else I may need .

name: Chris Giles
text: A little tough to get to but very good guys

name: Chad Nelson
text: I am the New General Sales Manager here at Off Lease Auto Outlet located in Daphne,Al off Hwy 98. I am shaking things up and discounting all of our inventory. You will find that we have some of the finest used cars ,SUV's and trucks with the very best prices on the Gulf Coast. All of our used vehicle sales come with your first oil change free. Come meet the staff and check out our new dealership. We have free refreshments and we always have the games on the television. You ,your family and friends will leave with the best deal and have the very best car buying experience. We can't wait to earn your business for life and be part of our growing family.

name: Maggie Roper Green
text: These guys were great. I would def buy from Off Lease again. Lex, Chad, Gary and the owner (I can't recall his name) made buying a car a lot less stressful than I have encountered in the past few months of looking. They were honest and did everything in their power to get us into the 2013 Honda Odyssey that I found on their lot. Great car and great experience. Always felt like I was dealing with real people and not someone just trying to make the sale. Great, clean cars at a great price. Would highly recommend anyone looking for a good car to check here first. The local dealerships turned me off before I even stepped foot on their lot to look at inventory. I would guess they purchase most of their cars at auctions, which isn't a bad thing. The bells and whistles of having everything perfect weren't there but I would rather have that than an over priced liar. Buying a used car is so stressful, but they made it down to earth and doable. Would definitely recommend these folks if you are value conscious.

name: Ginger Foshee
text: Best experience ever buying a used car.  Everyone was very professional and pleasant to deal with.  From Carl the salesman that assisted me to the finance guy Michael.  Everyone was great.   Will definitely recommend them to anyone that is looking to buy a good used car.  My daughter is very happy with the car that I bought her.

name: kayla ledger
text: Went to off lease with $6000 looking for a used but reliable car. It was me and my mom, we had never bought a car before, did not have the slightest idea what we were doing. We didn't know what questions to ask, we didn't know what a "good deal" was, but we knew we needed a car. Marcus was absolutely INCREDIBLE! He showed me a 2008 Lincoln, not at all what we were looking for but I instantly fell in love. After some negotiation we settled on a fair price and I drove out of the lot with my beautiful new car. Later that evening I took it for a drive and it started acting crazy, I panicked! My first thought was omg I signed an "as Is" agreement! I called Marcus and he told me not to worry that they would take care of me and they did. They picked up the car, found out the problem, fixed the problem, gave me a rental until it was fixed, and returned it to me in a timely manner. Marcus and Roger were absolutely amazing and made sure I drove away a happy customer. Any future car I purchase will come from off lease, no questions asked. They treated me like family and have by far the best customer service I have ever experienced anywhere. THANK YOU SO MUCH!

name: Aussie girls in Florida
text: They called me right away on a Sunday and within 24 hours I was in a beautiful BMW. I met the new manager Tom and he couldn't have taken better care of me. My sales man Ricky helped me get my new car, and made sure all went well. The finance manager Gary worked hard with several banks to get the deal we needed. Together, these folks made a great team. I am glad I did business with them.

name: Kandis Davis
text: We loved our experience at Off Lease Auto. Honestly I was dreading shopping for a new car. Ashley, his dad and our salesman Garry were wonderful. They were extremely friendly and helpful. They were not pushy like most dealerships we had dealt with.  We went expecting to buy one car and ended up buying two. Ashley and his dad spent the majority of their day talking baseball with my husband and playing with my daughter. Not only did we end up with a great deal on 2 vehicles, I also feel like we made some new friends today. I highly recommend Off Lease Auto Sales.

name: Justin Alexander
text: Definitely weird experience. Everyone that works there is related. Bait and switch definitely going on. And cars popping on and off website. Car I went to buy wasn’t even there after I had confirmed before I came that it was still available. Got there and someone let it slip that vehicle had been sold over a week ago. Why was it still on their website then and why did you confirm you still had it on the lot?  Strange place!!!

name: Vicki Morrisonb
text: Kelvin was an awesome sales person. I have been in several car dealers and never had the customer service this young man provided. I will definitely send him customers. Thank you Kelvin for your great customer service.

name: Brandon Jamison
text: I purchased a car from them and it broke down twice in 2 weeks. It's still in the shop getting fixed at a real dealership. Now 3 weeks later my old finance company is calling saying I'm late on the car I trade in. Now I have to deal with these guys who sold me a car that has been more reliable at break down then anything else. So after everything said and done the car is still in the shop that I purchased and they haven't payed off my trade-in. Does this sound like a company you want to deal with. Also it's only been almost a month. Everybody was nice at the dealership but that seems to be a way to get you to trust them.

name: Charles Mims
text: I purchased a 2013 Toyota Highlander from them on January 8th, 2018. As of February 28th, 2018 they STILL have not provided the title to my vehicle. The vehicle was purchased from a pair of sales reps - Devin and Brittney. I worked closely with the finance manager Roger to complete the sale. It is now 46 days later and well outside the 30 days they legally have to transfer the title and they still have not sent the title. I have repeatedly called and get transferred to voicemail, told the Title Agent is out of the office, told he just left for lunch, etc. I do not believe they have the title to the vehicle I purchased, in looking at other reviews I suspect they have not paid off the previous owner's loan on the vehicle and don't really have the title.

name: Brandi W
text:
Would NOT recommend this place.  My husband was promised a car for a certain price both verbally and via text message.  After we drove 45 minutes to their location with 2 babies in tow, they would not uphold their initial offer and were asking for $1000 more than promised.  It was a complete waste of our time.  Will be purchasing a vehicle elsewhere.

UPDATE**
We were contacted by Off Lease Auto about 1 hour after leaving their facility and offered the car at the promised price.   They brought the car and paperwork to our house the very next day.  I'm leaving 4 stars due to the initial headache and waste of our time, but we are both happy that they made it right.  THANK YOU

name: Justen mcallister
text: Was a little weary going here bc of the reviews at first but I do know how angry people can give a business a bad reputation. But, They had a really good deal on a truck I wanted. Went this last Sat. And looked at the truck. My salesman ( RICKY) was really nice and helpful. They even let me take the truck and get it checked out by a mechanic. I decided to think over it a couple days. In that process, Ricky wasn’t pushy at all, which most salesman are trying to pitch something down your throat. I came back today and bought the truck. Got a really good deal and was able to neg. a little. The people were really nice and found out they were getting bad reviews bc of a technicality issue which got fixed. I would recommend them.

name: Myra Mason
text: I bought a car from Off Lease back in May. I am glad they talked me into buying the warranty. My AC compressor went out. They helped me right away and got me back on theroad with working air in no time! The sales people were also very nice to my children and I while we waited for the repair. Thank you for a good experience!

name: Cameron Swift
text: DO NOT GO, STAY AWAY, FAR FAR AWAY. Family run which is normally good, but not so in this case. Staff were annoyed about small things and outwardly showed it. Bought the car over a month ago, they haven't sent title to DMV and can't get a hold of them through any network. Temp tag is expired so because they aren't doing their job I'm driving an unregistered vehicle.

name: Graham Llewellyn
text: Don't go there. I've been waiting 4 months for my title to be mailed to the DMV. I don't think they ever had the title, so this dump is definitely a crime scene. Reported them to the BBB, and next step is to sue them. I've called 35 times at least, and 100% of the time they say "No one is upstairs right now that can help you with your title."

name: Chris De la cruz
text: They have the best prices on low mileage Honda Accords. The staff was friendly and respectful. I highly recommend.

name: C. Reeves
text: Down right liars! They pulled my leg for a week! They shut down temporarily due to title issues and assured me it wouldn't affect my transaction. I left work early yesterday by two hours just to have "Ricky" get an attitude with me on the phone and essentially told me to not buy the truck from them. They never sent any of the info to my bank regarding the vehicle in question. Then he told me he'd deliver the truck with no issues today...well? Here I am leaving this review! Truly unprofessional!

name: Sandra Myers
text: Highly recommend off lease auto sales. have bought 3 cars from them  and have been completely satisified. everyone is so nice and have went way beyond the call of duty to satisfy me  thanks guys  great job.   Sandra Myers

name: Rico Martinez-Ruiz
text: Tom, my salesman, and the rest of the team here at Off Lease are friendly and knowledgeable. Quick and efficient as well; considerate of your time. If you need a ride go check out their inventory!

name: Sean Gore
text:
The worst car buying experience ever.  They presented carfax that was not updated with structural damage and other issues.  Owner is not trust worthy.  Beware!  I have dealt with many car dealers and these guys are crooks!
Ashley Booth (owner) promised to put car back on lot and get me out of this junk, left car outback for 2 weeks with no intention of making it right.
Wow!
I have had to buy second car just to get to work.

name: Cynthia Hurst
text: These guys are LIARS- avoid this place at all costs. They had us drive 90 minutes one way after we called about a specific car they posted on Carguru. THEN THEY CALLED TWICE during our drive to be sure we were coming. After we get there- they smile and tell us the car sold TWO DAYS PRIOR!!! They had NUMEROUS opportunities to be honest and tell us the car was gone. INSTEAD they LIED to bait us in. We took our CASH SALE to a better dealer! RUN AWAY FROM THIS PLACE! Also their ceiling is falling down all over the building - beware for your safety!

name: Rochelle Tripp
text: Can't say enough about the folks at Off-Lease.  We bought our daughter a car and couldn't be happier!  Carl and Ashley went above and beyond to help us.  We still take it in for the routine maintenance.  Highly recommend them and will be back for future purchases!!

name: Silvertip 420
text: I highly recommend the finance director, Michael Cavalcante.  He really made the experience great!  We love our new car.

name: Veronica Jensen
text: I'm giving this 2 stars, because initially, they were great.  I live out of state. My daughter was going to be driving about 2 hours to come look at a car.  A couple of them actually. She called and made an appointment to look at a specific car, that ended up being sold when she got there. I get it... whoever gets there with the $$ first gets the deal... but the other cars that she was going to look at weren't there either.  Guessing they don't keep their website updated or there was a great amount of sales they had within the 2 days.  Just so happened to be the cars that she was going to look at... hmmm..  I was given the direct number for Roger when I originally talked to him.  Like I said, initially was great.  I called and left a message this past Saturday. Still have yet to hear anything back.  Not good customer service, if you ask me. And, they now lost a sale because of it.  There's a great little place down the road that went above and beyond expectations. COAL Wholesale.  Check them out. Rayray is awesome :)

name: Kenya B
text:
I think there are some great people who work here HOWEVER
I purchased my car about 37 days ago. At the time that I purchased the vehicle, all of the paper work went smoothly, my loan was approved, I even provided full coverage insurance and copies of all of my paperwork in order to expedite the tag and registration process. Once the 30 day mark approached I began calling both my bank and the dealership to get information regarding the title to my vehicle so that I could begin applying for the appropriate tag required by LAW for me to drive my vehicle. My bank informed me that the OFF LEASE AUTO car dealership would have my title and all information I would need in order to apply for the proper tag. My bank also informed me that once the dealership received the title it would basically be instantaneously sent over to my bank. With that information I leave the bank alone and begin calling the car dealership for an ESTIMATE of when my title info would arrive, The first day that I called a sales man transferred me to Carla/Carroll's office. No answer. So I left a detailed message. I call twice the next day and get sent to the same office.Left a message. The third day I left them know Carla/Carroll is not answering the phone or returning my phone calls. Jerry writes down a message from me to give to Carroll. I wait a day, still no response, On the 5th day I refuse to be transferred or placed on hold until I get some kind of information on the whereabouts of my title after I purchased the vehicle 34 days. I speak with another salesman who happened to be the man who sold me the vehicle and he states to me that he spoke with Carroll regarding my title, and promised that everything would be settled within 2 hours and that he would return my call in 2 hours. Of course, here I am 72 hours later and still no response, no returned phone calls, and no info about when I MIGHT expect my title. I just think it's ridiculous that I got preapproved through my own bank. saved up for a cash down payment, and provided all the paperwork to ensure there would be NO DELAYS and here I am with a 38 day delay, and absolutely no clue what to do regarding the title of my vehicle other than contact a lawyer.
As a young first time buyer, I honestly feel like at this point they've taken my money and run with it.

name: Rachel Kulman
text: If there was an option for 0 stars I would have chosen that! I bought a car and after purchasing it realized very soon it was a mistake. They take these cars home and drive them for personal use. Sold it to me on slap empty and with brakes that were not safe. When I brought it back to get them fixed, it took 4 hours and then when I was tired of waiting so I was going to get my car and just leave some girl I had never met before and I guess her boyfriend got out of it.. they took my car!! I don't even know where they took it. Now my car drives worse than ever and smells funny. I paid a lot of money and would NOT recommend to a friend.

name: Jay Duncan Delisle
text: It was honestly one of the easiest, fastest, best experience I have ever had buying car. Would definitely recommend to others.

name: tracy nguyen
text: HORRIBLE. I bought a Jeep Grand Cherokee for my little sister and not even 2 weeks and the car broke down in the middle of the street as she was DRIVING. Someone could've been seriously injured! Turns out, alternator was bad. I called to confront him and the man didn't even apologized for selling me a bad car! He just said, "Okay". They are not a man of their words. I would NOT recommend them.

name: Rachel Kulman
text: If there was an option for 0 stars I would have chosen that! I bought a car and after purchasing it realized very soon it was a mistake. They take these cars home and drive them for personal use. Sold it to me on slap empty and with brakes that were not safe. When I brought it back to get them fixed, it took 4 hours and then when I was tired of waiting so I was going to get my car and just leave some girl I had never met before and I guess her boyfriend got out of it.. they took my car!! I don't even know where they took it. Now my car drives worse than ever and smells funny. I paid a lot of money and would NOT recommend to a friend.

name: Shannon Daniel
text: You may seriously want to rethink purchasing a car from this dealership. They did not honor the agreed upon price. They wanted to add on repair charges before I even took possession.

name: Moira flint
text: Jessie James, internet sales manager, and James Cavalcante, finance manager, have enough experience between them to know that the way to build business is to build relationships. No hard sales-just good service and transparency about the deal.  Got a great deal on a 2012 Honda with only 16,000 miles and I'm still smiling.

name: Linda Kane-Poole
text:
The pros and cons of my experience as follows:  We drove to Off Lease
Auto Outlet in Daphne from Northwest FL.  The internet price sounded good for the car I was looking for.  The dealership did honor the internet price.  The car drove nice, and  looked good.  They gave me the NADA book value for my trade in, however there was one stipulation.  I had a hard top made for my car that was my trade in.  It was a convertible, we had it made, it was after market, and costly.  In order to get the book value for my trade in, we had to throw in the hard top.  My trade in was in excellent very clean condition, and very well maintained, had always been garaged.  So we did consent to that, we agreed they could have the hard top, because I wanted a good down payment toward the car I was purchasing.  The owner came over and introduced himself, everyone was very cordial, there was no pressure.  He said he always makes things right with his customers that buy from him.  BUT, as soon as the deal was done, that was it.  As we drove away we noticed there was no key fob on the key ring.  One of the advertised features was automatic start.  They never said one word about that.  Also, there was no owners manual in the car.  So I called the back Off Lease Auto dealership, our salesperson stated that the dealership would not pay for it.  They would contact our local auto dealer in Florida close to our home to see if they would order those items for us at wholesale price.  Which they failed to do.   We called and called and emailed numerous times, our phone calls were dodged, emails left unanswered.  Right after the sale the owner was fast to drive out to our house over an hour away to pick up the expensive aftermarket hard top, that technically  should not have been just thrown into the book value.  That is the last we would hear from any of them.  We went to our local dealer, had the car checked out to make sure it was safe and so we would know if there were any issues.  At the same time we ordered the missing auto start key fob, and owners manual at our own expense, since it was becoming more obvious as each day passed that Off Lease was not going to do anything to make it right as the owner had promised before we signed all the paperwork.  The car also needed an alignment very badly, and marker plate bulbs were out.  This should have been part of their safety check, that is required by law.  They neglected to do, when this was mentioned to the owner when he was picking up the hard top we pretty much gave away to him.  His response was "well, you didn't buy a new car, ya know."   Oh Really now.
Buyer Beware.
I would not recommend this dealership after our experience.  As nice as the people were prior to the purchase, after the deal is done you are on your own.  They are not equipped to do most repairs at their shop, even if they were willing.  Which they stated they would do after we purchase the car.
Best of luck if you do go there, you'll need it.

name: Kim Jackson
text: We highly recommend John Gleason (salesman) and Michael Cavalcante (finance) at Off Lease Auto! Great car - Great price - Excellent service!

name: Kim Mannon
text: BUYER BEWARE!!!! Do not buy a vehicle from this company. I bought a 2011 Honda Pilot from them on October 9, 2017 and as of November 14, 2017 I still have not received my paperwork and check to pay my taxes from them. I have been calling them since November 2, 2017 to talk to Ashley Boothe ,who by the way is the owner. No one will return my phone calls. I’ve called 9 times since then and I keep getting “he just left” he’s not in today “ or yet I get told that it was overnighted on November 10th and it’s the 14th and I still haven’t received it. No one should have to call so much or even wait this long. I payed them $2,000 down and they charged me $499.00 for customer processing fees. Because they have not sent what I need to get my tags and pay the taxes now there are penalties to Pay along with what I already owe. I have talked to Roger ,Max,Ken, and Rickey but still not Ashley who is the one who I’ve been told is the one who does that job.

name: 4our
text: I just got my car today a Honda Accord 2012 my experience here had been so good the sales personal are so nice a very informative I am really happy with the dealer

name: Marci Williams
text: They saved us! Fabulous service. They went above and beyond to help us get into the car we needed.

name: Joe Cucci
text: I was the internet photographer for them for about 9 months. These guys were definitely shady. They hurt a lot of people all for simple greed.

name: Jorge Ramos
text: The place reminds of the movie "Used Cars". If you like scratched up, dented, bald tires, never been serviced, totally abused cars you've found them here.  I saw one out there on Sunday they left open. The oil was coal black, down 2 quarts, the interior was covered in dog hair, it smelled like a dirty gym sock, and the bumper cover was wired on. I mean really.They're cheaper on some of their cars and when you see them you'll know why. I wouldn't by a bicycle from this place.

name: John Dro
text: Stay away from this place, some shady business practices going on here. Here's me story, I purchased a used Cadillac SRX for Off Lease Auto Outlet in Jan 2018 and paid cash along with a trade in of my old car that was paid off. I signed over the title for my old car to them and paid them cash for the balance of the purchase price. I was told that the title and sales taxes that I paid for the vehicle would be sent to me with in 20 days of the transaction. I have called the dmv to see if they received the title and they have not. The DMV recommends calling the dealership to track the title. I have called the dealership probably 30 times to find out what the status of my tile is and spoke to several people there during this process. Some of the names of the people I spoke to are Devin, Jose, Britany, Ricky, Tacey and the Manager. All of which have told me to talk to the owner Ashley Booth who does the title work. I have left several messages with Mr Booth and he has yet to return or take any of my calls. It is now February 27 2018 and my temporary tag on the new used car is expired and I still have not received my title. I have recently hired an attorney to rectify this situation. I started out by sending them a certified demand letter demanding that they send me my title. Apparently Alabama requires sending this before pursuing a legal resolution to the problem. I am currently driving my car on an expired temporary tag. I have filed complaints with the Alabama Attorney General, the Better Business Bureau and filling out as many reviews I can to get the work out. Save yourself some misery and avoid this place! You know what they say "when a deal is to good to be true it probably isn't" This place is shady and needs to be shut down.

name: Jakaveli 7
text: Great service here, they make sure that you are comfortable every time you come in and if you have a problem with your car feel free to ask Carl or kelvin and they will take very good care of you

name: Nichelle Jones
text: Bought a 2013 Kia Soul with a little over 58K miles.  No problems thus far, we would definitely purchase from them again.  Michael Cavalcante was great to work with.  The Kia was missing the rear wiper blade and they had no problem ordering one and getting it put on in less than a week.  BTW no extra charge involved for the wiper blade!

name: Christi Raynor
text: This dealership has good prices but nothing else going for it. We drove 6 hrs for a car we were interested in and we ended up getting it but were sent back to fl without a temp tag, told we didnt need one and to do our tag transfer once we got back. Once we got to the dmv here in fl they told us that we cant do anything without them having the title. Needless to say i have had this car for a month and the dmv still has no title. We were given a temp tag by demand of the dmv here in fl, that has now expired. Everytime you call to discuss a issue your blown off with ill call you back, or im so sorry ill fix it and get back to you, none of that happens. I traded in a vehicle that they still havent paid off to my other lean holder so im getting calls about making a payment. This place is just about taking your money and nothing else. Im here in fl screwed with no way to move around unless illegally. No wonder when you buy a car with them they make you sign a paper saying if you ever have a problem you wont go to court. This place is a joke. Dont buy a car from here

name: Teo Williams
text: Went there and everyone is real friendly, at least until you leave with a car. After you leave youll probably wind up like me waiting almost a month or more for them to update me on why they havent sent my title to the facility i gave and the title tax they promised to pay upon purchace. Not to mention no matter how much i call them to inquire about it i never get an answer. All i recieve is a "promise" that theyll call back to help me but they dont. José will send you to answering machines and brittany will talk over you and say whatever she has to in a rude way to get you off the phone. She told me that the owner just stepped out but hed be back in a few minutes or do so i asked her to call me back in half an hour and she said "to make you feel better?". Well its been an hour and now im writing this. Disgusting service, excuses abound here. Stay away. Spend your hard earned money elsewhere because youll be wasting it on these people who are CLEARLY NOT INTERESTED IN ANYTHING BUT YOUR CASH.

name: Theresa Houston
text: Dont shop here, I wish it was zero stars to rate. something is not right about this dealership. Crooks and schemers. Only wanted me on the credit applications instead both us due to my credit being higher but my husband make more money. What business owner/ finance manager makes a statement saying " dont worry about the income part that will be taking care of" . what dealership only offer one (1) Premium warranty package. Take your money else where. When went ahead did the credit application never gotta valid reason on why they kept pulling my credit with any approvals. I dont trust these people. Thanks but no thanks.

name: Michael Burgos
text: I bought a Ford Fusion 2016 about two months ago, they never gave me my title application and papers. Now I am trying to solve through the Police because they washed their hands they hide they never answer the calls and when I go they will not let me in. I hope someday to fix this problem. I never bought again. and if someone thinks to buy they suggest that you do not think about it and do not do it because everyone who works is the worst I regret having bought a car in that place. I hate this place

name: Shane Walker
text: Fooled by this dealership. Sounds like a great idea for a used car dealer but trust me this place does not sell quality used vehicles. I purchased an suv with 98k miles and thought paying a little more for a 1 owner vehicle I'd get something better taken care of, I did not. Within the first week the rear door window/lock controls stopped working, the rear lift gate handle had to be replaced to be able to continue opening the hatch. Now less than 1 month later the engine began misfiring and had to have new spark plugs, no problem I'd have done it at 100k anyway but then the check engine light came on for jumping time and will have to have 3 new timing chains. On top of this although not near as severe the paint had apparently been touched up with less than quality paint or by someone without knowledge of painting because it has started to come off in a dramatic fashion. Please trust me and do not buy a vehicle from these crooks. They are not selling anything better than buy here pay here lots with sky rocketed price tags.

name: John D Flowers
text: Awesome experience with Off Lease Auto!! Have recently purchased 2 vehicles, everyone went the extra mile.to get  the price we needed!!

name: Patricia Moondancers
text: I had done tons of the research the 2008 Chrysler Town & Country Touring. I had looked through many sites and found the perfect one at Off Lease Auto Outlet in Daphne. I drive all the way to the dealership and test drive the 2008 Chrysler Town & Country Touring. On the test drive I had looked the automobile over. Inside and out. On inspection I did find a few scratches here and there. NO cracked windshield. Got inside to start the paperwork. This is where things started going down hill. I had brought a print out of the 2008 Chrysler Town & Country Touring  from the Off Lease Auto Outlet webpage. The price that was on the internet was $6,997. The dealer Stephen tried to tell me that the car was listed incorrectly on the website. If this was true it had been listed incorrectly for 68 days. Not likely. Stephen then told me that I would have to pay $8,999 for the 2008 Chrysler Town & Country Touring  that was listed for $6,997. I told Stephen that, this was incorrect and that they were supposed to honor the online price. After about 30 min. to an hour of going back and forth with Stephen and the dealership about the price. They finally agreed to sell the van to me at the price of $6,997, which was only fair. I was taken over to the finance man and we started working on the paperwork. Then another problem came up. They did not want to finance the low amount and wanted to "add" some to the price so that it could be financed. This was insane I had never heard of adding to a price just to get the automobile financed. So, we left the dealership empty-handed.  I then called Stephen two days later and let him know that I would like to pay cash for the 2008 Chrysler Town & Country Touring . I even made a $1,500 down payment over the phone due to the fact that I was in the hospital recovering from an unexpected  illness. Stephen told me that they would bring the van around back and park it till I can come pick it up. I go a few weeks later to pick up the van. I noticed tinny pings from gravel or something all over the windshield after driving off the lot and down the road. When I called about this I was told that they could do nothing to help with this problem that they had already lost so much selling me the van at the price that I saw it advertised for on the website.  The next day that I came out to get in the van the little ping marks had turned into full blown cracks. This did not occur in my drive. A windshield does not crack like that overnight. Something happened to the van while it was on the lot. But Off Lease Auto Outlet refused to make it right by either repairing or replacing the windshield that was cracked while the van sat on their lot. I was told by Stephen that "It was not their problem now" I thought that Off Lease Auto Outlet would want to make this right and correct the situation. All I got was a run around and spoken very rude to by Off Lease Auto Outlet Staff. So now I have an automobile that is three days old to me and it just sits in my drive because it is illegal to drive an automobile with a cracked windshield. I was told file it on my insurance. Only problem there is it happened on the lot not by fault of mine. So now I have to save at lease $500 or more to replace the windshield of an automobile that I just bought. I will NEVER buy another automobile from this shady lot again. I can not believe this lot did this. I thought there were laws in place to prevent this type of thing. I would not have even given Off Lease Auto Outlet in Daphne one star but I had to give a rating to post my review. It should be a minus five stars. Such horrible customer service and the staff was so rude. They refused to fix a problem that was a fault of their own. Buyer beware, this dealership also pressure washed the motor to make it look clean so you will not think there are any leaks or anything wrong with an automobile. Go anywhere but Off Lease Auto Outlet in Daphne, Al.

name: Kate Sims
text: worst experience ever! Bought a 2014 dodge avenger with 9999 miles for a little more than 13000, sounds 2 good 2 b true, it sure was, It has been in an unclaimed accident, the front bumper was tied up so it wouldnt fall off, a head gasket blew now theres radiator fluid in my oil, she over heated the other day and now it wont start, i had 2 pay 100 bucks 2 have it towed but still have a car payment due every month so i dont ruin my credit but unfortunately i dont have money for 2 payments, im a single mother of two who works very hard for the things i have & 2 think these idiots sold me a car that could have ultimately seriously hurt or even killed us. The molding on the passenger side was torn half off & theres scratches & dents all along the underneath. The grill was held on by 1 screw, the rest were missing because  whatever the car hit bent the radiator into a v shape and nothing now will fit correctly, Cylinder 4 has misfired since iv had the car, had a tune up & fixed a bad coil, tier pressure doesnt hold, Iv lawyered up & have spoken 2 the attorney general, alabama as well as maine has a lemon law & we're going 2 deal with these idiots accordingly!!!! Please do yourself a favor stay away from these rotten scheming fake bunch of hicks & find a decent car through a decent dealership.....

text: I don't write reviews, but this place deserves one. text: I had a fairly decent experience. Wayne did a good job of taking care of me and my interest. The vehicle I bought needed some minor work and Tony wouldn't let me buy the vehicle until those needs were met. They even let me take the Tahoe I bought to a mechanic of my choosing for a pre-purchase inspection. I was mostly satisfied. Thank you Wayne, Tony and Keith!
