text: Great place, great people! Tellis was very helpful in getting me in the best car possible. I highly recommend.

name: Jacy Hopkins
text: My husband and I were preapproved through a lender and we started shopping for vehicles. We drove almost 100 miles to test drive a 2014 Honda Pilot, decided we liked it, our lender sent the paperwork to the dealership, “Big Al” said the title person was gone for today and he would email us anything we needed to sign in the morning, not to worry the vehicle was ours and wasn’t going to be sold to anyone. The next day rolls around and we cannot get in touch with Al. Our lender cannot get in touch with Al. Finally later in the afternoon the lender gets in touch with him and he says he’s going to get the paperwork (bill of sale and signed 30 day warranty guarantee) sent over which he doesn’t do until the following day. We sign all necessary paperwork with the lender and call to let Al know they would be sending a check at the beginning of the week as he pushed back the paperwork until late Friday afternoon, we can’t get him on the phone. Try to reach him again on Saturday and can’t get him on the phone. Try to reach him again Monday and I’m sure you know how it goes at this point. The lender says they are sending a check out today. We call and can’t get Al again so we call the dealership directly to find out that they sold the car out from underneath us because Al claimed he had no heard from us or the lender and couldn’t get in touch with us. Mind you I already purchased insurance for this vehicle which Geico is now charging me to cancel the policy on. Highly disappointed in the lack of professionalism. Would not recommend this dealer to absolutely anyone. You’re better off taking your hard earned money somewhere else and spending it.

name: Brianna Johnson

name: Chasity Cox
text: After the run around looking for dependable transportation i found myself at suncoast. The salesperson tommie was very helpful with getting me into a car. I started having problems with the car the following month of actually getting the car. The owner was very rude about having to fix the car (that was never fixed from the start because it was in the back of the lot right off of a truck that brought cars in). 5 days After taking my car back to be fixed because my hood wouldnt close it turned out to be more problems with the car than expected. The owner complained about how much money he had to put into getting the car fixed which wasn't my fault. I made him aware that this was the only transportation and that my kids had missed the entire week of school and he said "well! U asked us to fix the car so we are fixing it" after my husband heard how i was being spoken to on the phone by the owner he told the owner that he didnt appreciate the way he was speaking to me. The owner then called the finance company and purchased the car back from them while the car was in his possession without letting me know what was happening. After calling from several different numbers (because they would no longer answer for mine) i finally spoke with the owner and he was extremely rude and my husband over heard the conversation and intervened letting the owner know that he wouldn't talk to me in that manor. Even After apologizing for him being rude to me or what he thought was getting smart with him he pretty much told me it was nothing he could do about my down payment or the payments I've made towards purchasing the vehicle. The owner is very unprofessional and rude he is not sympathetic with anyone and if i could give this car lot 0 stars i would. I would never recommend anyone that i know to this car lot they are a scam not to mention I've had the car since march and never recieved my tag paper work so I'm stuck paying tickets for a car i no longer have and EVERYTHING that has happened is because of suncoast unprofessional owner and the scams that he pull. I hope the next mother that is working hard to take care of her kids will read this and not waste money with these clowns because if u let them they'll take advantage of u too and take all out your money leaving u and kids stranded while they get richer off of messing over kind people.

text: the folks at Sun Coast City are wonderful!  so easy to deal with and work to get me the car I wanted.  I would highly recommend them!  Great selection and many financing options.  No need to go anywhere else - they take great care of their customers!!!

name: Sheena Marie
text:
Just spoke to the owner who after telling me he would not be sending someone to help me with a car that broke down in less than 60 days  hung up in my face.

I called to inform them that the car was not cranking and I had just paid the first car note.  He said he would send someone to jump me off and nothing else. I asked would the problem be fixed and he said they could inspect it for $75.  I explained to him that I didn’t understand why I would have to pay. He then informed me of how I should have inspected the car myself and that he would not send anyone and hung up.

When I purchased the car I was told that they had just gotten the car but now they want me to pay them to do something that should have been done!

I am still wondering why this car wasn’t inspected  before the car left the lot!

There is a such thing as bad business practices and unethical business.
I am a single mother who trusted the wrong car lot.

name: Christina Kunde
text: the folks at Sun Coast City are wonderful!  so easy to deal with and work to get me the car I wanted.  I would highly recommend them!  Great selection and many financing options.  No need to go anywhere else - they take great care of their customers!!!

text: I have never been so totally impressed with any business as I am with Suncoast City Auto Sales. Al and Tommy are amazing, the entire staff is AMAZING. I was treated so kindly, I was in tears, literally.  GO THERE IF YOU NEED A CAR!! You'll never regret it!!!

name: Kimberly Hicks
text: It was horrible I won't refer anyone there ! I had put money down and the employee told me I could bring $700 back instead of $1000 so when it was all said and done after having the car for a week they took it when I came to pay the $700 and made me and my 1 year old stand In the heat for over a hour I wouldn't be upset if it would have been just me ! I even asked them to bring me close to home which was 35 minutes away ! Needless to say this company sucks. Oh and also was reading the reviews and someone faked my middle name and gave them a 5 star rating ! Negative rating DEFINITELY ! has been reported.

name: Chase Spitzkopf
text: Unfortunately one star is being given where credit is not due...in reality this company earns a negative five stars. Excellent model for HOW NOT TO RUN A SMALL BUSINESS. However, if you are searching for a previously auctioned, molested, sketchy scratch and dent daily driver for 10-20% over NADA this is a wonderful place to consider. Customer service is a foreign language for these people. They don't give two ***** about you, and rightfully so (being business people) but they could at least attempt to. A salesman actually posted positive reviews to mitigate the negatives. Do yourself a favor and steer clear, just my $0.02.

text: My sales person was Paul Baker. Paul met us in the parking lot and help us every step of the way. He was very professional and I would recommend him as a salesperson.

name: Matt Schroeder
text: Do not talk to Paul. I called specifically to see if a specific vehicle was still available. He put me on hold to check, and told me it was. We drove over from Baldwin county at 6pm, and they had sold it a week ago. No apology was given. He tried to show us another vehicle. We didn’t waste our time.

name: Benjamin Smith
text: How do places like this stay in business? Looks like the few positive reports they received were employees posing as customers. (Henry & Parrish )  Bought a car on a Saturday evening. They promised to repair before I signed final paperwork.  After I took car home, salesman never would return calls. Since no one will call me back I decide to wait until someone does call me to go back and sign final paperwork. Finally, 3 weeks later the owner calls accusing me of avoidiing them! I was irate, told him I've been waiting on salesman or anyone for that matter to return my call. Tell him I still want car If they want to sell it as long as fender is repaired    Of course he takes employee side and says I never called and they never promised to fix anything. At this point I just wanted to return car, he said I could but then they would not return my down payment. Basically they robbed me. Buyer Beware. Avoid this place like the plague !! Where's Donald Trump when you need him ?

They were tremendously helpful and walked me through everything, and felt bad I wasnt able to follow through today.

It’s like they do not care about anything that happens to their customers and its hasn’t been 30 days since I purchased it. Not only that they lied about the contract and I had to pay extra than what I agreed on. Worst dealership ever! Never do business here.

text:
I bought my car from Chris and he was great. We had a small issue with the windshield wipers and set an appointment and they fixed it right away.

It's nice to know they do what they say they are going to do!

name: Laura Strachan
text: Tommy is a great sales man and the owner was fabulous with us. Definatley coming back to purchase another car later.

name: FBA Forget Being Average
text: Do not I repeat do not buy any vehicles from this car lot. Just from my last visit there they have car salesmans in the office cousin out loud yelling across the room to one another which this is supposed to be a place of business not the ghetto. Very unprofessional people including the owner. My wife and I purchased a truck from this dealership it had issues that they promised to fix. We brought the truck back as instructed. They didn't have time to fix everything so the owner told my wife to bring it back but when we try to bring it back he tried to charge us for Diagnostics as if the old problems were already fixed when they were not fixed we did not need another diagnostic considering the old issues were never completed in the first place so he wanted to charge us for Diagnostics and charge us for the work. In the beginning we were told we would only have to pay for the parts. If they tell you they're going to do something make sure you get them to put it in writing because they will go back on their word I can assure you of that.

name: Anthony BAZZEL
text: I have nothing but good things to say about my experience at Suncoast. I still cant understand how they were able to secure my car loan, with the credit issues I brought to the table. I am now the proud owner of a 2013 Nissan Altima and I love it! If you need a vehicle I would definitely go see them.

name: Scott Caris
text: Tim is awesome !!! Was in and out in less then an hour !! Iwill be back

name: Christopher Hodoh
text:
I recently purchased a BMW from Suncoast and had a great experience.

I had some credit issues but they were able to get me financing and deliver the car to me the same day!

I would recommend them!

name: Mary Dailey
text: Horrible business. They are professional scam artists and try to take advantage of you in every way possible, from hiding the immense issues with the cars to putting USED tires on the brand new overpriced car you just bought.  Why would you replace used tires with used tires? The tires on the car bought were bald, with written intentions that Suncoast would replace the tires AND get the car a much needed alignment. They lied about the alignment and then put used tires on it. "Your safety is our priority, we'll fix it."....After 6+ months, that promise  has not been honored. Phone calls are not returned, the people in the building are disrespectful. Also, it's childish to try to cover up your bad reviews, own up to your scam tactics and fix yourself before you go out of business. To those of you who are looking to purchase a car, stay VERY far away from this place...with all due respect.

name: Thuy Flowers
text: Tim Henry is the reason I bought my car, such a good salesman 🙌🏼 And I'm so in love with my car 😻

name: Jennifer Gaspard
text: Shane ,our dealer that my wife Danielle Gaspard and i had was amazing . he did what he said and got us in a vehicle we love our 2010 buick enclave .also Tracey who Danielle and I dealt with was amazing so nice and friendly the machanic who looked over the enclave as my wife had a ton of questions lol but he was very patient and making sure we understood what was being done ,so with all that being said i"m really looking forward to buying another vehicle with suncoast and their staff thanks guys!!!!!

text: I purchased a vehicle from this place last year and found out the truth behind it after i hit a minor pothole. THE CAR HAD BEEN IN A PREVIOUS WRECK NOT ONCE BUT TWICE. The saleman failed to offer me a carfax up front like most dealer do now. After i found out it was wrecked i told them about it and they it was nothing they could do. I could not trade it in or switch out the car. After they found out about it, they blame the auction where they purchase the car from which was Texas Motors. After been inspected by a collision company they discovered that it had poor body work under the so called "good paint job". The car looked good, But it was under all that what was hiding. Took it to FORD and they couldn't even activated the airbags because the control panel was tricked. All Parrish (THE INTERNET GUY) could say was "i dont know anything about the cars someone else does that, I just sale them". The car suppose to been totled out but wasn't. I had to surrender it cause no one would take it. But in the end I got a better car, for a price FROM ANOTHER DEALER. Will never bring my love ones here NEVER. I pray god corrects their blindsided ways.

name: David Tipton
text: Was a horrible experience. Please do not go there. I am warning everyone. They are sketchy from the start. They will continue to be sketchy till its all over. I was working on my loan with the company they approved me with. Talked to a lady with the loan to finish up paperwork and Suncoast sent a repo. Weeks before I even had a payment due. Tried to keep my downpayment. They charged me 200 for repo that shouldn't even of been repoed. Recommend definitely looking around at other dealerships. I have had way better luck with ano the dealer that took care of the problems with the vehicle I now have.

name: Lina Manning
text: What a joke of a manager. My car sales man was really nice. I decided not to buy the car which put me on a rental status. The car I was looking at buying had an exhaust leak, it had been in a front end collision and was falling apart. The work that needed to be done was not a issue. When I went in to get my money back the manager Tony took his sweet time in getting to me and was really rude about it. I brought the car back yesterday at 8:15 am and it was 2:30 by the time he decided he would deal with me. He charged me 100$ for 2 days that I didnt even have the car fully (picked it up monday night close to closing and returned yesterday at opening). He told me in the middle of fighting with him about the days that "this country has laws" which obviously. He fought with me about paying me back my money when I hadnt even signed the purchase agreement. He told me I was lucky he wasnt charging me for gas, to have it cleaned and washed. I received the car with no gas in it at all and it was dirty. There were mold spores growing on the roof and the roof was cracked on the exterior. Functions in the car didnt work properly and the transmission was on its way out. The brakes had two inches of play in them. 5 miles down the road the service light had come on and the car started shifting funny. Took it to Advanced Auto and had them hook it up. It gave a malfunction code. Which I didnt stress cause it had gone away within a hour, but had called about it. They had lost the keys to it but did have 2 new keys made. The manager of this place is extremely rude, especially towards women. I had raised my voice and told him it was BS that he was charging me for days I didnt have the car and that I had to wait 6.5 hours for him to cut me a check back of my own money. He threw me out of his office after I had to fight the check out of him. This is a place I will never do business. I have never met someone so rude in customer service and called him out on it. I lost 322.56 to this guy and he told me he wasnt making a dime. Looks to me like he made a few hundred. I dont have a issue paying what I needed to pay but I do have a issue of paying for days that the car was not in a possession for the full day. I would have payed less at a car rental company instead of 50$ a day and .36 a mile. This place is highway robbery. They wanted 22k for a 2007 Ford Explorer Eddie Bauer Edition with 122k on it that was falling apart. Good thing my husband had no interest in buying this vehicle and we returned it. I couldnt imagine being locked down to this guy for the next 4 years. My recommendation is to not do business with this company solely do to the guy who manages it and he will rip you off. He treats his own employees like crap. The only reason they got 1 star is because not possible to leave it blank.

name: Tameka Brooks
text:
Been waiting on my car to be fixed from the service department for almost 2 months now. Been given excuse after excuse. Can barely reach anyone on the phone. They tell you they’ll call you back but don’t. Now I did get only (1) call back from Chris these almost 2 months. I guess I should be satisfied with that.
Chris W did admit they dropped the ball with how long I’ve been waiting. This is unacceptable. But here’s the question: Do they care? My answer: No they don’t.
They tell you whatever just to keep pushing you out of the way!

name: Jack Norris
text: Next to bottom on experience. Salesman was nice but never even presented an offer not willing to deal so bought new from Jim Burke and love it.

name: Michael G
text: I purchased my car at this dealership new this year.  I reached my first service interval and SCHEDULED an appointment.  I had to wait 2.5 hours for an oil change and tire rotation.  This is unacceptable at any level.  If they cannot handle the volume then the service manager should be metering their schedule better.  From a customer service point of  view, the manager was "unavailable;" typical, let everyone else feel the frustration of the customer due to your decisions.  Great place to buy a car but because they cannot transfer that experience to the service department, where customer service really begins, I HIGHLY suggest that you find somewhere else.  I was a raving fan of this dealership; however, they have proved me wrong.  I WILL NOT go back unless I can leave my car there all day for a factory recall.  That is it.  Shameful.  If I was this owner I would fire that service manger today and find someone that could do the job.

name: Destiny Sims
text: I had the pleasure to work with Myron Deskins who truly treated me like he would his own daughter. He went above and beyond to get me the exact car I wanted (in the exact color too!) Trust me when I say you won't be disappointed. He's not your typical car salesman. He's patient and down to earth and doesn't beat around the bush on what you're getting. Also loved working with the Sales Manager Tracy Case who also went above and beyond in getting the car as close to my asking monthly rate as possible. These people are absolute wizards. 10/10 would definitely work with again.

name: CullLivesMatter Support the Cause
text: Originally gave one star due to bad experience with one of their employee. But after talking to Jeff he got me approved and answered the questions I had. Can't wait to meet him and pick up my new truck.

name: Lenora Ramsey-Johnston
text: I had a great experience at the Service Dept today! Service Advisor Tracy and Service Manager Jay were awesome! They kept me informed and were friendly and knowledgeable. The snacks in the Service Dept waiting room are a nice touch.

name: Dan East
text: Took our car in for a recall repair. Car was running fine before we took it in. As soon as we left, the engine light came on and the car would not go over 40mph. Called to report the issue and the very rude lady in the service department told us they were busy and we would have to bring it back the next day. After taking ANOTHER day off of work, we took the car back and the service department suddenly found some “additional issues” that needed to be repaired. Of course, the cost of these repairs landed on us. None of these issues existed until we had to bring it in for the recall. The lady was very rude to my wife and made it clear that the only reason they were correcting the recall issue for us was because she could tell my wife is a front-line healthcare worker from her scrubs. She also had the nerve to tell my wife she was free to come back, “once you’ve saved the money to pay for the repairs,” insinuating that we couldn’t afford to pay for repairs on the spot.  I will never buy another vehicle from this dealership again or bring my current vehicle back for repairs. Kia should fire everyone that works here and start from scratch.

name: Chantale Summerville
text:
I want to start this review with saying their sales rep Lanesha has constantly and consistently given me wonderful service. However my experience with this dealership has been far to horrible to even give a them a single star. I am doing a 5 start review for her SPECIFICALLY because this is the only way to give HER, the recognition she deserves.

They are understaffed in their service department which has forced me to go to local shops for maintenance as getting an appointment for even an oil change is an all day event. The local companies killed my car, so I traded it in. When doing so JEFF practically tried to scam me. I bought the car in April and didn’t receive any of my paper work until the end of may, that net me a $15 penalty with the DMV for late registration. My payoff check wasn’t sent to my original holder until JUNE 2nd after Calling nearly twice a week since buying the car. Now I have to go through the issue of getting my payments reapplied and corrected so that I’m not in the red on my current vehicle.  If you really really want a Kia go somewhere else. He should never have been allowed to do my paperwork if he wasn’t going to do it right, especially when I left with what I feel is a cheaper version of the car I had.

Once this is settled and over I hope to never have to step foot near this place again. And I say this whole heartedly the sales rep Lanesha is the only reason and I mean ONLY reason I have not outright reported this location to anyone that would listen.

She NEEDS a bonus, raise and a few days paid vacation because she has been the only one in the entire building that has actually helped me. I’ve spoken with 2 finance mangers, the sales manager, and a girl in service and out of all of those ppl Lanesha was the one pressing my issue to make sure it was resolved even though she’s in sales and no longer had any part of it. I really truly want to give her, JUST HER the 5 stars. The location as a whole though -5.

name: United Federation
text: After they had our vehicle for 7 days... We broke down 2 blocks away from the dealership after they worked on it.  Separately..  Beware.  We suspect fraud on behalf of Riverchase KIA.  They are doing unnecessary work and lying to their customers.   They replaced a belt that they had just passed on an inspection prior. A belt with only 12,000 miles usage on it. Separate dealership says that the work they did was unnecessary.   Do not trust their service department, they will gouge you.  We had been loyal customers for more than a decade and this is what they did to us.  This is the first time our vehicle has had to have 3 servicings in 1 month.  The 3rd time to correct and check  the work of the 2nd.  The 2nd servicing was 3 days after our first servicing and our vehicle wouldn't start 3 days later.   After it had passed their 30 point or whatever safety inspection with flying colors..   We had went to their service department because we bought the car there and spent $28,000.   I didn't know they would gouge us to get even more money out of us for servicing..

name: Eric Sanders
text: I went here cause i saw something online to i just went in to check it out. so i am used to everyone telling me i make enough or i don't make enough or i need a co signer or a larger down payment.but that changed once i got inside.the car i went it to try to get was sold time i got there .but no problem they got all of my information.and they ask me to hold on while they check some things out .i say i waitied about 15 min and the guy came back ans said i got you something better then what u wanted. I was like wow this got to be. Trick.to my surprise they got me in a. Awesome car .that fit's my budget.drove of the lot in it.so if u need a car this is the place to go .just to Add my Creidt is not go at all. So i would like to thank my sales Man. Sutton Burleigh

name: Madison Cannon
text: Worst experience ever. Purchased a car in December of 2020 and am still unable to get out of state tags for it. First, the paperwork to get our tags (including the title) was mailed to the wrong location by the dealership so my husband had to hunt it down at the incorrect location and we had to turn it in to the tax office ourselves. However, said paperwork was incomplete/incorrect and after speaking with several employees my husband finally spoke with someone who PROMISED that they would have the correct papers overnighted. That was over 2 weeks ago...and as of today our local tax office has yet to receive any paperwork from them. I am to the point of requesting that they repo the vehicle as I refuse to continue to be pulled over and pay traffic tickets for something that is out of my control. Will NEVER do business with them again.

name: Gibran Mancus
text: I have two main complaints about Kia Riverchase. I bought a car there this summer. First thing I was when I discovered a star in the windshield on the way home. Yes, I missed it but it was hidden behind the visor. Second thing, I am dealing with now is the “new” tires on the car. I just developed a flat and discovered a plug in the “new” tire. I am an agreeable person but tried to be attentive to getting cheated. Do not trust these guys. They will tell you anything. Quote, “we believe in full disclosure,” bovine scatology! Is this any different than other dealers, probably not, but buyer be ware. Also, the financial guys can’t be trusted. I came in with a loan from my bank, the dealership has an agreement with my bank, they tried to change all the arrangements of the loan. The financial guy also did not follow the law on wearing mask, putting me and my father at risk in his office. So really four complaints.  So far.

name: Wesly Denton
text: Excellent experience! Excellent trade allowance! Excellent salesman! Excellent finance manager! Excellent service! Excellent on being informative! Excellent patience! Excellent attitudes! All around excellent! Thanks Riverchase Kia!!!

name: Johnny Nunn
text: Went there to get car looked at for a antifreeze smell from my car. They can't find the leak. They are nice and professional but can't find the leak. Car runs fine. Been 30 mths trying to find leak. Guess I will have to find it myself. Antifreeze level is always correct. Haven't had to add any antifreeze. I don't know if it is a defect or what. Even the shop personnel smelled it.

name: S W
text: Good luck finding an employee who wants to help you. they'll just hand you off to the first person they see, if they even want to help. Most unprofessional experience I've ever dealt with.

name: Wanda Perkins
text: It's sad when you get greeted to look at cars and the one helping you comes out with no mask on to tell you mostly all dealers had the virus. Just might have missed a sale. PLEASE MASK UP FOR EVERYONE  SAFTY.

name: tori Peoples
text: I had a bad experience with a previous car dealer and decided to go with Kia. When I say it was such a blessed experience. I cried in the car. I had been through so much trying to get a reasonable car for me and my girls. They made it happen. They were friendly, professional, empathetic, knowledgeable. I got to say thanks to my dealer Harvey, thanks to Justin the manager, Lanesha for encouraging me to just try, Terry and Jeff for looking out for the the best interest for me and my family. I know the goal is to sale cars but they also make sure you’re happy every step of the way. You’re looking at the owner of a new 2021 Kia K5.

name: Quavardis Morrell
text:
Ok let me explain something to whomever is reading this....YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR....is an understatement! I came in with questions and left out fully knowledgeable, confident and most importantly ROLLING OUT IN A NEW K5 & FULLY COVERED! I am a sales manager and I know when people try to add things not needed or when they assume and leave things out....THAT WAS NOT THE CASE HERE!!!

SHELINA was my personal advocate not just Salesperson, and I don't feel as if I've gotten "GOT" I feel BLESSED!!!
She went over everything and is even helped me with a plan to build "My Future Credit" as well as how to understand what the financing companies look for. I haven't always used a credit card nor have a strong credit history  but  SHELINA has an ALL STAR OF SALES & FINANCE MANAGERS behind her like MR BEN & MR WOODY,  when I say they worked with me to overcome that and I'm fully covered in a 2021!!! They did not run my credit for no reason, until after we game planned first, with an estimate of what my credit was and the potential interest rate w/o down-payment and took it from there!!!

Also her team is SUPER SUPER FRIENDLY and helpful!!! So if you are reading this if you don't have HER nor Riverchase in your CORNER  you just been sold and have a  car!!!

(Don't make the mistake I did at first and wasted my time and dignity at Gardendale Kia)

Get you a RIVERCHASE KIA!!!
Thanks again
Shelina and yall ask for her she's great!!!

name: Ashley Yates
text: My husband and I came to see MOJO back in January 2020 and got our Forte. We recently just went back on Saturday 8/29/2020 and purchased a Sorento from mojo. He is absolutely the BEST! He cares about what you want and is realistic. We went in with a couple different options and we walked out with the best option for us and our financial needs. Our daughter is a huge fan and he makes sure the kids have stuff to keep them occupied while you are in there. We didn't spend all day in there, which we liked when we bought the forte. We have definitely told our friends and family about our experience and we will definitely be back. Jeff and Justin remembered us from back in January as well and its nice to be remembered by name/face and not forgotten.  GREAT JOB RIVERCHASE KIA!!!

name: Ron McCurdy
text: This dealership does not communicate up front when requesting quotes on service. Also, they are not timely in completing service.

name: Alexis Dunfee
text: Just to have your car looked at takes over a week, not including repair time. They are unable to make a reservation so you just have to leave your car to "wait in line to be seen". While knowing they won't get to it for days. Then to pay out will take almost an hour. The manager will hold your paperwork while checking in other customers so you have to wait more. I paid for a rental car out of pocket when they told me it would be 3-5 days for a diagnostic. I took my car back after 8 days and a complete diagnostic was not performed (I declined repairs as they were already more than the value of the car). I heard them telling someone else 3-5 days when picking up my car and the day before the manager told me 3-5 is a "miscommunication" it's actually 5-8 days. They are purposely "miscommunicating" with customers to get them in the door. So I left with the cost of what diagnostic they did do and 8 days of car rental fees. The repair workers and service assistant were nice but the manager made it obvious she couldn't care less. I am now searching for a new car and will not be purchasing a Kia solely because I do not want to deal with this service department ever again. Also, if you are worried about COVID, two people that worked there wore a face mask.

name: Lisa Carter
text: This place is a joke as well as Kia.  My daughter's 2015 Kia Soul has been here 3 times because it uses a quart of oil every 500  miles.  Kia refuses to replace the engine.  The oil consumption is causing the catalytic converter to clog up and cause more issues. The first time we were quoted $1500 to replace the convertor, we put catalytic convertor cleaner in it and it cleared up.  Took the car in this last time to have 3 recalls done on it and they again say they can't do anything about the oil consumption and that the converter needs to be replaced. This time they quote $800 to replace it.  My daughter goes to pick the car up and they make her pay over $200 to pick her car up for diagnostic fee on the catalytic convertor.  If they had looked at the history on her car, they would have seen where they just did the diagnostic a month or so ago.  This place is a joke and I will never own another Kia nor take her car back to this dealership. Sitting on hold right now to speak to someone in service.  Been on hold for over 12 min at this point. After 20 min on hold I hung and called Mr. Dean per the invoice my daughter got.  Ok so Mr. Dean no longer works there, so I get someone else's voicemail.  Left a message, lets see how long it takes for them to call me back.

name: Kurty C
text: MOJO!!!!!! Is that absolute best. I had the most pleasant time, it was like talking to an old friend. MOJO had me in and out of there in a couple hours, did not waste my time and got me the deal and car that I wanted. Very satisfied customer!

name: Natalie Rodriguez
text:
WOW!!!!!
I have been buying cars for over 3 decades from dealerships.
NEVER, NEVER, have l had a wonderful time, as l did these last two days.
I gave Mr Rodriguez "cool" Edwards a tough time in the beginning.
Mr "cool" kept cool and just determined to have me leave in a brand new car and leave soooooo Happy.
I was given the red carpet treatment. You would have thought l was buying 3 or more cars in cash.
Mr Harvey and ALL the A STARS there, gave so much respect.
I never ever thought l would be a lifetime customer for any dealership, BUT this is not just any dealership.
IF YOU HATE CAR SHOPPING, then 💋 those days 👋.
See Mr. Rodriguez Edward and he will make your car buying experience in a 🤗!

name: NEPHETERIA HORN
text: Piss poor service! I waited three hours for an oil change with an appointment! Appointment was at 10 left out at 2:00! AWFUL! I WILL NOT BE BACK!

name: Sam Roberson (Sam R)
text: Took my Nissan in to get some service as it was close to home. The service manager was so wonderful and walked me through the whole process, both service advisors were curtious. I only waited 45 minutes. 10/10 recommend! Will definitely be going back!

name: Diamond
text: I worked with Johnathan ,but he goes by Mojo. I explain to him that I had challenged credit from the very beginning. Everything was going well until I decided to accept  his offer which was a New Forte. The down payment that was agreed upon changed and I was ok with it ,because it wasn’t  much. He text me back and told me the car wasn’t going to be ready until “probably Wednesday”. To me this is very shady. If it’s a new car why isn’t it ready? I should’ve known he was shady with he told me to enter more on  income on the application. I haven’t heard anything from him.

name: Thomas Rooney
text: I had some difficulties with a salesperson and a used car but after speaking with the manager I had an incredibly satisfactory experience there and left with a great car.

name: NEPHETERIA HORN
text: Piss poor service! I waited three hours for an oil change with an appointment! Appointment was at 10 left out at 2:00! AWFUL! I WILL NOT BE BACK!

name: Sam Roberson (Sam R)
text: Took my Nissan in to get some service as it was close to home. The service manager was so wonderful and walked me through the whole process, both service advisors were curtious. I only waited 45 minutes. 10/10 recommend! Will definitely be going back!

name: Derrick Lewis
text:
The staff is kind, but there is almost none of the staff that are adhering to COVID-19 social distancing or face covering guidelines. The waiting room is very small and has poor ventilation, so as someone who is trying to get my car serviced while still being very careful, this is a very nerve-wracking experience. Please improve your efforts to keep your patrons safe during this pandemic.

Edit: Updating my review to 3 stars, and I will also add that if we weren’t in a pandemic, this would have been the best service I’ve received from any service department. My associate was extremely helpful and got me out of there as fast as possible, and I will be back to see him after the pandemic is over with.

name: Lydia Ford
text: Zero stars if I could. 10/10 recommend any Kia dealership but this one. My car had an engine failure recall which Kia is responsible for replacing at no cost to the consumer. They were going to fix it as they are required to do but would not put me in a loaner or assist with a rental! ALL the other dealerships offer loaner programs or assist with Enterprise rentals and apparently this is personal decision made by individual dealerships 😡 Tracy and Nicole the "managers" were less than helpful, just kept repeating the same thing "Our dealership does not offer those programs". I had my car towed from their dealership to Sierra in Gardendale. Gardendale's service team was AMAZING got me in a loaner within 10 minutes of my car being pulled in by tow. If one dealership can be so great, why is Riverchase so awful??? They personally don't care at all about their consumers and I will never be back to Riverchase even for a oil change EVER. Brent in Riverchase's service department, as well as  Sam, were the only positive experiences I had. I feel bad for them having to tell consumers no when their hands are tied by the big guys in the office raking in all the free money Kia gives them for fixing recalled vehicles. Go ANYWHERE but here!

name: Cynthia Wilson
text: Purchased a new car feb 14th 2020 found a hole in the head rest on the way home called up there took 8 months to get it fixed. Rear view mirror broke was told they would have to keep my car 48 hrs to fix the rear view mirror it never got fixed. My tire kept going flat took it up there to get fixed waited three and a half hours for a oil change and for them to tell me the extra road hazzard warranty I purchased would not cover the tire. Very rude and hard to get anything done.

name: sarah jones
text: Terrible customer service in the SERVICE DEPARTMENT!  This rating is not for the actual mechanics but the “service” reps that works with the customers.  It’s so bad that I would drive 3 hours away for work on my car before I dealt with these guys again!!

name: Madison Johnson
text:
Bought 2 cars from Riverchase Kia, great experiences both times. Maintenance on the other hand has always been an issue. This past week we scheduled tires and for them to look at the driver window button. My husband had went and gotten a quote on that over a week prior. Got to the appointment on time, @8:30am and the car wasn't ready until 5pm for tires and to look at a button. We were called at about 5pm to be told the brakes needed to be replaced. They did a fast job on the brakes, but my husband is not pleased that tires took 8 hours, a rim is all the sudden BENT causing a shake drinking on the highway, and we weren't given the service papers. We will be going to another Kia dealer for maintenance in the future.

Returned for warranty work to repair the window button since they didn't order the part the first time.. that alone took 5 hours. They also forgot I was waiting at the dealership. I did not receive my service paperwork then either. They also stated that we caused the rim issue  based off dents in the car door even though the shaking wasn't an issue until the new tires were put on.

Let's just say I'm not coming back to this dealer, ever.

name: Amelia Landers
text: Back in April, my husband and I were in the market for a car and ended up at Riverchase Kia. The salesman who took care of us was Harvey and he was fantastic! We ended up purchasing an Optima and I have no complaints with my car and everything seemed to be going great until about 2 weeks later when we noticed that the car we traded into them still had not been paid off and I received a delinquent payment notice for that vehicle. This rocked on for over a month of going back and forth with their finance department and my bank. It took Riverchase Kia a whole month to send in the payoff check, for the car we traded in, to the bank which resulted in my credit score being affected because of their inability to do their job within a timely manner. So now we are having to deal with the credit bureau to try to correct what they have messed up. I would so love to give a good review in regards to the experience we had with our salesman Mr. Harvey because he is absolutely wonderful but I do NOT recommend trying to work with Riverchase Kia's finance department because it has truly been a nightmare.

name: Jackson Shell
text:
Avoid this place at all costs. I sat in the waiting room for three hours to get a rotor replaced on the front of my car and instead they did a brake inspection on the back. Three hours. For nothing. They couldn’t find my appointment when I arrived, they lost my keys and tried to give me someone else’s. When I tried to talk to someone about the rotor they left, didn’t come back, and had the check out lady do my paperwork instead of talking to me. They were supposed to give me an estimate before they performed work, did they? No. The lobby is gross, the waiting room is gross, the bathrooms are gross, the receptionist couldn’t be bothered to look up from her phone when I walked in. Bad bad bad all around. Every other person in that lobby and waiting room was disgruntled/upset. I have no idea why they have any good reviews.

On another note, not a single employee wore a mask or practiced any type of social distancing or cleanliness.

name: Aviation Josh
text: Went in to see about trading my car in. It was such a great car buying experience.Myron helped me trade my Sorento in for a Seltos. Im super happy with my car. As a single woman, I hate feeling  pressured. He was super laid back and professional. Would highly recommend

name: Tim Thomasson
text: Good price for my new car, good trade-in price for my old car.  The sales team was really nice.  Will was a good salesman.

name: Chuck Crowe
text: Raised the price of a used vehicle by $1350 after I test drove it because repairs and maintenance were needed. I would expect that those items would be corrected before it was priced and put on the lot.

name: Casey Cambron
text: We worked with Rodriguez ' Cool' Edwards and was extremely pleased with the experience!! Even had some help with one of the managers, Justin Grier. I will definitely be a repeat customer!!!

name: Henry Hardin
text:
Excellent experience!  Christopher, my service advisor, took care of everything. All services completed in 75 minutes. Everyone I met was courteous and polite. Clearly they are focused on the customer. I’ll be back next time service is due.
Special thanks to Christopher!  He took care of the intake and explained everything when service was completed.

name: Amari Quinones
text: My car has been at Riverchase Kia for two weeks now to be serviced and nothing has been fixed. I’ve called numerous times and either no one answers or they don’t have any updates on the status of my car. My service advisor, Christopher McMillan, has not reached out to me in any form regarding my car and he said that “I should know to call him.” Him along with the service manager, Bryan Arrington, have been lying to us constantly saying they were ordering parts and contacting the dealership I purchased the car from for paperwork, but when I arrived there today, none of what they said were true. None of the parts for my car had been ordered, even though I was told differently and I was expecting them to arrive this past Tuesday. They didn’t even care to offer me a rental car until the General Manager stepped in today. I definitely don’t recommend getting your car serviced at this location.

name: Ralph Williams
text: Riverchase Kia is TERRIBLE,, UNPROFESSIONAL and  INCONSIDERATE !!!! Theyve lied to me on several occasions, theyve had my car 6 months and EVERYTIME that I've gotten it back it was another issue!!! They said the warranty company denied my claim, which they never did. Matter of fact the warranty company contacted Kia told them it was approved but the General Manager never relayed the information and TWO MONTHS LATER we get a call from Lia telling us to bring the car back even though they dropped the call and my car is STII THERE

name: Brian Cunningham
text:
Myron Deskins was an excellent salesman. He did not pressure us or try to sell is something we didn't need. Once we decided, he went quickly through all necessary steps. Then he gave us a tour of the facility and introduced us to the service department where everyone was so nice. We couldn't have asked for a better car-buying experience.

Brian and Susan Cunningham

name: Laura Louise Gentry
text: My first maintenance on my new KIA Soul at the dealership were I bought my car went great. Savannah did a great job at answering every question or concern that I had. I understood everything that was being done to my car, she went over it in detail for me. And for a added bonus she said me that my first maintenance service was free.

name: Steve Oakes
text: Horrible service. Kept car for three weeks and never repaired it. Would not respond to calls or emails.

name: Gabriel McDaniel
text:
DO NOT BUY FROM THIS DEALERSHIP! Bought a Sorento with 17,000 miles. Vehicle was Certified Pre Owned, but I chose to also get the wrap around warranty.

6 months and 5,000 miles later the antenna cover on the roof of the car flew off. My wife took it in bc it should be covered under warranty and the technician told her there was damage so it wasn’t covered. I looked at it when I got home and there is ZERO damage whatsoever to the antenna or anywhere on the roof of the car, not even a scratch.

When she spoke with a manager and called them out on it, he offered no explanation as to why they lied and tried to take advantage of her. All he said was “it is not a manufacturing issue so it isn’t covered.” They literally sold a car that a piece flew off of and hit me with the “not our problem”.

STAY AWAY. Look at the most recent reviews. There is a reason they are getting 1 star. Zero integrity or ethics involved in this dealership.

name: Kye Dibble
text:
Went here a few months ago, didn’t think to write a bad review.
The car salesman didn’t think it was enough to already harass us after we wanted to leave after 20 minutes of being there . He had us staying for an hour guilt tripping us to buy a car.
THEN he proceeds to follow me out the door to my car , yes try to walk with me to my car once I say I got to leave . I wish I didn’t forget his name , the other staff seemed a bit embarrassed at the front desk.

name: Peyton Aldridge
text: Crookedest dealership around, will tell you one thing to get you in and once you get there, its completely different. One of the managers named Jeff is terrible. DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!

name: Eric Fort
text: Vehicle was serviced quickly. Brian, our Service Writer, kept us well informed throughout the process and made a few recommendations without high pressure sales to get them done. We have always been pleased with the service and will continue to do business with them in the future.

name: Suzie Coo
text: Christopher provided awesome, friendly service.  This was my first time here and I was very impressed with the people. They are honest. They didn't give me "fake recommendations" and, believe me, I was ready for that. This is my Kia service place from now on.

name: Steven Peterman
text: I had my car towed there on June 30th and was told it was going to get the diagnostic test the following week. They lost the ticket on my car and didnt know where it was... not once, not twice, but three times. After a month in a half, they had an employee pick the phone up and tell me that it was going to be fixed for free under warranty...only to find out another month later that, that was false and they difnt even know who that employee was. After misplacing my car the third time, they finally did a diagnostic test in the first week of September... 3 months later😡 only to tell me that, again, its not going to be fixed for free, but it costs almost $1,100 to be fixed. Im getting a lawyer and the news to do a story on them. I cant be the only one. Worst business experience in the history of my life.

name: Jessie Franklin
text: Yes the people were very friendly and done there best to be helpful. Now the new springs that was installed in the ignition coils only made the the car run worse . But it was a recall cheap fix that didn’t do anything but make things worse now my car is missing and the check engine light is on.  How is Kia gonna stand behind there product? Are they going to provide new coils to fix there problem?

name: La Shonda Reid
text: The salesman Dennis was Amazing! I loved his personality! He made the process smooth and comfortable! While waiting I had gotten hungry and he bought me a drink and chips. Kind and considerate person!

name: Brandy Gill
text: My salesman, Justin was great. The sale went smoothe and I love my car. A few days after purchase, my headlight went out. Christopher, in the shop, had me scheduled the next day and took care of my car. Thanks again. I highly recommend this business.

name: Asia Michael
text: I had a great experience. The staff was very nice especially Chris. He was helpful and informative and made my experience great. The wait time was not bad at all. Definitely will be back.

name: Dawn Smith
text: This dealership is a JOKE. I went 1 day to test drive and told the salesman Ray that. He answered 5 phone calls while we were looking around AND in the test drive.  He was dismissive and literally told me he had 2 other customers waiting.  So we try again the next day, we talk to someone different named MOJO. He was texting my husband and  told him we were ready to buy and ask about the specific car we wanted. He stopped texting us when we asked aboit his best price. Crickets/nothing....so we drive an hour to the dealership and MOJO states ' we sold that car 5 minutes ago". The ONLY person that spoke to us with any kind of respect was the used car manager.  The new car manager was to busy, never even looked our way. BYE RIVER CHASE KIA. All my friends will know how you treat your customers.

name: Mary Lentz
text: I purchased my Soul in 2011. Have taken it to dealership every time for service. Each time everyone has been so nice and helpful. That’s why I continue to come back.

name: Tracy Atkinson
text: When we arrived, the sales person had to wait a bit on us to finish our conversation on the phone.  Will, our salesman, was so nice and very patient with us. Everyone involved in our car buying experience was nice and professional. I would definitely recommend Riverchase KIA.

name: brandy wimpy
text: These guy's are awesome!! The best experience ever buying a vehicle! Everyone from the Receptionist  to the Finance Officer was amazing!! Only place I will every go❤️

name: Lissa Benson
text: This is a horrible place to buy a car. Please don’t buy from them. They sold me a lemon. I have tried to talk with them and they refuse to communicate with me. I rate them a 0!!

name: TYESHA COOPER
text: my experience with Riverchase Kia was AMAZING from start to finish. Harvey & Christopher made my experience easy and chill which made the buying process effortless. Jeff Williams was AMAZE!!! he went over and beyond which made this experience one of the best!!!  if your looking for a new vehicle be sure to stop by and get the treatment!!!!!

name: Michelle Warren
text: Best experience ever, everyone is so nice and friendly! They were able to get me into the car of my choice when I doubted myself!

name: Michael Vacciano
text: Bought a used kia sportage, price was reduced but at time of sale they used original price. They said finance company made them use higher price. I called the finance company and they stated that I could of bought car at lower price. Riverchase kia wanted 2,000 down payment said we could not buy new car due to credit. So after I bought car. I went to Jim Burke Hyundai was approved zero down for a 2020 Hyundai I bought it. But realized just how screwed I got a River chase Kia. I have bought new cars in the past at River chase kia. They don't give a sh## about customer relations all they told me that boat done sailed. So don't waist your time!!  The car even smokes and I'm stuck with it!! I will Never Buy there again!!!!  Take your car buying Elsewhere!!  Retired Police Officer Mike Vacciano

name: Kimberly Pearson
text: After purchasing my car here 4 years ago I still return to them for maintenance. This past weekend my car was due for an oil change and tire rotation, and as usual I had a great experience. Clean waiting area, friendly staff and service was less than an hour.

name: Nancy Hamm
text: My husband and I had been looking to trade our current car for something a little bigger, but still wanted to save on gas. My husband is a diabetic and his sugar went high and when that happen we had to leave and come back in a couple of days when he felt better. Our saleswoman was awesome in doing a lot of the leg work for us over the phone, so when we went back all we basically had to do was sign the paper work. Not to mention we got a great intrest rate,  Kudos to Riverchase Kia!

name: Matthew Paulick
text: Just a few days ago I took my friend to Riverchase Kia to purchase a bigger car our sales guy Stan Sims was absolutely amazing! He was able to put her in the exact car she asked for upon entering. He made sure we knew all the functions of the car and how they work not to mention we had fun and was laughing through the entire process. Amazing experience!

name: Stephanie Lamore
text: I cant say how wonderful everyone at Kia has been to me. I appreciate them so much. From the people upfront to the service department all. Wonderful people. Best service ever.

name: Vance Torres
text: Just trust KIA and they're amazing team, they make you feel welcome and they work with you and explain everything as they go. They don't shove nothing down your mouth. They were easy to talk to, the person who helped me was Tyree, he did a really great job, he was funny too. They were patient, understanding, helpful and very relaxed. I don't have the best credit, and they got me in the car I asked for with the down payment I said I wanted to pay and actually lowered the monthly cost during the final steps. Tyree was really helpful and offered to help me every step of the way. The lot manager, was helpful too I could see him assisting multiple people, he didn't make you feel like he was more focused on anyone, he cared about everyone there buyers and his team, very great guy you can tell. and he was very professional and helpful! He was very informative and if he wasn't sure about something he found out. He let you know what you're getting into and what you could do later. Over all just a real fantastic experience. I've looked at plenty of cars and I'm telling you Kia just is the place to go. On to the service department. I drove by there today before posting a review because Tyree said the service department was great, There was nothing really wrong with my car as I just got it lol, I just wanted to see how they would respond to my questions, I didn't get thier names but the guy there was super friendly and informative. He didn't try to make you feel stupid (because i asked a stupid question) I expected him to to be honest, then they replaced my key battery and even the guy and girl who helped me there were very nice and helpful and funny too. Great place to buy a car 100/10 yes one hundred out of ten.

name: Richard Gay
text: I would give them a 4.8 rating. Myron Deskins was very friendly informative and easy to deal with.

name: MLC
text: Was showed a Telluride by a guy who was the most unprofessional sales person I ever met...If you are looking for a vehicle don't go here these dam people act like don't want to sell cars,I guess that's why the place was so dam empty!

name: Brittany Tedder
text: Great service but it took a little while just trying to get a call back for an update. All in all though, very happy with experience.

name: Kelsey Rhoden
text: On Friday, May 8th, my fiancé and I bought a 2016 F-150 3.5L eco-boost from Riverchase Kia in Pelham, AL. Well we thought we did. The entire time “Mojo” showed the truck, we discussed the motor as well as the other features. Then when we sat down and talked numbers, he presented a piece of paper comparing it to all the other 2016 model F-150s within so many miles and my fiancé noticed the motor was listed different than every single other listing, so he asked “this may be a dumb question but this truck’s motor is listed differently. Is that just the way you guys typed it up? Is this truck a twin turbo EcoBoost like the rest?” Mojo replied with “ yes exactly”. So we moved forward and we bought the truck. That following Sunday my fiancé went to look under the hood at something and after some research he found out it did not have the 3.5L EcoBoost motor. He called the following ‪Monday morning‬ and talked to Mojo. He stated said “mojo do you remember us talking about the truck being an EcoBoost and showing me the comparison sheet of the surround F-150s, and I asked about the motor being an EcoBoost, even though it didn’t match up to everything else and you told me yes it is?” He said “yea, yea I do” then My Fiancè said “well Mojo it’s not an EcoBoost. It’s a plain V6.” His response was. “Oh $@it”. He then said he would talk to management and get back with him. My fiancé called him two different times that day. One telling him that he’s still trying to talk to management but they’re busy and the second time was 8 hours later and all they were willing to do was give us an oil change. Both responses were via text messages. He would not answer a phone call. So we then called and spoke to a sales manager and he was nice but didn’t have any more to offer. After a couple weeks we were finally able to talk to the sales manager that was working the day we bought the truck. At this point we were over having to deal with them so we settled for a few oil changes and floor mats since the truck didn’t come with any. He stated “they wouldn’t be cheap mats”. Once they finally came in we went and picked them up from the dealership, and they were universal Riverchase kia mats that no where near fill up any of the back seat floor board. We bought better ones from Walmart than the ones they gave us and he only gave one more oil change than the original one. We find this to be highly unprofessional and unsatisfactory. There are thousands of dollars difference as well as the evident performance differences. I’ve also bought a brand new Kia from them in 2017 and it’s crazy we get treated this way after spending so much money with them. I hope that people read this and choose to take their business else where.

name: Edrickson Morin
text: The staff is awesome. Super helpful! And I love my kia

name: John Flannery
text: Quick and easy oil change!  They made everything go smooth.  They also made sure I was aware of future maintenance on my vehicle.  Clean waiting area and very professional staff. Will definitely be back and will be recommending to friends and family.

name: DuAnne Branham
text: We were looking specifically for a Dark Moss 2020 Kia Telluride SX and they were the only ones within 500 miles that had it. They were extremely accommodating to our circumstances and gave us insight that we did not know before. They took their time to ensure that our needs were met.

name: AMBER Ward
text: Harvey's was great. We didnt feel pressured at all, he eased my anxiety and even gave me some financial tips to raise my credit score. We were in and out in 1.5 hours. Highly recommend.

name: Regina Bucknor
text: Each time that I have utilized Kia for whatever servicing my car needs.... They have always provided quality service and very courteous and informative. I plan on purchasing another vehicle from them in the near future.

name: Austin Purser
text: After buying a car here a few years ago I referred my cousin to go buy one. The dealership told me that they would send me $100 referral fee in the mail. That was months ago! I have called three times since then just to be told they were sending it. FALSE ADVERTISING!!! They do not send the referral money. Do not waste your time here. Even after being told three times they’d figure it out and send it.

name: Bonnie Temple
text: Excellent customer service from both Christopher & Savannah! I didn’t have to wait that long either!

name: Vicky Smith
text: Saturday morning my Kia Optima would not start. I had it towed to Riverchase Kia and Christopher was so helpful and they fixed the problem. Thank you so much for being so courteous.

name: Shaelyne Duran
text: Awesome experience. Mojo went above and beyond to help us get our car. Would recommend him to anyone.

name: Ryan Galloway
text: Had a very positive experience buying a pre owned Sedona.  The salesman, Juan, didn't pressure us to buy, letting us make our own decision.  The manager and financial people were efficient and at the same time did not try to trick us into making bad financial decisions for our family.  We were treated with respect, and allowed time and space to make a good decision.  Having had negative experiences with other car dealerships in the area, I recommend Riverchase Kia.

name: Jan Harrison
text: Fast service. Kept me informed. Made suggestions but didn't try to push services I didn't ask for.

name: Shane Caton
text: Bought 1 new vehicle then worked a deal a week later for another new vehicle. Once I had financing they changed the price by thousands of dollars. Not honest about it either. Avoid the games here!!!!

name: Craig Jones
text:
Purchased a new car 2 months ago ...still haven't received title application..i can't get a tag !!!
They don't return my calls.
$32,000 . JERKS!!!!!

name: Tee M
text: I had a great experience at Riverchase Kia. Rodriguez Edwards was the salesman I worked with and he was amazing and made the process easy. I'd definitely recommend him to anyone in search of a vehicle.

name: Nick S.
text: Go see Myron and tell him I sent you. Very knowledgeable, easy to talk to, funny, polite, and a really enjoyable experience. I tested multiple vehicles until I found my fit. Flexible with your schedule, early or late in evening, they are there for you. Free drinks and candy too

name: Jo Ann Stallings
text: Very pleasant experience. Great phone calls update. Friendly, and did all I asked to do.

name: Haley Whitmire
text: Had a fantastic experience at Riverchase Kia. Was instantly offered assistance as soon as I got out of the car. Lionel got my parents into two cars, then the next week got me into a new car with $0 down. The facility was clean, the bathrooms were clean, and we were overall treated as if we were family. Easiest car buying experience I’ve had! Thank you Lionel and Riverchase Kia for my new Optima! Would definitely recommend!

name: Amber
text: Just bought our new Kia. Myron Deskins was our sales guy. He was absolutely the best at helping us find a car to.meet our EVERY need and still at a highly affordable rate. He introduced us to everyone in the service department, which made us feel very welcome. He explained everything down to the smallest detail. Will be returning for ALL future car needs. Thank you so much for everything!

name: Sarah Stamatelos
text: These people are the most amazing car salesmen every! They are super friendly and helpful and very very funny! They were all so sweet to my girls and made sure they were comfortable and not bored. If you are looking for a new car, go see Stan Sims.

name: John David Phillips
text: First time used car buyer at Riverchase Kia. Myron worked with me to get me into a Kia Optima and I couldn't be happier with the purchase and experience! Thank you Myron and Riverchase for getting me into my new car.

name: Malia Tartt
text: I had a great experience with Riverchase Kia. I found a vehicle I was interested in online and was pre-approved. That alone saved me half a day sitting in the dealership. Once I got there, Ray and Kevin treated me like family. They answered all my questions and made me comfortable with making one of the biggest purchases of my life. If you need a vehicle, go see these guys. You won’t regret it.

name: Kate Hallman
text:
We love Riverchase Kia! ❤️
Last week we made our second new car purchase with Riverchase Kia, the first being last November. Both times Ray was our salesman. He is truly amazing. So kind and great to do business with! The whole team we worked with were so kind and great at what they do! The process was quick and easy! The cars are both perfect. We could not be happier! We will always come back to Riverchase Kia for our vehicles!

name: Marcus Mccoy
text: Everything went very well, great service, staff was very helpful

name: Kristyn Taylor
text:
I was expecting to have to look at cars for a month, test drive everything, have to find a co-signer, and then spend several hours doing paperwork (based on my first experience buying a new car several years ago at another place. )
I was very pleasantly surprised. Guillermo and Woody made the whole process quick and painless.  I have a great, brand new car that I love, and the payment isn't going to cause me too much stress every month.
Thanks, guys! I'll tell my family and friends.

name: Rebecca Williams
text: Stan was my salesman, and he made all my dreams come true , I told him what I wanted and he made it happen. he went above and beyond for me. He was so sweet and we got along great. If you go there he is your man! ABSOLUTLEY THE BEST EXPERIENCE! And Jeff was awesome as well, he was kind and very generous and worked really hard to get me the best financing! A++ For Riverchase Kia

name: Lauren Russell
text: $152.00 is quite steep for diagnostics when your vehicle is still covered under warranty. They have to run diagnostics to even see if your problem is covered under warranty and when it isn't (because it is considered routine maintenance) you end up paying $152.00 for them to tell you that your spark plugs need to be replaced. A job that literally cost $40 for the actual spark plugs and 10 minutes for us to fix ourselves. It is our fault for signing the work order (that we had to sign or they wouldn't even look at it). Lesson learned I guess. Learn from my mistake--get Auto Zone or someone else to run diagnostics to confirm if the problem is covered under warranty to save yourself some money and a hassle.

name: Dave K
text:
My daughter found a used Kia forte here. Seems like a good car at a good price. She is happy with it.

The salesman really pushed getting a new car on us, a bit too much in my opinion. We test drove three cars and ended up getting the third one. The other two cars had clear mechanical and cosmetic issues. I was surprised they would try to sell cars with such obvious problems.

For some reason the prices are not on the used cars and the salesman didn't know them. This led to a lot of back and forth in to the computer and back to the lot. We would have preferred more transparency and ease in locating a car.

name: Jayla Harper
text: So let me talk about the man name jay I came in to the service department and he was so nice. I was in and out very quickly and he kept me up to date often. After he walked me to my car I saw it was vacuum but it could have been much cleaner he took my vehicle to detail and made sure it was done just  like i like it and I was very happy when he brought it back to me. So I will be bringing my car back to him my next oil change great job jay keep up with the good work

name: Webb Kuzmicki
text: Great place to do business

name: Avery Jordan
text: I felt very comfortable with my sales associate. He was courteous, respectful and straight- forward; he did not try to force a sales on me. Mr. Whitsey was the best sales associate I have ever dealt with when buying a car.

name: Richard Mayes
text: Really great service department. Very thorough and very professional.

name: Melanie Peters
text: Nick Johnson was great.  He got me in the car I wanted, made sure I knew all the functions of the car and was extremely helpful and a nice guy!  I highly recommend him!!

name: Bailee Perry
text: Thank you to Mr. Harvey for getting me in the new car I wanted at a price I could afford. I had an awesome, easy experience at Riverchase Kia and that’s exactly how car buying should be!

name: Kevin Williams
text: Chris & Service Dept was informative & Great. Took care of my needs & car issues. Thanks !

name: Richard Mayes
text: Really great service department. Very thorough and very professional.

name: Brian Harbison
text: Great place for service on any vehicle!!!

name: Crystal Hawkins
text: If you need a vehicle, I suggest going to see Stan Sims! He his wonderful. Very funny guy, very honest and will treat you right!

name: Valerie Gaines
text: I would not recommend this place to no one!!! They do not honor customer commitment and promise! I setup an appt for today Sat @8:30 am. I get there at 7:53am. When I finally get to the front of the line to find out the service I requested can't be done on Sat and the person who set the appt up was new. I expressed that wasn't my fault. They had a hard time finding my info and the guy spelled my last name wrong even after I spelled it out to him, nor did I get an email reminder as he suggested. I spoke to the lady with whom he suggested as my service rep and again explained the issue to her. She says we can get to you in a couple of hours. 3/12hrs passed and she advises me a diagnostic was done and the suggestions needed. Then told me it would take about an hour to get a tuneup and an oil change. An hour and 20 mins passed  and I went back to advise her of the time frame and asked for a copy of the diagnostic print out that was done and she told me I would get it when I check out. I advised her of their sign and commitment to the customer and her only answer was I told you it would be a couple of hours and you said you would wait. I stated a couple was two and it's now going on 4 hours. There was no compensation for THEIR MIX UP AND MY TIME, NEITHER DID I RECEIVE A COPY OF MY DIAGNOSTIC REPORT. GIVING ME A COPY OF YOUR SUGGESTIONS IS NOT A REPORT. I WILL BE CONTACTING THE SERVICE MANAGER TIM BEARDEN (which is the name I was given) AND THE CORPORATION ALSO! This is definitely NOT A PLACE I WOULD RECOMMEND FOR KIA SERVICE. DON'T BELIEVE EVERY THING YOU READ, SOMETIMES IT'S THERE TO LOOK GOOD AND MAKE PEOPLE THINK YOU ARE GOOD. BUT THE  OLD ADDAGE IS "THE PROOF IS IN THE PUDDING. " IT'S BEEN TESTED AND FOUND  TO BE A LEMON!!!!

name: Michelle Foley
text: Awesome customer service! We were in a bind and had to get a vehicle that day. Rick Henry worked with us and we were able to drive away, in our last minute, new car purchase. Thanks, Riverchase Kia and Rick for making the process easy and stress free! I recommend everyone to make your purchase with them.

name: Adrienne Bazile
text: Hope Is Real. Riverchase Kia Sales Rep Teddy Frye welcomed me with a spark of hope. He was thorough, confident, and reassuring that I would leave with a new car. Most intriguing was his simple explanation of what decision I could make that best fitted in choosing a car. Teddy gave me hope and I did leave in a new Kia vehicle. Go see Teddy Frye: he will not lie about believing hope is real. You are a great sales Rep Mr. Frye.

name: Ernest Walker
text: Leo is the best salesman I've encountered. It's a pleasure each time I come to Riverchase Kia, I leave satisfied. Thank you for all your hard work

name: Jessi Nystrom
text:
Read this review if you need a salesperson that 1.) isn't pushy 2.) is actually very smart and 3.) is super responsive

I've been speaking with several dealerships, as I'd like to buy a car either this month or early January. I haven't yet landed on that car, but I feel the need to point out the service I've gotten from Riverchase Kia, specifically from Joseph Donahue  Joseph is clearly very knowledgable and extremely responsive. He's really set himself apart from all other salespeople just by actually answering me promptly, listening to what I've said, and working hard to find what I'm looking for. Riverchase Kia has offered me a great deal for my trade in as well!
Go to Riverchase Kia, and specifically ask for Joseph! He's the best!

name: Gethyn Jones
text: Met with the KIA sales agent Teddy Fryer who was very professional in his manner. He was knowledgeable about the KIA range and made the buying process a smooth transition. We traded our car and purchased a new Soul. I would without doubt buy from him again. I rate the experience a ten stars out of ten. My wife and I were introduced to all who would support the servicing of the car as well, to me a very important part of the package. There was no pressure to buy and we left to make the decision to purchase off site and in private. When I called to say we wished to buy the car we we had decided on it was was detailed and fueled whilst we completed all the necessary paperwork. The staff involved with the sale were professional and more than helpful. I am very impressed with Teddy Fryer who conducted the whole sale from start to completion in a manner that made the buying of a new car a stress free and enjoyable experience. I would buy from him and Riverchase again as and when I need a new or used car. Finally the KIA Soul is a great car and I highly recommend it.

resp.text: Thanks for sharing your experience, Gethyn! It is always wonderful to hear that our staff is providing excellent service in a professional and knowledgable manner, just as Teddy did for you. We are so happy that you found the perfect car and had the time to think over your decision with no pressure because that is how a car buying experience should be. Congratulations on your new Kia Soul and we look forward to working with you again for any of your car needs!

name: Jennifer Englebert
text: Love love loved my experience with Riverchase Kia! Joseph Bibb was the nicest man to work with and he definitely has the customer in mind! I felt no pressure in the process of picking out my new-to-me car and he explained everything I needed to know as a first time car buyer.

name: Tonja Casey
text: Steven Willard was fantastic to work with. He helped us get a great deal on our daughters first car. The whole experience took a few days to get the deal complete but Mr. Willard stayed in contact with us. He provided frequent updates. Highly recommend.

name: Adrienne Bazile
text: Hope Is Real. Riverchase Kia Sales Rep Teddy Frye welcomed me with a spark of hope. He was thorough, confident, and reassuring that I would leave with a new car. name: Tjai85
text: This place is amazing. They really work hard to make sure you get what you need, and they go the extra mile for their customers. Myron Deskins is one of the best salesmen I've ever had the pleasure of working with. He made sure I was comfortable the entire time I was there, and he got me what I was looking for. The staff is pleasant and very professional. I wish I had come here when I first started looking for a vehicle. It would have saved me a lot of time and stress, and I would have been riding a lot sooner. Check out this place if you are looking for a vehicle.

name: Terri Burnett
text: Jay in service is the best.  Always very sweet answers every question or finds somebody who can answer.  We Love him!!!  He knows us by name every time.  Thanks Jay! Terri and Deborah.

name: Kelly Madison
text:
BUYER BEWARE ESPECIALLY ON USED CARS!!!
Purchased a new one a few years ago and had a decent experience. Needed a third car so we went there for a used one-BIG MISTAKE!
1 1/2 months later... needs a new tire (actually 3), a battery (less than half charged) and filters that were so nasty, I JUST CAN’T.....  they hadn’t even done an alignment! Never been a huge fan of the service Dept but while the new one is still under warranty it goes there- this used one-no way!!!

name: kendrietta orr
text: Thankful for the service department correcting the issue with my car.

name: Felicia Roberts
text: I had a great experience. Stan Sims was my sales person. He was very helpful and understanding.
