name: Joshua Vanleemput
text:
Turning a Rough Situation Around

Alright were to start. Let me provide you a little setup for my situation that this amazing dealership managed to turn around for me. End of 2014 my old Saturn (yes, the car dealer that went under) with its cracked suspension was traded into a dealership that I thought was reputable. Well put you in a new car they said, don't worry about your credit they said, I end up in the most manual of manuals; roll down windows and all Versa Note. Alright, I can turn this around, I tell myself, they said come back in a year and well get you in something nicer. Year rolls by, go back, "Nope your credit isn't good enough, you got money to put down? Nope, then cant help you, try again next year." Alright, so I continue with this car that I am not happy with, upgrade jobs, still upside down in this car years later. Now its December 2017, still upside down in a car I am not happy with. I hear a jingle on my radio, you all know the one, "We wanna see yea at Riverchase Kia." My wife and I talk and decide lets take a chance, what have we got to lose, if we don't like it we can always walk away. I do my research, and go in with an open mind, telling myself I want one of two vehicles. Optima or Forte. I park at the dealership and out walks one of the best, brightest, and positive salespersons I have ever met. Mr. Lionel T. Lee. I had time to stand and stretch on this cold winter day when he greeted, us. I was not set to meet anyone in particular but I am so glad I met this man. He took us to his desk and talked to us a few minutes about our situation and our plans, asked what I wanted and within 15 minutes he came back. He broke down my station for me but did not send me away.

I am a negative person here folks, of course I was thinking everything had gone to hell and I was just wasting mine and his time, but Mr. Lionel was positive, he said, "I cannot get you an optima, but I am going to get you in a new car. Trust me. I have the perfect one in mind too. How do you feel about a forte." My mind went everywhere but I tried to play the shrewd buyer, I said sure I would be happy to consider if the price is right. And off he went again, another fifteen minutes and back he was to grab his scarf, "Oh you guys are in for a treat, wait here!" Five minutes later I was asked to walk outside and man was I blown away! The Forte was beautiful, I mean pearl white, leather, backup camera, you name it it was in there. I was speechless, he asked what I thought, take a seat, get a feel for it because man this is going to be your car. I know it. I sat in it and never wanted to leave, going from a manual base to this luxury model, you know I almost drooled a little. He asked, "What do you think, anything you want to change on it?" The only thing I could think, "Got it in Grey or Silver!" He just grinned and said, "Yeah, I sure do. Wait here." Exact same model, color I want, hasn't even been an hour and I am test driving the car I could not be happier with! Then the standard numbers talk goes by, no one likes this part but I will state for full disclosure that I was in the negative over 6k on my old car, I was expecting that I was going to have it a little rough but you know it was not nearly as bad as I thought. The discounts were amazing, in fact I walked away an hour later one of the most satisfied kia customers, keys and paperwork in hand and taking a picture in front of my new vehicle. Thank you so much Mr. Lionel for putting up with all my negativity and fighting for me to get me in this new vehicle. Hell I sat in it all day yesterday just playing with all the new toys and features, you are an amazing salesperson and even more so just an amazing person to help someone like me. Thank you again! We will be seeing you again next year to get her out of that jeep!

name: Derek Alldredge
text: Had a great experience at River Chase kia! Clarence Rasberry helped me get into a brand new kia soul! Go see them and let them hook you up!

name: Wes Day
text:
I had several problems with Kia Riverchase yesterday.  My car died during the ice storm, and I HAD to buy a car.  Here are the problems I observed:

1. 12 salesmen standing out front, half of them smoking cigarettes... certainly not illegal, but it just automatically makes any business look really bad fast.  Plus, they obviously overhired, maybe to motivate car sales by putting more hungry vultures on the lot.

2. I dealt first with a guy named Adam.  He was nice enough... the sales manager obviously sensed my hesitation, so he swooped in and began his "Pushy sales guy" mode.  At one point when I started to get up and leave because I felt uncomfortable, he told me I promised him I would buy a car from him if the numbers were right for a used model.  I wanted a new car.

3. Don't even bother looking at the prices of Kias online -- when you get there, everything is 5 to 6 thousand dollars more.  See, that's when they offer you the $6,000 trade in on any model.  Then, they'll act as if they're such great guys doing you such a favor.  It's ludicrous.

I went directly to another dealership, found a car I liked at a reasonable price, and drove away happy.  Stay away from this place unless you just really want to buy a guaranteed box of crap, ("I've got spare time" -- Tommy Boy)

name: Maxwell W
text: Put in an application to get a new car. We did not end up getting the car but surely get a ton of spam calls and email spam from mortgage company and company trying to lend me money. Not worth it.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback!

name: Jessika Ashlee (Hip and Simple)
text: Bought our soul here in Nov 2014. Felt we got ripped off a little and found out they tried to get lending from so many places for the incorrect amount and causes unnecessary credit inquiries. That was annoying to find out weeks after the fact and that they hid it from us. But the big issue is their service. It is impossible to make an appointment for your "free" oil changes. When you do arrive they push a pkg that's like $65 so you can get a tire rotation and other crap. Then when you pick about charging that much for the "free" oil change they say, they'll take the oil change portion of that off the top like they are doing you a favor. Then they claim you need a new filter or something or other, which they changed at the last oil change 5,000 so I ask how often that's needed and they claim it's needed every 10,000-15,000 not knowing we just had it done the time before. So your free oil change is $75 + when you are done. It's cheaper to go elsewhere to get all the same things done.

resp.text: Ms. Reed, at RiverChase Kia it is our goal that every customer leave our dealership satisfied with their experience. name: Akins Josh
text:
My wife had been in rolling DOT hazard for a while.  It was passed time to get her a new ride.  We did a one stop shop.  We knew Riverchase Kia had awesome deals on their new Kias.  However, this was not the market we were looking for purchase from.  We were after a slightly used but still certifiable new to us SUV.  Teddy met with us.  He asked what we were looking for in a purchase today, and said that he would do his best to keep us from going anywhere else.  Teddy did just that.  We were up front with him on the financials that we had and the monthly payment we need to stay around.  My wife was looking for something older with many more miles, but I wanted to have something that had warranty and miles to a minimum.  Teddy brought us a single option, The Right Option.  A very low mileage Sorento with transferable warranty.  The test drive sold it to my wife, and I signed the line.  We got an extremely well kept Sorento, with a detailed one owner record review by Teddy.  He answered the questions we had and some that he knew we should ask but not know to.  He was easy to work with.  He was knowledgeable  and we are a family with a great ride.  The experience was great, our turn around time for paperwork was minimal, our satisfaction was at the maximum.
The entire experience was better than I expected.  They treated us very well.  They earned my business.  I will recommend Teddy, when people ask about my wife's new Sorento.

Josh Akins
2/17/2018

name: Ricky Gilliland
text:
Purchased a new 2015 Kia Soul last month. The salesman informed us of an occurring sales event ( we were not aware of it). We had a great experience and was in and out with our new Soul in less than three hours. Every one was friendly and our salesman (Joseph Bibb) went the extra mile to ensure we got a great deal. Thanks to everyone there!
RW Gilliland

text: I came to  Riverchase Kia after I visited a Kia dealership in my home town which didn't go well. Marshell greeted me in a friendly manner and we went in and discussed what I wanted. He listened to me and took note of what I wanted. One of the great things I noticed about him was that he was very knowledgeable about Kias. I would definitely recommend him because he was honest, very knowledgeable and made the process of getting a car a smooth transition. In the end, I left with a Kia Optima which is what I wanted. If you go to Riverchase Kia, ask for Marshell you wont be disappointed.

resp.text: Thank you! We appreciate your review and are glad we could make your purchasing process an easy and enjoyable one.

name: Karla McCulley
text: Teddy Fyre at Riverchase Kia was excellent!!My husband and I have been trying for awhile to get rid of an older Cadillac SRX vehicle with no luck. That is until today, when our car salesman, Teddy Frye was able to offer an excellent deal to us. We were FINALLY able to get rid of our vehicle. Teddy was very quick and efficient! He listened to our concerns and needs. He did not try pressuring us into a vehicle as soon as we walked on the lot, which was a breathe of fresh air. We were able to take our time and think about what was best for us.  We are happy to say we got into a new Sorento SUV. Teddy was easy to work with and didn't  hassle us into making the sale. That was truly appreciated!!! He even went the extra mile and gave a referral for Geico insurance that saved us a ton! The finance office was also very quick!! We will definitely use Riverchase Kia again in the future!! We are so appreciative of their awesome business!!

name: Mandy Pierce
text: I came to Riverchase Kia just planning to test drive a Sorento, but from the moment I walked in, it felt more like a place I would want to do business with.  Marderius was polite but persistent in getting me there, calling and emailing me regularly.  Lionel assisted me once I got there, making sure he knew what I was looking for and trying his best to help me find it.  Staci, who had only been there a few days, did a great job of keeping me occupied as Lionel looked for the car I would drive.  When I saw the Sorento I was to test drive, I was immediately pleased, as it was in the color combination I really liked, with even lower miles than I had expected.  Once Rose, the finance manager, got involved in the process, it became clear that I was dealing with someone who not only wanted to sell a car, but was keenly aware of what it would take for me to make that decision.  She displayed excellent customer service and a true willingness to do what it took to find a way for me to get the car I wanted, at the price I wanted.    I would highly recommend considering Riverchase Kia for your next car.

Ask for Lamar Black
I recently have be looking to buy my first car. An for about a year and a half I have been researching the Kia Soul. I first went to the Kia Garderndale,Al but they werent very nice and i felt as if I was in a interview to see if I was good enough for the car. But when I came to Riverchase Kia. Lamar Black meant me  at the door with a smiling face. He knew everything about the car I wanted. He made me feel relaxed when test driving the car. I felt so sure about the car I bought it that day. And still to this day I know that it was the perfect car for me. Thank you Lamar the other dearship made me question my choice but you claried ot for me! Thank you. If you even have a young person looking for a car and dont know much about them. Lamar will put them in a safe and cool car!!!!

name: Nakita
text: My air went out on my car, and as you already know with the heat and rain that was not a good feeling. Even my 3yr old stated mom you I'm sweating lol lol. The air went out Wednesday Oct 6th. I took my car to you guys Thursday Oct 7th.....and when I arrived to the auto tunnel a older lady probably in late 30's or 40, kinda corpulent. I got the expression from her as whatever going on with your car you would have to pay, didn't give other options, just basically it's on me. I understand she have to tell me the fee etc.. but my car is only 2yrs old, and at that moment I didn't want to hear about money, I just wanted professionalism and just let me know it will be OK. I just said make me an appointment for Friday and I will come back. I went back Friday morning and spoke with a pleasant young woman by the name of Season. I think that was her name, b/c it was a unique name. She told me the SAME thing the other lady stated but in a different tone, and made me feel as though she cared. She even let me know by the car being new it may be covered under warranty. I told her my husband can get a gauge to ck it etc.. And she said if we do all that then it's still not working then it's likely a issue that will be fix with no out of pocket expense. I took my car back home again, and my husband did ck it Sunday, and the gauge showed Freon in the car, but stated to take it to the professionals. I then took off work Monday and brought my car back and Season's was there also.. I was happy b/c at this point I was just tired of going into circles. She let me know it may be a wait and was honest about it, and the fee again. I waited 2hrs, but I didn't care b/c I wanted my air fix, and to top it off it was under warranty. Anytime you are dealing with something that is a touchy subject about your car, b/c that is your way of survival and also getting around.... you want people to be knowledge of what's going on, and the situation. Thanks Seasons for your hospitality and patience.

name: Bobby Crabtree
text: If I could go lower than 1 I would, this experience was the most horrible car purchase I've ever had. We went up to riverchase kia at 11am on a saturday. Got immediate help and looked at a specific car. 2015 Kia sorento with 56k miles. Selling for 14k. Lemme tell you, these guys were shady and terrible. Wanted to low ball me on my trade in and jack up my APR with a credit score over 700. Wouldn't honor a coupon that they had online, that someone had already told me I could use in their office. Everytime I came back with a question or counter offer, the salesmen went back and spent about 10 minutes there and would come back with something worse than before. I was looking for integrity on their behalf and found none. Salesmen struggled at explaining most things and the other guys would write their offers down a half sheet of paper with a highlighter and would put an x and a line on the bottom for me to sign to agree to their terms. I asked multiple times for a printed sheet explaining how they came to their offers and was meet with the hand written sentiment everytime. Avoid this place. They are the classic definition of shady dealership. I left and got a better deal with a much better...EVERYTHING!!! Don't let Shamaar help you either. Couldn't tell you anything on his own. Senior Salesmen? I only share for you to avoid the experience I had and go somewhere else 1st. Spent 5 hours there with nothing to show for it.....

name: April Davis
text:
Never again will I go to Riverchase Kia. Today, I went to get my oil changed. I pulled up, got out, and went in the waiting area. I was the only one in there. After about 40 minutes, I see a man drive my car into the bay. I’m thinking: oh finally. I’m getting hungry lol! Another 20 minutes go by. Another man comes into the waiting area asking if that was my Sportage. Why yes. Yes it is. I’m thinking: oh good, it’s done. He says: “what do you need done today?” I said: “ are you serious? I’ve been here over an HOUR and you are the first person I’ve seen.” He says: “oh we were trying to figure out who the car belongs to.” I say (in my voice that is now shrieking): IM THE ONLY ONE HERE. YALL DROVE IT IN THE BAY 20 MINUTES AGO! I’M THE ONLY ONE THAT’S BEEN HERE!
I got in my car and left. I was so stinking mad. On my way home, I decided to call them and speak with a manager. The first girl, Kaitlin, left me on hold for 10 minutes. I called Back. Nicolette left me on hold for 5 minutes. They have the worst customer experience I have ever experienced. Never. Again.

resp.text: Congratulations on your first brand new Kia, April! It is so exciting that you found the perfect car and that Mr. Henry took such amazing care of you throughout your car buying experience. We really enjoyed working with you and appreciate your business. Please don't hesitate to come visit us for any of your future car needs. Safe travels in your new Sportage!

name: Elizabeth Knobloch
text: My Husband and I went in looking to trade in my vehicle which I was upside down in payments with and his old paid for vehicle for 2 brand New 2017 Kia's. We did not expect to be able to do it but went anyways to see our options and what we needed to do. Teddy was clear and upfront that he made no promises but would do absolutely everything in his power to get us driving away in new vehicles. HE MADE IT HAPPEN! He worked with us, the finance people, and the banks to get me out of my bad situation and get us in our new vehicles in the price range we felt comfortable with in less than 4 hours. We were also helped out by Joey Bibb. He did an awesome job with helping with test drives, getting our new cars cleaned and gassed up, giving feedback on gas mileage, and making sire we had a great experience.  Thank you so much Teddy and Joey! We will be sending everyone we can on yalls direction!

name: Amanda Bunt
text: Riverchase kia and their sales associate Teddy Frye were awesome. Mr. Frye was very straightforward and honest with us not your typical car salesman to say the least. I would reccommend riverchase kia to anyone. Go see them and ask for Teddy Frye.

name: Ann Sherwood
text: The top 1-2 things that I hate to do is go car shopping. My hell started on Sat 10/15/2016 where I ended up at Benton of Nissan knowing exactly which car I wanted to buy which was the versa 2016 advertised for $9,995 - long story short, the agent told me there would be another cost of $1500 added to the car which I thought was misleading/advertising, then the sales agent presented me with a smilar versa 2016 for $15,000 which I strongly felt was a bait n switch car, and was strongly urged to hurry and sign for the car, so after 4 hours, and feeling super pressured to buy this car, my gut just said walk away, and i listened to my gut; however, I still needed a car; on my way out again on 10/17/2016 I stopped off at ford, where I was shown the 2016 Fiesta with sunroof, which was fully loaded for $16,300 compared to the versa 2016 that they were trying to sell for $15,000. I got no sales pressure from ford, but I felt I needed to go to another dealer, since I already owned a car from Riverchase Kia, I then went back over there to see what they had; I ended up buying the 2014 Kia Rio with 34kmiles; Runs great, and the look of the car is very modern and sleek, and feel within my budget range. sales agent Teddy Fryer was cool as hell, and while they were working on the paperwork, we even took a second test drive just to make sure everything was good, and it was. teddy, I gave benton their just review, look it up when you have time. thanks

resp.text: This is fantastic to hear, Ann! Teddy is an amazing member of our team and we know he will be thrilled to hear how much you appreciate him over the other salesmen you worked with at other dealerships. Here at Riverchase Kia, we value our customers and want their car buying experience to be comfortable and easy so they can make the best decision without the pressure, just like your experience. Thank you for choosing us and we are here whenever you have another car need. Enjoy your new Kia Rio!

name: Gregory Chiadika
text: Attempted to buy a new Kia from Riverchase Kiai.  They advertised on tv that their vehicles were up to 10,000 dollars off.  I didn't believe it.  I went to the website and it appeared to confirm the special.  It even gave an example of a Kia Optima that started off a 26,900 would be discounted to $16,900.  I still didn't believe it so I decided it would be better to email the dealership.  I told them that I was only interested in vehicles that qualified for the $10,000 off. The dealership representative , Marderius Appleberry, emailed me every car except the ones that qualified.  I reiterated that I wanted to buy a vehicle that qualified for the $10,000 off.  He again showed me every car under the sun except the ones that qualified for the special.  Eventually, he began asking me to come in to see the car.  I told him that I didn't see the point if you can't even confirm they would actually sell a vehicle for the $10,000 as advertised.  Riverchase Kia ought to be ashamed of themselves.

resp.text: Mr. Chiadika, we would like to discuss this matter in more detail. It is our goal that every customer receive superior customer service, so if we could come to a resolution that is satisfactory to you, that's what we would like to do. Please call us at 407-792-3972. Thank you.

name: John Brennan
text:
I shopped online for my Fiat before visiting Fiat of Huntsville. Hands down they have the best and most up-to-date website in a three state area (AL, TN, KY). Through my web inquiry I was quickly connected with Richard Green. Richard answered all of my questions in a very timely manner and made me confidant that it would be worth the two hour drive from Nashville to visit the dealership.

I did purchase a Fiat 500 Pop and as the dealership was very busy the experience took about five hours. Richard never left my side. Greg Melso, the Fiat sales manager, also did a great job of just keeping me informed as to where they were in the process and when I'd be seeing the finance guy (great too!) to finalize my deal.

An overall A++ experience and I already know that Fiat of Huntsville has earned my future business. Drive down, it's worth your time.

David Evans graciously answered my questions over the phone and by email until I was ready to travel down from Nashville and make my purchase. Together, he and sales manager, Greg Melbo, made my purchase smooth, low pressure, and positive. I am not thoroughly enjoying my new car!

text: I came by honestly not expecting to make a purchase. Upon taking my new FIAT 500 out for a test drive I was hooked on the driving experience immediately. Just make sure to be clear with what you want up front since it makes the staff's job much easier. Financing department was an entirely different experience, unfortunately, and stops this review from being 5 stars. I highly suggest getting financing done ahead of time as they were misleading with me and outright told me they had tried going with my bank (they didn't according to my bank).

text: One of the best interactions we’ve had while purchasing a car.

name: James Bowman III
text:
Hello, my name is James L. Bowman III.  A few months ago I purchased a Toyota Prius for my daughter, from Fiat of Huntsville.  Approximately 2-3 days after purchasing the automobile, we noticed that the touch screen was not calibrated.  When attempting to turn on the A/C  via the touchscreen, the cursor would select another area of the screen (truly frustrating).  Additionally, when the lights were turned on, the taillights and the headlights would randomly be inoperable.  We noticed that the lights would be off, then on again.

Based on our limited experience with the automobile, my wife and I felt very unsafe with our daughter driving.

We went back to Fiat of Huntsville and discussed with a couple salespersons (Mr. Julian Boykin & the sales manager whose name I can’t remember) and the accounts manager (Mr. Don Alexandria).  These gentlemen worked with my wife and I to purchase a new vehicle while concurrently not taking a massive loss on the Toyota Prius.  I was shocked.  Often times, we hear horror stories about automobile purchases gone awry on social media but this was not the case with our transaction.  My wife and I are VERY grateful to Fiat of Huntsville for providing the customer service that facilitated purchasing my daughter a safer automobile.

Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. Glad to see we helped put your daughter in a safer car!

name: Frank Doluca
text: Went beyond limits

name: K. E.
text: It has taken me a few days to fully process my service experience on 5/7/21. I scheduled a service appt online for my Stelvio. I also checked the box for a loaner vehicle. I was scheduled for 4/27/21 for an oil change. Once I checked in I was told by Tom Williams, Manager, that I was not required to have any major services done on this visit but maybe the next time I would need to have my brake fluid flushed. I let him know that I would need a loaner vehicle. His response was, We don’t have any so Johnathan will take you to work. Once I picked up my truck and I was driving off I immediately noticed a different feel to my truck. I just thought it was different because they had done a tire rotation. A few days later I noticed a noise when I braked. It gradually got worse and louder. I called and spoke with Jonathan. I told him about my concerns. He told me it was probably a rock stuck between my rotors and that if it was the brakes my sensors would have let me know it and its probably just a rock but if I brought my truck first thing in the morning it would be a quick and easy fix. He told me they didn’t have any appts available and that they didn’t have any loaner cars for me to drive while they inspected my truck. When I arrived on 5/7 Jonathan stated you are gonna have to leave the truck with us you need new brakes and rotors. I asked why and he said you are metal to metal. So that’s when I immediately started asking what happened when I brought my truck last week, he apologized said the tech just didn’t catch it. I asked what about my sensors, why didn’t they go off, he stated the sensors are on the inside and this was on the outside pad. None, of this was making sense to me. I asked him for a quote for the service to be completed and of course it was approx $700 with a 10% discount. I’m fuming inside by this time bc not only have you all inconvenienced me when I could have had this service done last week, but I was in danger and you lied on my vehicle’s multi point inspection, or maybe you didn’t even do an inspection at all, but now you’re gonna double charge me for labor. I asked him who is the service manager and he stated Tom was. I explained that every time I have come here you all have told me that you do not have loaner vehicles but the last time I was there(for my oil change) he told a customer on the phone “oh no worries we’ll put you in something when you get here and you’ll be on your way”. Johnathan replied, “Oh that was probably a Maserati owner and he’s gonna put them in a loaner Maserati”. I stated, “so you are telling me that you all hold certain customers to a higher standard because of the type of car they drive”. He stated they don’t have any loaners, and someone could drive me to work. I literally paced the parking lot in disbelief bc of the lower standard of service based on the brand name of the car I drove, the oversight of my right rear brake being completely gone and scrubbing metal to metal, and the fact that over half of the cost for me to have the service done was a charge for labor for some techs that clearly half do their job. People think that it’s a myth that women get mistreated when it comes to their vehicle service but I experienced it first hand. I could have chose to be an irate customer but because I am a black woman I chose to keep my feelings, emotions, and anger inside and take the poor customer service I received. However, I do have a choice in what type of car I drive and what type of customer service I feel I should receive. I was even just considering upgrading my car. I did not feel valued and I don't think they provide the same level of customer service across the board.

name: Sal Frenda
text: Outstanding selection of cars and knowledgeable sales staff

name: Jacob Busfield
text: Daniel should be your go to guy for all your Fiat 500L and 500x needs great guy 100% on his game took care of my mom very much appreciated drove from central Mississippi they are the only fiat dealer close with a selection of cars we were literally in and out in 2 hours future customer for sure

name: Michael Kidd
text:
I don’t often leave reviews, but in this case I definitely have to because it is so well deserved, by several people, at Birmingham Alfa Romeo.

I recently traded in my 2017 Alfa Romeo Gilulia for a 2020 Giulia. Definitely the best car buying experience I’ve ever had.  I was given a fair price for my trade, and the sales price of my new car was more than fair.

My salesman, Beau Beggs, made sure I completely understood every single item during the buying process.  He is very well versed in all aspects of the Alfa line, and took the time to ensure I understood the operation of all the new car’s systems.  From the time I walked in the door, until the time I drove away I never felt pressured or hurried in any way.  For the first time, buying a car was actually enjoyable.  Thanks Beau!!

Now I get to brag about the service department manager, Tom Williams.

About 800 miles later I was driving home from work when my sunroof blew out for no apparent reason.  Needless to say, it kind of freaked me out.  I called Tom while I was still on the interstate.  He didn’t avoid the problem, didn’t ask a bunch of questions, and even though it was late in the day, he didn’t suggest any other avenue to solve the problem other than to bring them the car.  Because the glass was still falling from the sunroof Tom sent a tow truck to pick up the car and ensured the driver wrapped the car to prevent any further damage.

When I arrived at Birmingham Alfa I found out that all the loaner vehicles were out.  That didn’t stop Tom from taking care of the situation.  He simply put me into a used car (another Alfa with only 2500 miles) until another Alfa loaner vehicle was available about a week later.  In the meantime, Tom communicated the issue with Alfa, and made sure they would take care of the problem, and of course they said they would.  I was told parts were on order, and Tom would stay in touch with me as repairs progressed, which Tom did because, well... He’s Tom and he’s the best.

When the sunroof blew out the glass hit the trunk and the spoiler, causing several paint chips.  I knew they would have to touch up the paint, and that the paintwork would cause the value of the car to depreciate, and talked to Tom about it.  I knew he would do whatever he could to remedy to problem.

What I DIDN’T expect was what happened next.

I received a call from Tom.  He had communicated the issue up the food chain, to include Alfa themselves.  The Alfa brand very, very rarely has any issues at all, and they were more than a little surprised to hear of this one.... and they definitely wanted to make things right.

Birmingham Alfa, due in no small part to Tom Williams’ leadership and superb customer service, replaced my car.  My brand new car.  With another brand new car.  No hassle, no hoops to jump through, no problems at all.  In a word:  Amazing.

So.... I say all that to say this;  If you are looking for a new vehicle (or even a used one) I cannot recommend a dealership more highly than Birmingham Alfa Romeo.  Go there, find Beau Beggs, buy something.  You will not be disappointed.  As a matter of fact you will be pleasantly surprised in the experience.

Sooner or later you’ll need that vehicle serviced.  When you do, take it to no one other than Tom Williams. There is no comparison.  I have never been so pleased in the caring customer service he has provided.  both on my 2017 Alfa that I traded in, and the new one I am currently enjoying.

I don’t know who actually owns Birmingham Alfa, but if you happen to be reading this I want you to know you’re doing something right.  Keep up the good work, and keep your good people like Tom and Beau.  People like them are what keep your customers  coming back.  I know I’ll be back, and I’ll keep recommending Birmingham Alfa to others.

Thank you Beau Beggs, Tom Williams, and Birmingham Alfa, for being the exception to the rule.

text: I bought a Tahoe from Cooks. I was told the vehicle had been through an inspection and was problem free other than a blemish on the rear door. I was told that they would pay for this blemish if I went and took it to a shop to be fixed. After purchasing, I noticed the vehicle rode rough and didn’t recognize it during the test drive. The following day I found out the front struts were bad. I called and notified cooks to which they said that it shouldn’t have made it through inspection like that, go take it to a shop to get a quote and we’ll fix it. The quote was $1,558.50. They then denied fixing it. After arguing back and forth they decided to give $200 towards the repair. Either their mechanics have no clue what they’re doing, or they just don’t care about selling “inspected” vehicles that have problems. Typical dealer with lies and a run around. Save your frustration and buy elsewhere.

name: Grant Howell
text: This morning (4/10/20) I spoke with a guy who I believe is named Ridgeway Berry about coming to look at a 35,000 dollar truck. I told him I was pre approved to buy it so there would be no issues getting the money. I’m from the Mobile area and told him that I had a 2.5 hour drive and wanted to make sure that he would hold it for me until I got there. He told me he would. He called me when I was 45 minutes away and informed me the truck was sold and the only thing he had to offer me was “I’m sorry”. I took off work and had a friend ride with me based on this guy’s word he gave to me. I waisted mine and a friend’s time, gas, and lost out on money from work because of this. In return I received an “I’m sorry.” I am putting this out there so others can avoid this issue if one of the salesmen tells them that they will hold a vehicle. I would hate for someone else to get this treatment. The bottom line is, if someone at a business gives you their word then they should hold up their end. This company did not do this today.

Great experience felt more like socializing with friends I had not seen in a long time than being a number. I realize it might be a little out of the way but well worth the drive. text: If your looking for a place to buy a quality used car then go by Suski’s. They are open and transparent about the cars they sell, while providing great customer service. I am very happy with my purchase.

Wonderful Christian and Freedom-honoring (yes, you can freely breathe here) auto sale company! They were very detailed in cleaning the minivan they sold me and also repaired a minor mechanical glitch in one of the seats that we noticed when looking at it.

I am glad to promote good businesses like this to my friends.

name: Rhonnia Bearden
text: Highly recommend Suskis for used cars! They don’t buy junk, have great prices, and the best customer service! Bob and Doug both are great to work with!!!

name: Max Eddy
text: Always honest and trustworrhy. This is the 2nd car we are buying from Suski's. They give each car a complete maintenance check and replace anything that is questionable.  Good deals too.

name: Linda C
text: I will never buy another car from Suski's, Bob sold me a 2008 Hybrid Toyota Camry in February of 2021,I had it for 3 months and it has stop running. I  was told that the car need a Battery Pack and that it would cost from 2000,to 4000 dollars to get the car fixed. I call Bob and told him what was going on and he told me he would get back with me, today is April 28 2021 and i haven't heard from Bob.

name: Derral Upton
text: Doug and his wife were VERY helpful and accommodating in getting me into a truck. They are honest and friendly. I would definitely buy another vehicle from them!

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Upton, thank you so much for sharing your experience!  We are thrilled that we were able to provide you with 5 star service here at Suski's Auto Sales.  Please let us know if we can help you with another in the future!

name: Boo Boo
text: Jen and Doug are absolutely amazing people who sell great quality cars. The thing that got me was all these great reviews and I had to leave mine. Long story short, I saw a car I really liked. Came to this page and read all these amazing reviews.... Test drove the car and it sold the next day. It was okay because Jen was sure to find me a great quality car instead of just selling me something they wanted to get rid of off the lot, like most dealerships do. I told her what kind of vehicle I was looking for and within the next week she brought back 2 vehicles for me to choose from........  So here's the kicker. I bought this used car "As is" That's no warranty nothing. My window was off track and wouldn't roll back up. I told Jen about it and Doug told me to bring it back up there that weekend and I did. They fixed it FREE of charge! They go above and beyond customer service. I had new tires, new floor mats, second set of keys( only because university kia gave me a single key to my vehicle) Sirius XM radio for 90 days. They didn't have to but they did. And believe me if I purchase another vehicle it will be with Suski's! Thank you guys and 💘 Love my new car!!

name: Max Tall
text: Purchased a Volkswagon CC for my daughter last week and she loves it!  Thanks for a great experience and car.  Really appreciate you standing by your quality cars.  Bob is a really friendly dealer and all around nice guy.  See you for our next car purchase.

name: Traci Ricketts
text: Bought my car here nice people very accommodating and willing to help us the best they could to get us a new car.

name: Parker Harless
text: I bought a 2010 Honda Accord about two months ago from here. Only issues I’ve had with it were a wheel bearing going out and getting sideswiped by a pickup truck. Great customer service.

name: Melissa Greer
text: Suski's is a great place to buy a quality used car. Over the years we have purchased three and have been very happy with all three.

name: Amber Pratt
text: Bought a 2009 nissian Altima and after having it for about 2 months, had to pay $1500 to get a new exhaust manifold and 3 motor mounts. That also included having to buy a new radio and speakers bc my car had one speaker :/. Granted I’ve never bought a car before and should’ve been able to tell I was being scammed but I would never recommend this place to anyone. Brother in law told me the other day he came to his place of business (an auto shop) and asked him to put saw dust in the engine they were working on to quiet it.

name: Vicki
text: I just purchased a car from Suski's this weekend. Very friendly, patient and helpful staff. My sister has bought a vehicle from them in the past few years as well. The easiest car purchase I have ever made.

text: Friendly and good communicator. The owner really made buying my car pain free and quick. The man does right by folks so far as I can tell. Hit market price and the vehicle has been running great. Waited a couple weeks to write a review.

text: The BEST customer service! It’s a very tight knit staff and it clearly shows - they truly care about their customers more than any other dealership I’ve ever seen. They truly go the extra mile!

text: These people are as crooked as the day is long. Had a family member buy a car from them and the engine failed within a year.

name: Breck Kelley
text: Bought an 09 Scion XD from Suski's a couple years ago.  It has been a great car with no issues. Fair price, free car fax provided.  Will look there first for my next car when my youngest turns 16.

name: Avg_Joe_VA _20
text: The owner was very nice and very helpful.

name: JANELDA Leduff
text: I bought my 2008 Nissan Altima from Suski’s in June/July 2018. When i first got it not even 3 days later it started making whinning noises. I called Bob (salesman) and let him know thats a sign of transmission issues. He was so smooth and seemed concerned and told me to bring the car back and theyll have it fixed at Smiths transmission in Athens. I was without a car for just about a month waiting and waiting on them to do whatever to the car. Now literally a year of having the car the transmission goes out! I called Suski’s auto to see what work was done on the car. He told me to call Smith’s transmission and they have NO RECORD OF EVEN HAVING MY CAR! So i called Suski’s back and relayed the information. Bob is who i spoke with told me its been a year and they do not keep receipts. At the end of the year they throw all if them away. So im screwed basically. They sold me a car they knew would only last LITERALLY a year. They acted like they would fix it and never did. So here i am 3 hours away from home stuck! If you are looking to be sold a lemon then Suski’s is the place to go!

name: Kasey
text: Love my “New to me” vehicle! Great folks, prices, and care at Suski’s!! I recommend to anyone I know that’s looking for a vehicle. I’ll be a return customer too, one day. ;)

name: Sandra White
text: My daughter just got her car about a week ago and already things going wrong. She bought a 2005 Nissan sentra and the ignition switch is faulty and needs replaced.  Having the whole car checked. Hopefully nothing else is wrong. I'm very disappointed.  This place was recommended to us. And the salesman was so smooth, telling me this was a great little car for my daughter. And already after one week having issues. Shame On YOU SUSKi's!!! Are you going to do the right thing and reimburse us for these immediate repairs only one week after car purchase???

name: Lesley Swanson

name: bryan Moore
text: Best customer service ever! Bob is the most knowledgeable and honest salesman I have ever met!

name: Doug Emerson
text: Great experience. We have bought several cars from Suski and have had great service from them all

name: Co Co
text: I have been in the market for a second vehicle for our household for over a year.  Finally, I had enough saved and found a reliable vehicle.  Each time I have inquired about a vehicle or performed a test drive, I worked with Bob.  Bob is pleasant and very knowledgeable, he is a straight shooter and does not pressure customers.  He always encouraged me to come back when I was ready.  This lot is known locally and their vehicles don't last long on the lot before they are purchased.  I test drove a vehicle after work Monday.  I returned Tuesday and had an inspection performed by my mechanic.  I paid full ask however, Suski did address both issues that arose from inspection, which is fair.  I have learned from past experiences, to never buy without a full inspection and Carfax! There are many dishonorable lots in the area.  Sushi's vehicles have clean titles, with a car fax, they make some repairs and many of the cars I test drove come with new tires.  The vehicles have all been trade ins from dealer lots that I have inspected and they are clean and appealing to drive.  You can tell Suski takes pride in the cars they sell.  I had a seamless buying experience and I will definitely consider them in the future.  I am the proud owner of a 2007 Honda Fit Sport aka "Mama's Wagon"

text: Had a great experience. I love my new car and Taylor was amazing! I have bad credit and she really helped me get into a nice car with $1200 down. I recommend going here and talking to Taylor. She will help you out! Thanks again and I will recommend you to everyone I know!

name: Mela Rogers
text: I have bought 2 vehicles from Joe's! In the future, I won't even bother with anyone else! They are so friendly and they have gone out of their way for us both times! The first time, 2016, we got there about 30-45 minutes before close and the never once made us feel rushed or like we were an inconvenience. 2 weeks ago we got there 25-30 minutes before they closed and I had already been crying because the last place we stopped had 35 minutes till close and he rudely told me to come back tomorrow because they had already put the keys up for the day. Keep in mind that I had no vehicle since mine broke down due to a design flaw, had just had surgery to remove my thyroid due to cancer and I work 55+ hours a week! So, I was stressed to my breaking point by the time we made it to Joe's! Once again, they were AMAZING!!! It was pouring rain and getting dark but, they never made us feel like we were a hassle! They stayed late for us and we got a great vehicle at an amazing price! I really love and appreciate these folks! I won't go anywhere else again!!!

resp.text: We appreciate your business Mrs. Rogers! Thank you for trusting us again with a 2nd vehicle! We hope you are enjoying that Ford and hope you get many, many miles out of it! Please don't hesitate to give us a call if you need anything! 256-887-1777

resp.text: Thank you so much Bethany! We appreciate your business!

name: Cynthia Cantrell
text: I can only give 1 star cause I have to to write a review. I wished I had researched them & read reviews before I bought a lemon from them. I've had the car 2 months & I'm already having to replace the motor. Joe's says they can't help cause of my contract. Fine, but what about the RIGHT thing? Saturday, I made my first payment & had it towed...all in the same day! Really?

resp.text: We understand your frustration, and we thank you for leaving an honest review. Unfortunately, once a car has been sold for such a period of time we are not able to cover damages because there is no way for us to monitor the car's upkeep or condition. We do our best to inspect everything we can on our vehicles, but some things are not able to be foreseen, especially with higher mileage vehicles; so, we adjust the price accordingly.            **Regardless, we apologize for your car's failure, and we hope you can understand our point of view as well. We invite everyone to research our reviews on Facebook and make informed decisions!**

name: andy collins
text: Clean, nice cars to choose from, and staff is friendly and helpful!  Won’t get a car from anywhere else in Cullman!

resp.text: Thanks Andy! We have appreciated you and your wife's continued support! We hope you are enjoying your Avenger!

text: Would recommend to anyone that needs a payment option that’s actually affordable

name: The H.O.G Channel
text: Please do business somewhere else. You will regret it. If you want a dependable car from honest people please go somewhere else. They buy $500 cars at auctions and don’t fix anything!! They are cold individuals!!

resp.text:
Thank you for your review, as it helps others make informed decisions. In that regard, we must clarify that it is always unfortunate when we are forced to uphold the terms of the contract. To be fair to all of our wonderful customers, however, we always will.

Although, we are unaware of any issues with the vehicle. If you could specify the issue, it will help us pinpoint the needed repair and possibly help ensure that it is in great shape for the next customer.

Again, thank you for your review and we shish you good luck.

name: Tom S
text: The female with dark hair and glasses driving the maroon Nissan altima with dealer tags today 4/27/16 down hwy31 from Decatur to cullman needs to be fired,  license revoked and or at the very least reprimanded before she kills someone.  No Lane control,  speeding,  tailgating,  aggressive driving and lane changing through traffic,  cutting people off all while texting is not only illegal and unsafe but driving in this manner isn't exactly what I would call good advertising.

resp.text: We completely agree that this driving behavior is unsafe; however, upon investigation of your review we have found only one vehicle matching your description, which was sold on 02/09/16. Every car we sell has a Joe's Auto Sales tag on the back. Thus, this was not an employee. It was the owner of the vehicle. If you have any questions, you are more than welcome to contact us directly at 256-566-0706 which we encourage you to do before you leave reviews such as this for any business.

text: Would never do business there again had a deal ended up having to folk out another 170 dollars and then on top of that key fob didn't work they said just dead battery but no out more money very unhappy

resp.text:
We are terribly sorry you are unsatisfied. You live in a completely different county and we are unable to collect that counties tax. That has to be done when you purchase your tag. Thats completely out of our hands.
They key fob didn't work when you bought the vehicle. And since we did come down on the overall price of the truck of well over $1500.00 (since we gave you an out the door price which included your state sales tax) we didn't offer to fix the key fob and you were fine with that. We are sorry your confusion and if you would like to discuss this further please feel free to give us a call.

name: Jordan Dumas
text:
This place is named the Best Auto Sales but it should be changed. I will never attempt to buy from here again, and no one else should either. I live in Montgomery, and drove here to find a car for a relative. We were told by Jimmy that he would update us on a particular car that we were interested in that was supposed to be coming in (which he also recommended to us). After driving around and wasting more than enough time here, we were told to come back another time, under the impression that the car we were promised we arrive and that he would let us know about. We needed this car ASAP, so of course we did. Days went by, and come to find out Jimmy had lied to us and told us that the car never arrived. However, it did and he wanted to either save the car for himself or for someone else. I will NEVER spend a dime here and I will continue to leave bad reviews. We ended up buying from a GREAT dealership in Montgomery (Jack Ingram Used Cars) and I recommend you all buy from the salesman Craig.

Also, don't quote this trying to call and 'work it out'. Don't ever contact me again.

name: Casey Thompson
text: They do have nice cars and a lot to choice from. The only issue I'v had with them is their pricing. I was looking at their 2007 Honda Fit with 79,000 miles, test drove it, ran great and really liked it. Kelly blue book valued this at $8,500-$9500. They wanted a ridiculous pricing of $12000 and wouldn't budge at all. Very over priced. King Honda offered a 2012 Honda fit for the exact same price. My credit is around 720 and my payments would have been $400 a month. With $3000 as a down payment, it would only go down to $301 and not including insurance. When I said I couldn't do that and Id have to look else where, they then offered a crazy warranty. Iv never heard of such a warranty, but apparently for $600 one time payment, as long as I owned the car, with $200 deductible Id have "free" maintenance. Sounds far fetched but if legit, its amazing. Over all, if you're very desperate and have awful credit and in need of a car on the spot, sure, but I think you could do better trying else where.

text: Bought a car from here, asked if there are any concerns we need to know about or anything wrong with the car. They told us nothing wrong with the car. He asked did you see the back of the car. We said yes....few minor scratches no big deal. We asked anything wrong with the car and again he said no. We asked the car looks good why are you selling so cheap. The response was because the got an over abundance of this brand of car in on the lot and they jus wanted to get them sold. Well long story short we drove it ran great seem there was no problem. Went home drove for almost an hour straight to shop had oil changed. Found out that the oil looks so bad in the car they found a oil leak. The windshield fluid container leaks ( no big deal, easy fix). Then two days later transmission went out. Now the car is on they way to a dealership to be FIXED! Famous saying buyers beware, we learned the hard way.

name: Sandar Johnson
text:
WORST CAR BUYING EXPERIENCE EVER. LONG REVIEW BUT A MUST READ REVIEW.

If i could give them 0 or even take stars i would. BEST auto sales? Ha more like worst. I bought a 2012 nissan altima from this establishment, 2 months later it blows a head gasket. IM NOT DENYING THE MOTOR RAN HOT, BUT THE TEMP GAUGE NEVER SHOWED THAT IT WAS. But why would you sell a car either knowing that it had mechanical issues, or without doing diagnostic tests (they either knew about the motor problems, or didnt care enough about their customers to see what was wrong with it when someone traded it in) After almost a week of going back and forth over whos responsible for repairs, we agreed that they would do the engine swap free of any labor charges if I paid for the motor. Once i was told repairs would begin shortly i called back frequently to get and update. Jimmy, a sales rep, told me time and time again, "it'll be ready this week." , "give it till wesnedsay", "ill call back today to give you an update" well jimmy never did, the ONLY updates i ever got were given after i called them repeatedly, or drove across town to go in the office. Well after about 3 and a half weeks being jerked around and told itll be done soon, i went to the office on a day that jimmy happened to be off. After talking to a member of management he informed me they had just started on repairs 2 days ago and it wouldnt be done for a week or so. FYI i was in the middle of a move to FL and stayed in a hotel and rented a car during this time frame which totalled around 2 grand. The car also had a good bit of my own personal property in it. So i decided to go ahead and move to FL, still waiting for my car to be repaired. After a little over a week they call and tell me the car is fixed and ready to be pucked up. So i drive the 4 hours back to auburn, had my bank refinance the car, and had a check for $9400 in my pocket ready to pay them off. When i test drove the car, i could hear a rattling sound from underneath the dash that was at its worst while idling at stops, and when i get back and ask about it they had me pop the hood while they fiddled around with the car (changing gears, accelerating, etc) and i see the motor itself moving, back and forth when he would change gears (its an auto trans but you can slide the shifter over and keep it in a certain gear). So i tell jimmy that he needs to figure out what that sound is being caused by and i want to hear from him the next day. Well good ole jimmy did what he does best and didnt call back. And after a few days of not hearing from them i figured it was time to move on. So i come by today to get all my stuff that was in the car......and its all gone, things of monitary and emotional value. Not only did they throw away all my stuff without a  call, now theyre telling me its going on paper as a repo. HAHAHAHA yeah right they can expect a call from my lawyers here soon. They are THE MOST CROOKED BUSINESS I HAVE EVER HAD THE DISPLEASURE OF DEALING WITH, IVE GOTTEN BETTER CUSTOMER SERVICE AT MCDONALD'S. AND I HAVE NEVER FELT SO CHEATED, DISRESPECTED, AND LIED TO IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. They will sell you a lemon (POS) and then screw you over when it brakes down. They take advantage of people with poor credit, give them outrageous monthly payments (was responsible for 300 a month on an altima and only 70 of that went to my principal), then repo the car as soon as they can.

SAVE YOURSELF A HEADACHE AND DRIVE RIGHT PASSED "BEST" AUTO SALES. DONT EVEN CONSIDER DOING BUSINESS WITH THEM. IF YOU READ THIS AND STILL GIVE THEM YOUR BUSINESS YOURE JUST AS STUPID AS THEY ARE.

text:
My wife and I went to MobilityWorks a few weeks ago to find this well taken care of by it's first and only owner that traded it in but my point is this used van had been well maintained and this dealership made us this wonderful offer that we couldn't refuse.

We're well pleased by the way Chris and Allen had the few repairs taken care of. They were wonderful.

All we can tell anybody looking and needing a really good used or new handicap van go by and talk with 2 nice guys Chris and Allen. We'll sure you'll be as pleased with your sale and any repairs needed there.

resp.text: Ronald, we take customer satisfaction very seriously. We’d like to get in contact with you personally to get more details about your review. Please provide your contact info at https://www.mobilityworks.com/review/ so that our Regional Manager can reach out. Thank you.

name: Herbert Smith
text: If you lease from here and your love one past away, in order to break the lease they want you to pay the lease out. Which don't make sense, because you will turn in the vehicle and pay the lease out so the can lease it out to someone else. Getting me some legal representation to handle this. This is how much they like disabled veterans., who lost a child.

resp.text: Herbert we are sorry for what you are going through. We've sent this review to our Regional Manager and he will be contacting you.

name: ALLEN WILLIAMS
text: I work at Mobility Works.  We help people in wheelchairs gain their independence

name: John Hollock
text: Chris Wathey and Willy Moulin both did an outstanding job of guiding us through the process of getting our Braunability van through the VA. We truly appreciate all the hard work and tenacity they showed while going through all the steps with VA. We love our new Pacifica van!

name: SFES PTA
text:
As a Special Needs parent, having a company that promises you reliability and great customer service is VERY important.
I feel as if I was taken advantage of. There has always been minor problems that should have been fixed and they never found time to fix things when I lived 4hrs away and was in the area. I call and email  to ask questions, and never get a response in time. I have asked repeatedly to get a quote on my van to sell back and they don’t even have the decency to call or email me back.
I would suggest BraunAbility, they seem to have better customer service from what I found out from other special needs families.

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear that you were unsatisfied with your recent visit to our Birmingham location. If you could please email us your contact information we will have our Regional Manager reach out to you. You can email us at ask@mobilityworks.com. Thank you.

name: milehigh34200
text:
First of all this in not a dealership, they are resellers.  All they do is buy cars at auction at wholesale and sell at retail, they clean them up and make them look shiny and pretty.
Because they know that most people don't know much about the mechanics of cars and buy on sight only. It's a numbers game,  some will buy, and some will walk away. That's why it says sold as is on the window of the car.
I walked away after I took the car offsite and did a careful inspection and found doors misaligned on one side, a none working headlight and other defects.  I was told it had a clear title, but had clear evidence of an accident.

text: My sister and I both bought what seemed to be pretty decent cars from this place.. until the next day. My sister paid $4000 for a Nissan Altima which drove fine for a day then we found out the battery terminals were corroded which we changed and then all was well with her car. I got a Honda CR-V that was selling for $6000 and we traded my fiancé’s bmw for only $2000 even though it drove fine. Aside from that the seller was saying the car drove fine and didn’t mention anything being wrong with it. We had this car for a week before everything fell apart. WE HAVE HAD TO GET A NEW BATTERY,STARTER,ALTERNATOR,AND BELT. Needless to say I was not expecting to have to pay for all that work after just spending $4000 and trading a pretty decent bmw. This dealer also had us come back to sign a paper because they forgot it, then asked me to leave them a good review FOR A BROKEN CAR. Do not buy from these people, they as don’t care about any concerns you have with the car after they sell it.

name: Aleena Bennett
text:
I am sad to do this, but I have to edit my original glowing review. The guys here are very friendly. They treat you well when you go to buy the car. But I would absolutely recommend getting any car in this lot inspected by an independent mechanic before purchasing. We have already had to put $1,700 into the car we bought 3 days ago, just to make it safe to drive. I called Tennessee Wholesale Autos about this and was basically told I overpaid for the services to repair the car. So far we had to get the tires aligned, get new tires (because the ones they put on wore out from misalignment), get a full brake job, resurface rotors, change the lock mechanism because it was broken and we didn’t have a key to the door, change two filters, and a broken intake hose. More details below.

We were sold a car with low mileage and told it was in “perfect condition mechanically”. It was inspected by their mechanic. I drove 200 miles one way to look at the car. The test drive was fine. The car was not as nice on the inside, but I was fine with that. There were a few little things missing (spare tire, plastic light covers, lock buttons, etc.). I assumed the low price was due to the missing things and the quality of the interior not being great. As I was signing paperwork to buy the car I was told that the key to the car only started the ignition and couldn’t lock the doors. That I needed to go to the Honda dealership so they could cut a key to the door. This should have been a red flag that everything wasn’t on the up and up. But I was naive and bought the car. On the drive home I noticed issues with steering and could tell the car was out of alignment. The next day I took it to Honda for a key and found out that not only was the lock mechanism broken, but they there were several other problems that needed IMMEDIATE attention. I took it to another mechanic for their opinion, they agreed and fixed everything for less.

I will say the car operates fine now, but I want to warn people to get the car inspected, or be prepared to put some money into the car immediately.

text: Set up an appointment to view a car I was very interested in and showed up at appointed time with cash in hand ready to purchase. Gentleman in the office called the salesperson I had an appointment with and informed me that he was on his way to the dealership and would be there with the car within the hour.  Suggested I go “shopping” for a while and come back later.  Left and came back approximately 2 hours later.  Still no car and no salesman.  Don’t waste your time on these unprofessional crooks.  I’ll take my cash and purchase from a REAL dealership that’s interested in actually selling cars instead of wasting your time.

name: Jesse Chappell
text:
The vehicle I bought was not in Excellent condition as it was listed. There were some small paint chips, one of the windows tint is coming loose and the front passenger tire has been scuffed. They didn't have a vehicle report printed when I got to the lot. But they did email me one during the test drive process.

I bought a car on July 12. The car was missing a part. I was told it's not an expensive part it's been ordered and should be here in a couple of days.

I did a test drive in the morning and returned to purchase the car later in the day. While completing the paperwork, I was told their internet is down. Employee said, "I am going to buy a new router, I'll email you your Title Application today when I get back." I did not receive an email.

I emailed the owner Josh updating him and explained I would be there on the 16th to pick up my Title Application. I mentioned the replacement part for the vehicle, stating what I was told by the salesman. In my email correspondence.

I did not hear anything from the dealership.

On July 23rd I send Josh an email in the morning, updating him explaining that I picked up my paperwork and no one has contacted me about the vehicle part.
Before end of business on the 23rd I called the dealership. They have two phone numbers listed. One number has a full voice mailbox and can not receive messages. I left a message on the second phone number.

No one called me back.

On July 27th, I called and spoke with an employee. I updated him on my status and he told me, he would look into it and give me a call. Today has been 15 days since I bought the car on July 12th, and still no update regarding the missing part I was told had been ordered.

I like Corey and have gotten a good impression from him. The issues I have experienced don't seem to be with him but rather elsewhere up the chain. If they have a vehicle you are interested in check them out. I will update this posting as needed.

name: Steven Mccornack
text:
This has been THE most positive experience I've EVER had with a Porsche dealership.  I had my 1985 911 Targa shipped out to Birmingham from Oregon this past May.  The car has been in my family since new - purchased in January 1986 - and is all-original.  But it had been in storage at my folks' place for several years.  Not only did the folks at Birmingham Porsche help me coordinate shipping delivery straight to their service department, but they immediately got the car in and did a full PPI on it, and produced a detailed report of everything that needs to be done.  Throughout the process, they gave me multiple different recommended options, and were consistently friendly, courteous, and kind.  For instance, the engine is due for a rebuild.  But I just can't financially swing it right now.  Instead of ANY hint of judgment or pushiness, they were completely understanding, and were like, "Don't worry AT ALL - just bring it back in when you're ready!"  :-)  In particular, Rodney and Tracy went out of their way to take phenomenal care of me and my car - treating me throughout as if I was a millionaire owner of a new 918 rather than a UAB Professor with an old 911.  I cannot begin to tell you how much it means to me to have guys who truly LOVE these cars - and are dedicated to taking meticulous care of them - right here in town.  They will be the ONLY ones who handle my "baby" from now on.  You can trust your beloved Porsches to them as well!

REVIEW #2:  For some jank reason, Google won't allow you to post MULTIPLE reviews, even if you have multiple EXPERIENCES to share, so I'm doing it this way.  I was driving my 911 around town, and started feeling my right heel slip on my floormat.  If you're an old-school Porsche owner, you immediately know that this can only mean ONE thing: master brake cylinder.  :-(   Sure enough, got home, put my hand on the mat, and it came up shiny and wet.  SAD FACE.  Immediately took it to Porsche Birmingham.  Figured they wouldn't be able to get to it for days, but instead they had it checked out within 24 hours, even though I (obviously) hadn't created an appointment in advance.  Two days later a new master cylinder had been installed.  When I picked up my baby, I was STUNNED to see that the floormat had been STEAM-CLEANED - along with the PASSENGER one as well.  They even DRIED them, prior to my pickup!  It's the little things, people, that speak to quality in service.  When asked about it, both Rodney and Tracy were like, "We didn't want your mats to be soiled!"  Exactly: thoughtful, considerate, and meticulous.  A++ Folks.

name: Merle Wade
text: Excellent experience all around.  I loved the relaxed vibe.  Everyone was professional.  Lee Goodson was excellent, 5 stars to him.  I never felt any pressure to buy or make any unnecessary changes.  He was always available by phone or email.  He made very helpful suggestions when it came to the purchase.  I also went back to the dealership recently due to a nail in the tire and it was the best service experience I have ever had.  Highly recommended.

resp.text: Brenton Boozer, thanks for your praise and kind comments about our team. We're looking forward to your next visit with us!

name: Sarah Howard
text: Chuck Gardner did an outstanding job finding a great vehicle for us at a great price!  I was actually sitting on the beach when he orchestrated our deal on a Lexus!  When we arrived to look at the vehicle it was everything he had told us!  Chuck had every detail worked out!  Quick, easy, seamless transaction!

resp.text: Sarah Howard, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and it is great to see you had such a positive experience at Porsche Birmingham. We sincerely thank you for the positive review, and look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Frankie Sarris
text: Excellent Customer Service.  Tracy and Rodney did an excellent job working me in for the repair.

resp.text: Hi there, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us. We're happy we could meet your expectations! We sincerely thank you for the positive review, and look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Ingram Worley
text: Chuck was a huge help.  Found the exact vehicle I was looking for- arranged a test drive, was in and out in less than an hour and Chuck even brought the final paperwork to my house so I wouldn't have to bring my 2-year old to the dealership.  Great experience, highly recommend!

resp.text: Ingram Worley, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and it is great to see you had such a positive experience at Porsche Birmingham. Please don't hesitate to reach out if there's anything additional we can do for you.

name: David Tritt
text: Great experience in purchasing a used Cayman. Great car and very fair price .

resp.text: Hi there, thanks for your praise and kind comments about our team. If you ever need anything else from us, please feel free to give us a call or stop by. Have an awesome day!

name: Miles Cobia
text: I've never had an easier experience making a major purchase in my life. From research to discussions about alternatives to price comparison to shipping, Michael Freeman not only made this an effortless process, I also felt I learned a great deal and he truly was looking out for me regardless of whether I bought from him or not. This is the type of service I expect when buying a premium car. I'm not looking for a car salesman. I'm looking for a consultant to discuss my options within my budget. That's what I got with Porsche Birmingham, specifically Michael Freeman. I will be going back to this dealership for my next car, without question.

resp.text: Miles Cobia, we're happy you found our staff to be so supportive during your experience here at Porsche Birmingham. Please don't hesitate to reach out to us if there's anything more we can do!

name: Chris Morales
text: Their service department folks are great. Friendly thorough and professional. Unfortunately the same can’t be said for the sales people. I have bought three Porsches in the last three years I’ve always gone to Birmingham first and never bought a car from them. Two of the cars came from Porsche Chattanooga and the other Porsche of North Houston. Every time I encounter sales people at this dealership I feel like they can’t be bothered. This last time the sales person was pretty rude actually mumbling under his breath and not taking me seriously buyer. So instead of buying the Bentley they had, I just bought a jaguar off of Carvana today. I honestly cannot see myself ever buying a car from this dealership. Their inventory is always really low and  I’m not willing spend my money somewhere they act like the customer is a nuisance. I would not have written a review but they are three for three, and it was a different sales person every single time. I do not know whether or not their attitude is because I am young or they treat everyone this way. I recommend Chattanooga or really any other Porsche dealer.

resp.text: We are very sorry to hear that the experience you had during your visit did not meet the exceptional experience that we set out to deliver. The management team here at the store would love the opportunity to speak to you directly to see how we can better serve you for any future needs. Please reach out at your convenience to 205-397-2700

name: Stroud Williams
text: After years of buying used Porsches, I just pulled the trigger on my first vehicle purchase from Porsche Birmingham, A Sonic Automotive dealership.  My experience with the service department had always been excellent and my new experience with the Sales Team was exceptional.  Michael Freeman efficiently worked all aspects of the purchase. Awesome salesman and awesome dealership!! #lovemyporschecayenne

resp.text: Stroud Williams, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and it is great to see you had such a positive experience at Porsche Birmingham. We sincerely thank you for the positive review, and look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Z Girl
text: I just purchased a "new to me" 2017 vehicle at this dealership and let me tell you..... my experience was absolutely amazing!!!!!  I could not have asked for a smoother transaction.   I had the vehicle in transport from this dealer all the way to Boise, Idaho.    And it was absolutely seamless.   The communication I received at this dealership is one you dream about. I wish all corporations,  businesses had this level of customer care.   Thank you Porsche Birmingham!!!!

name: Brittany Hudgens
text: Excellent inventory and outstanding customer service! Michael Freeman went out of his way to help my dad and I buy a Certified Pre-Owned Macan. We certainly didn't make it easy for him because I'm in school in Virginia and my dad works full-time in Birmingham. My dad and I are very impressed with Michael's composure and communication with joint buyers in different states. On the day of purchase, I called about an online listing before any pictures were posted, but Michael took the time to text pictures directly to me. Even though Birmingham was experiencing severe weather, Michael was patient as my parents made their way to the dealership. He was extremely knowledgeable and answered all of my parents' questions. Despite the nasty weather and distance between joint buyers, Michael orchestrated the sale on the same day as my initial call! He overnighted paperwork to me and kept me up to date. Michael is passionate about Porsche and customer service. I couldn't be more grateful that he was our salesman!! The Macan is gorgeous, in excellent condition, and drives like a dream!! Thank you, Michael Freeman and Tom Williams Porsche!!

resp.text: Brittany Hudgens, we strive for 100% satisfaction, and it is great to see you had such a positive experience at Porsche Birmingham. If there's anything further we can do for you, we are happy to help! Thank you and have a wonderful day!

name: brad young
text: Had a great experience with this dealer. Michael Freeman was our rep and always took my call and gave us quick answers to questions we needed to make the decision to buy our 2020 Macan.  When we came to pick up the car Had been detailed and looked amazing.

resp.text: Hi Brad Young, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at Porsche Birmingham. We're happy we could meet your expectations! Please don't hesitate to reach out if there's anything additional we can do for you.

name: Ronda Parsons
text: We are so impressed with the service department at Porsche Birmingham! They went above and beyond to figure out the issue with our car and fix it!! We'll definitely buy from them again!! 5 stars!!!!

resp.text: Ronda Parsons, we're glad you had such a wonderful experience with us! Please don't hesitate to reach out if there's anything additional we can do for you.

name: Scarlett Canedy
text: My husband and I bought a 2017 Camry XLE from Chuck Gardner! He went above and beyond in making car buying a pleasant experience! My husband called Chuck about the Camry and Chuck went and got the car! He took multiple pictures and sent them to us! When we got to the dealership Chuck had everything ready! We drove the car and signed the paper! Truly the easiest car buying experience ever!

name: kwayne jones
text: I saw the listing on Thursday, touched bases that day, talked to Greg who gave me the rundown. Michael Freeman called me back later that day, I asked him if the car had certain things, he took the time to walk out to the car & check everything I asked, I told him I was coming from MS to Birmingham on Saturday. He was waiting when I got there, the customer service was exemplary, cudos guys well done. I was headed back to MS in my new car within an hour. Very pleased!!

resp.text: Kwayne Jones, we're glad you had such a wonderful experience with us! Our team strives to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out!

name: D C
text: Terrible Customer Service, Poor follow up,They are a buy now or We dont care dealership.I was so shocked.It was better under other management. I purchased my vehicle from Mercedes. I promise you people that I am not lying ! Go to Mercedes over 459 or Anywhere for better Customer Service....This is a Real review; Not an emotional or angry review...

name: A. Corbett
text: I have purchased 3 vehicles from Porsche Birmingham and every experience has been super! Friendly staff, wonderful service department, always been greatly taken care of! Chuck and Tracy have always been very nice and helpful!

name: S G
text: Great service...very friendly and professional! You can always count on Chuck to go the extra mile!

resp.text: S G, thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review! Our team strives to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out!

name: Drew Ramsey
text:
My scheduled maintenance visit was outstanding! From the time I arrived to the time I left Cesar was very approachable and interested in the concerns I had with my Porsche. All of my issues and concerns were addressed under the CPO and while my car was in the shop for a week I was provided with a new 992 as a loaner vehicle! When I picked up my vehicle it had been washed and vacuumed and all issues were resolved to my complete satisfaction .

Thank you Cesar! Best experience yet!

name: kristina carr
text: Satisfied with my purchase

resp.text: Hi Kristina Carr, thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us at Porsche Birmingham. We're happy we could meet your expectations! We do hope we can be of assistance in the future. Take care!

name: Drew Ramsey
text:
My scheduled maintenance visit was outstanding! From the time I arrived to the time I left Cesar was very approachable and interested in the concerns I had with my Porsche.
