name: Mark Bria
text:
I had to have my AC Condenser replaced after only 57k miles. Apparently this is a widely known problem with GM vehicles and a $1000+ repair cost to the owner that should be covered under a recall or part warranty because of the shear number of failures. Just look it up it is not hard to find. If it were a safety issue it would already be covered.

I will say that the service writer did everything that he could to get my vehicle back to me the same day and was apologetic of the fact that the local dealership has seen a huge number of these repairs. He even went as far as check to see if my 2016 Yukon may be covered with some discount related to the same failure but it appears that GM thinks that it is OK for a part to fail at 60k miles but not at 61k miles.

Dealers should be doing more to convince corporate GM to protect their potential customer base. Someone paying as much as I have for 2 GM vehicles should not be hit with the repair cost for a well documented part failure that continued to be used even AFTER it was identified. GM needs to do the right thing if they want to have my continued business.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback and thank you for your business. We appreciate your business and we are looking forward to GM to properly address your concerns.

So they tell me they do not put fluids in the car but windshield wiper fluid so I stated to them it is no windshield wiper fluid nor oil in my truck. What a sneaky place I would never go back again.

text: Charged $96 for an oil change on a 2014 Silverado, we have 23 fleet vehicles and have never paid that much for an oil change. We have a bunch of vehicles in the area for the Amazon project and will not be taking them here. Average is $65 for most of our trucks that get regular oil changes across the US.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave Premiere Chevrolet a review. We make every attempt to be competitive within the marketplace. Our recommended oil change consists of fully synthetic oil, the required filter and an engine oil treatment. The fully synthetic oil reduces the number of number oil change visits allowing you to drive up to 7,500 miles between oil changes. The oil treatment includes an oil additive that helps clean sludge buildup and deposits, helps prevent oil breakdown, reduces engine wear, increases fuel economy and extends your warranty coverage when serviced at the proper intervals. However, we do offer a non-synthetic conventional oil service for under the national average for $59. We appreciate your business and we will continue to strive to provide you with the best customer service. I would like to talk to you personally to address your concern. Please call Bill Whitehead, partner/owner at 205.424.4121.

name: Angela Jones
text:
DO NOT use McKelvey Chevrolet for any car repairs. Took my Cadillac in on Wed. Dec.5 for a oil leak, $1000 later I pick it up on Sat. Dec. 9. Only to take it back on Wed. Dec. 13 cause it was still leaking oil worse than when I took it in. Picked it back up late in the evening on the Thurs. Dec. 14th. Well on the Wed. Dec. 27 the motor starts making a knocking noise, I get the owner cell phone number cause its after hours to have him tow it in. It had no oil in it. He tells me he can't get it tonight leave it at Freds he would get it in the morning. I called on the Thurs. Dec. 28th to use a loaner car again to be told one wasn't available. He called on Fri Dec 29 but I was at work & couldn't answer. So I called back on Jan. 2 cause they were closed for the hoilday & was told it's the lifters & they could do a oil change w an additive ($65) to see if it would help but the car was still driveable. He questioned the amount of miles on the car for the month, not sure what that has to do with anything.  So I pick it up about 4:20pm on Tues. Jan 2, motor is skipping as we are waiting to get on 280. I get less than 5 miles & it cuts off. We think timing belt broke, when my fiance asked them earlier that day had they checked the timing, he said it cranks & runs to smooth to be the timing. I called them to come tow it back in again. So I don't hear anything from them Jan 3-5. So my fiance calls at 4pm on Fri Jan 5 (mind you the owner had been calling w updates) only to be told the owner had left for the day & to call back on Mon cause he was now handling my car. So I call today Mon. Jan 8th (they had it now the 3rd-8th) at 9:30am for an update to be told you need a motor. Not sure why he wasn't contacting me to let me know that it needed a motor other than avoiding/putting me off cause they aren't really sure what's wrong with my car. I'm guessing no one there is qualified to figure it out. I've been borrowing cars to have a way to get to work. Didn't have a car today, so I tell him that & how poor the customer service has been. They have had my car 20 days total from Dec. 5 & even today I was told he had no loaner available but his employees drive the cars on the lot all the time. He tells me let's not worry about a loaner car let's worry about getting yours running. Were talking another $3,000-$4,000. Umm NO, I will not give you another dollar of mine. I will give my money to someone who appreciates my business & will not leave me stranded.  In closing I've never had any issues with this car, never had to add 1 ounce of oil between changes the problems started when I took it to McKelvey Chevrolet for the oil leak to be fixed.

I know someone else that was getting oil changes there & they weren't changing the filters but charging for them. He marked his filter so he would know if it was getting changed & it wasnt.

name: Joe jones
text: Best services for disability helps Center in North Alabama. We got our van little over a year ago. And they treated us like family and still do anytime we need them. Super fair prices also. I highly recommend them to anyone.

name: Gerrelyne Burnette
text: My family and I have had to experience some health challenges that we never imagined before 6/5/2019. I went into MobilityWorks to inquire about a rental to take my sister who has been mobility challenged since her stroke in 2019 to her party. Tiana Garner went above and beyond customer service. She shared helpful information on A gentleman that had a vehicle to donate that is fully equipped to accommodate transporting my sister. Tiana Garner is a professional that takes her career to heart. In business it’s not about just what you specialize in it is about helping where you can. And that is what she did. God used her to meet a need for a family that wants to make sure their  loved one does not miss her surprise birthday party. Thank you Tiana Garner.

name: Bea Godbee
text: Great sales person. Still waiting for the van we bought 4 days ago to be delivered. Hope it gets here the first part of this coming week! Can hardly wait for our wheelchair accessible van with ramp. Open roads, here we come! <3

name: NoneofYour Business
text: The Store Manager is a liar and a thief.  She encourages her employees to lie to customers and tell them they need things on their cars that they don't.  She never returns phones calls (or maybe she is never really there most of the time).  This location is much more interested in ways to get your money than it is taking care of its customers.  Find someone else that is honest and more customer service oriented than this place to take your equipment to!  I can't believe this place is still in business and that they haven't had sense enough to get rid of that awful fake-a$$ manager they have.

resp.text: NoneofYourBusiness, We take customer satisfaction very seriously. We’d like to get in contact with you personally to get more details about your experience with our Huntsville location. Please provide your contact info at https://www.mobilityworks.com/review/ so that our Regional Manager can reach out. Thank you.

name: Maxi Kaylin
text: The people were so nice.  They had to order a part so I knew it would take longer. But the wrong part was sent so they had to reorder. MobilityWorks called and apologized for the delay.  They seem to want to satisfy their customers.

name: Gilbert Jones
text: Being a two time "Vietnam Veteran and after a very major auto dealership in my local area blew me off on a purchase of a vehicle to accommodate  me and my handicap scooter, however, they did do something right when I was referred by their employee to "MOBILITY WORKS!" Scott came to my house in a vehicle which pleased me greatly and between him and Melissa, a way was made shortly thereafter to purchase this vehicle.  Thanks to my "God" first and foremost because He alone made it possible for Scott and Melissa to do what they did to accommodate my needs! PTL

name: Karen BlueBaird
text: Very knowledgeable and friendly business. Repaired my wheelchair van while I waited.

name: Josh LyBrand
text: Mobility Works helped us find exactly what we were looking for!  Scott Grabner is the absolute best and made sure everything was absolutely perfect!  Go see him!

name: Londi Foster
text: Scott Grabner was our salesman and this was the best experience we've had with any sales staff.   Very knowledgable and efficient. More importantly, not the aggressive pitch we have frequently experienced. Walked us through the entire process over several days. Melissa was equally proficient and helpfull with the extensive signoff paperwork. Highly recommend this firm.

name: James McComb
text: Great people to work with. They have always accommodated my needs for a van.

name: Cyndy Akin
text: This is a great company!

name: Ben Tipton
text: Great service

name: sandra whorton
text: Very nice people
